Automation is a very interesting area where I think we will see a rapid development in the future. Working here at PostNord with its history and as a company that so many people can relate to is both challenging and important. I really can´t imagine a more exciting and developing job."
PostNord offers communications and logistics solutions to, from and within the Nordic region. With our expertise and a unique distribution network, we are developing the basis for tomorrow’s communication, e-commerce, distribution and logistics.

  

  

**Accountable** 


We see the bigger picture and take ownership to continuously improve our business and systematically share best practices.
**Brave ❤**


By challenging current situations, we can prioritize effectively and focus on the things that matter the most. We lead a business that is in constant change.
**Committed** 


It is important that we listen, pursuing development and asking each other for feedback. Together we create an inclusive workplace where our people can thrive.
company_description: Ledande leverantören av kommunikation och logistiklösningar till, från och inom Norden. Genom vår expertis och ett starkt distributionsnät.

title: UX-Designer
description:
**Brinner du för användarens upplevelse, och vill bidra till att bygga ett smartare och mer robust samhälle? Sök rollen som UX-Designer på Combitech i Växjö!**

**Vad vi erbjuder**
-------------------


På Combitech satsar vi på våra medarbetare, de utgör kärnan, hjärnan och hjärtat i vår verksamhet. Det gör vi till exempel genom att satsa på din kompetensutveckling, göra det lätt för dig att kombinera jobbet med vardagen och andra schysta förmåner. Dessutom står vi på en stadig grund av högteknologi, forskning och anställningstrygghet med försvars- och säkerhetskoncernen Saab som ägare.


Vi erbjuder en roll i ett långsiktigt och expansivt uppdrag som har en lång historia på Combitech. Du blir en del av en organisation som idag sysselsätter ca 40 personer och som kännetecknas av ett nära samarbete och ett flexibelt och agilt arbetssätt. Här ges möjlighet till flexibla arbetstider, kontinuerlig kompetensutveckling och utrymme för eget ansvar.

**Vad rollen innebär**
----------------------


I rollen som UX-designer verkar du för att användarens upplevelse blir den bästa möjliga för de produkter som utvecklas. Du tar fram skisser och prototyper för nya och befintliga produkter tillsammans med produktägare, kravställare och användare. Du ansvarar för att ta fram riktlinjer för våra olika produkters gränssnitt och har en kontinuerlig dialog kring UX och användargränssnitt med våra utvecklingsteam.


Som UX-designer arbetar du nära våra produktägare och utvecklingsteam. Användarupplevelsen kommer att vara ditt fokus för både nya och äldre produkter.

**Vad vi söker**
----------------


Vi söker dig som brinner för att förstå användarens behov och omsätta dessa till enkla och tydliga gränssnitt. Att ta ansvar, se till helheten och att vara den centrala punkten kring UX-arbetet är naturligt för dig. Som person tror vi att du är en kommunikativ och ödmjuk lagspelare som gillar att dela med dig av dina kunskaper. Du har en god teknisk förståelse, gillar kreativitet samt har en känsla för färg och form.


Slutligen letar vi efter dig som har flera års erfarenhet som UX designer och har jobbat brett inom UX med både research och design. Vi tror att du har en relevant universitets eller högskoleutbildning inom området och behärskar svenska i tal och skrift.

 **Då tjänsten innebär arbete som omfattas av försvarssekretess krävs det att du genomför och godkänns i en säkerhetsprövning med registerkontroll.**

**Urval sker löpande. Vi ser fram emot din ansökan!**


Kontaktperson/rekryterande chef: rebecka.falk@combitech.com

title: Head of UX Design
description:
At Hive Streaming, we enable the world’s largest enterprises to use live video as a strategic tool for communication, alignment, and impact. Trusted by more than 130 global customers, Hive combines market-leading video distribution technology with unique communication analytics, helping organizations ensure flawless video experiences and measure how effectively messages reach, engage, and align employees.


Our users are IT and Network professionals who rely on Hive every day to ensure flawless video delivery, Event Producers who ensure optimal video experience during internal company events, Leaders and Communications professionals who plan and execute powerful video-enabled strategies to deliver measurable impact.

#### **About the team**

  

As Head of UX Design, you are part of Hive’s Product organization, reporting to the CPO, and lead the UX Design team. You represent the UX Design craft in the Product Development Leadership trio, next to the CPO and CTO.


Your mission is to shape and drive execution of a clear user experience vision that ensures our products are customer-centric, intuitive, and impactful. You will influence our product portfolio evolution, co-creating remarkable solutions, coaching a high-performing UX Design team and creating a culture of experimentation and continuous learning.

### **About the role**

* You define and champion a clear user experience vision for the Hive product portfolio based on customer outcomes, in alignment to Hive’s product strategy.
* You lead the UX Design team to deliver on a long-term vision and continuously advance the UX Design craft in the company. You spearhead design initiatives with strategic impact and UX Design ops workstreams.
* You lead by example through hands-on design contributions when needed, supporting and elevating the team’s work by applying your craft directly, demonstrating best practices, and acting as a force multiplier for design quality.
* You help advance customer-centric, outcome-driven continuous discovery & delivery practices as a member of the Product Development Leadership trio.
* You collaborate across functions, inspire your peers and company management to enable remarkable UX solutions you’ve helped co-create.
* You grow and mentor the UX Design team, fostering psychological safety, growth, and continuous feedback.
* You lead and structure the UX Design function for resilient, ongoing impact delivery. You work with your peers to anticipate where the business, industry, and UX design practice are going and evolve the UX vision and team structure accordingly.

### **Who we are looking for**


 We're looking for someone with a strong UX Design foundation in B2B enterprise products - but just as importantly, the right attitude. At Hive, how you work is just as valuable as what you know. We are looking for someone with the following:

  

* 5+ years’ experience in Product Design, with a strong foundation as an individual contributor and people leadership experience as a direct lead, mentor, coach.
* Experience setting up and scaling UX Design practices in fast-moving, complex product environments.
* Strong expertise across product design and user research, especially for B2B software, data-heavy, enterprise-grade applications.


And just as importantly, we believe you are:

* A humble, empowering leader who lives and elevates Hive’s values of
  

innovation, customer centricity, and empowerment, enabling the team to
  

do their best work.
* An excellent communicator and facilitator with a growth mindset, who embraces change with curiosity, ownership and grit.
* A believer in continuous improvement of products, processes, and yourself.

### **Location**


Stockholm, Sweden (Hybrid: 2-3 days/week in the office)

*Just a heads up, we're a dog-friendly office!*

### **What Hive offers**

* A mission-driven culture where UX Design has continuous strategic influence.
* The opportunity to shape a growing product portfolio used by key roles in enterprises to drive impact through video.
* A lean, customer-centric product development culture, enabling fast decisions through empowerment.
* A diverse, collaborative team that values curiosity, rapid learning, and new perspectives.
* Hybrid work model: Based in our Stockholm office, with 2–3 days a week on-site for collaboration and creativity.
* Great benefits: Wellness stipend, pension, health insurance, extra vacation days, benefit bikes, and more!

### **Recruitment process: what to expect**


To apply, please submit your CV, portfolio, and answer a few short questions in lieu of a cover letter directly in the application form. Please submit all documents in English.


Our hiring process is designed to be transparent and collaborative:



* **Intro call**: Meet our People & Talent Partner and share more about your motivation


* **Hiring manager interview**: Meet our CPO, discuss your UX Design leadership journey


* **Case interview**: Collaborate with the UX Design team on a practical challenge


* **Leadership** **interview**: Meet our Chief People Experience Officer and peers in the leadership team, to align on values and vision


* **Reference** **checks**: We take security seriously, and conduct 2 reference checks to stay compliant with internal protocols and regulatory requirements


* **Decision**: Timely feedback and next steps



Depending on your availability, we expect the process to be completed within 3-4 weeks.

title: UX-designer - Stockholm
description:
### **Rollbeskrivning**


Vi söker en erfaren UX-designer som vill vara med och utveckla digitala kundgränssnitt med fokus på ett hållbart energisystem och en smidig kundresa. I rollen blir du en del av ett tvärfunktionellt team där du arbetar genom hela UX-processen – från research och analys till konceptutveckling, prototyper och användartester.


Du ansvarar för att kartlägga kundresor, identifiera förbättringsområden samt skapa wireframes, prototyper och visuella lösningar i moderna designverktyg. En central del av arbetet är att följa WCAG och tillgänglighetsstandarder för att säkerställa inkluderande digitala tjänster.


Rollen innebär nära samarbete med utvecklare, produktägare och andra intressenter för att skapa en konsekvent och användarvänlig upplevelse.

### **Arbetsuppgifter**

* Genomföra research, analys och användartester
* Kartlägga kundresor och identifiera förbättringsområden
* Ta fram wireframes, prototyper och visuella koncept i Figma och Adobe Creative Suite
* Säkerställa tillgänglighet enligt WCAG och andra standarder
* Samarbeta med utvecklare, produktägare och intressenter i agila arbetsformer

### **Krav**

* Dokumenterad erfarenhet av UX-design och digitala kundgränssnitt
* Mycket goda kunskaper i Figma, Adobe XD, Illustrator eller liknande designverktyg
* Förmåga att genomföra användarundersökningar och användartester
* Erfarenhet av att skapa prototyper och interaktiva flöden
* Förståelse för responsiv design och webbstandarder

### **Meriterande**

* Erfarenhet av UI-design och grafisk formgivning
* Kunskap om designsystem och komponentbibliotek
* Erfarenhet av arbete i agila team och nära samarbete med utvecklare
* Grundläggande förståelse för frontend-tekniker (HTML, CSS, JavaScript)

### **Start/Längd**


Start: 2025-09-29  

Längd: Till och med 2026-03-31 (med möjlighet till övergång i fast anställning hos kund)

### **Plats**


Jönköping (på plats/hybrid enligt överenskommelse)

### **Om Rasulson Consulting**


Rasulson Consulting är ett specialiserat bemannings- och rekryteringsföretag inom IT-sektorn. Vi samarbetar med både etablerade teknikbolag och innovativa startupföretag för att erbjuda attraktiva karriärmöjligheter för dig som vill utvecklas inom digitalisering och IT. Genom vår djupa tekniska kompetens och vårt omfattande nätverk matchar vi rätt konsult med rätt uppdrag – snabbt och träffsäkert. Hos oss får du personlig rådgivning, kontinuerlig återkoppling och möjlighet att ta nästa steg i din karriär.

title: Content Design Consultant
description:
**PowerApp & Content Design Consultant**
========================================

**Role Description**
--------------------


We are looking for a consultant with strong expertise in Microsoft PowerApps and content design. The role requires a combination of technical development skills and creative design capabilities. You will be responsible for building PowerApps solutions, developing user-friendly interfaces, and delivering high-quality design outputs. The assignment also includes working with generative AI, machine learning, and Microsoft CoPilot Studio.

**Responsibilities**
--------------------

* Develop and deliver solutions in Microsoft PowerApps
* Contribute with expertise in Java and JavaScript coding
* Work with Microsoft CoPilot Studio, generative AI and machine learning solutions
* Create design deliverables using Adobe Illustrator and Photoshop
* Develop intuitive and user-friendly UI/UX interfaces
* Work within an agile and structured project environment
* Collaborate with stakeholders and ensure adherence to processes and guidelines

**Requirements**
----------------

* Proven track record in Microsoft PowerApps development (portfolio required)
* Expertise in Java and JavaScript coding
* Experience with Microsoft CoPilot Studio, generative AI and machine learning (portfolio required)
* Strong design skills with Adobe Illustrator and Photoshop (portfolio required)
* Experience in developing UI/UX and user-friendly interfaces
* High proficiency in business English, spoken and written
* Experience working in structured projects and agile environments
* Strong professional attitude with commitment to procedures and guidelines

**Meriting**
------------

* Demonstrated ability to combine technical and design expertise in previous projects
* Growth-oriented mindset and willingness to take on challenges

**Start/Duration**
------------------


Start: ASAP  

Duration: Until 2026-03-31

**Location**
------------


Lund (on-site, workload 50%)

### **About Rasulson Consulting**


Rasulson Consulting is a specialized staffing and recruitment firm within the IT sector. We partner with established technology companies as well as innovative startups to offer attractive career opportunities for professionals looking to grow within digital development and IT. With our strong technical expertise and extensive network, we effectively match the right consultant with the right assignment. At Rasulson Consulting, you will receive personalized guidance, ongoing feedback, and the opportunity to take the next step in your career.

title: Senior UX-resurs ServiceNow
description:
**Senior UX-specialist ServiceNow**
-----------------------------------

### **Rollbeskrivning**


Vi söker en senior UX-specialist med fördjupad kompetens inom ServiceNow för ett tidsbegränsat uppdrag. Arbetet bedrivs huvudsakligen på distans men med vissa tillfällen för fysiska möten i Halmstad. Rollen innebär att bidra till ökat tempo i pågående initiativ och säkerställa att lösningarna får genomslag i verksamheten.


Tyngdpunkten ligger på portalutveckling, där du ansvarar för att utforma struktur och design i Employee Service Center, bygga upp portalstruktur via CRM och Internal Business Location samt utveckla moderna och lättadministrerade portaler. Uppdraget omfattar även att ta fram dashboards, rapporter och visualiseringar samt att delta i workshops och dokumentation.

### **Arbetsuppgifter**

* Design och utveckling av portaler i ServiceNow (ESC, Service Portal)
* Utforma användarvänliga dashboards, rapporter och visualiseringar
* Bygga upp och strukturera portaler via CRM och Internal Business Location
* Delta i workshops och omsätta verksamhetsbehov till designlösningar
* Dokumentation och stöd i etablering av lösningar i verksamheten
* Samarbete i agila arbetsformer med regelbundna avstämningar

### **Krav**

* Minst fyra (4) års erfarenhet på senior nivå inom större projekt
* Mycket goda språkkunskaper i svenska eller engelska
* Dokumenterad erfarenhet av UI/UX-utveckling i ServiceNow
* Fördjupad kompetens inom Employee Center (ESC) och Service Portal
* Erfarenhet av att designa och utveckla portaler och gränssnitt
* Förmåga att utveckla dashboards, rapporter och visualiseringar med fokus på användbarhet
* Erfarenhet av att leda workshops och omsätta verksamhetsbehov i designlösningar
* Relevanta ServiceNow-certifieringar

### **Start/Längd**


Start: 2025-10-06  

Längd: Till och med 2025-12-31

### **Plats**


Remote (med resor till Halmstad vid behov)

### **Om Rasulson Consulting**


Rasulson Consulting är ett specialiserat bemannings- och rekryteringsföretag inom IT-sektorn. Vi samarbetar med både etablerade teknikbolag och innovativa startupföretag för att erbjuda attraktiva karriärmöjligheter för dig som vill utvecklas inom digitalisering och IT. Genom vår djupa tekniska kompetens och vårt omfattande nätverk matchar vi rätt konsult med rätt uppdrag – snabbt och träffsäkert. Hos oss får du personlig rådgivning, kontinuerlig återkoppling och möjlighet att ta nästa steg i din karriär.

title: Product Manager
description:
**Join our Team**
-----------------


**About this opportunity:**


As the technology firm that created the mobile world and has a rich history of 145 years of building ground-breaking solutions and innovative technologies supported by 60,000+ patents, Ericsson has made it our business to make a mark. When joining our team at Ericsson, you are empowered to learn, lead, and perform at your best, shaping the future of technology. This is a place where you are welcomed as your own perfectly unique self and celebrated for the skills, talents, and perspectives you bring to the team.

  

Ericsson Enterprise Wireless Solutions (BEWS) is the group responsible for leading Ericsson’s Enterprise 5G, Networking, and Security business. Our growing product portfolio spans across private 5G, wide area networks, local area networks, and enterprise security. We are the #1 global market leader in Wireless-WAN-based enterprise connectivity solutions and are growing fast in enterprise Private 5G networks and Secure Access Services Edge (SASE) solutions.

 **How Will You Contribute to the Company?**  

We are looking for a Senior Product Manager with industry experience in a product management role to join our RAN team for the Enterprise 5G portfolio. You will be joining a globally diverse team, interacting and working closely with one of the finest product teams in the Enterprise private 5G industry – where you will find that work is both fun and challenging with ample opportunity to learn and grow.

 **What you will do:**

* Product Manager for RAN feature development teams.
* Work closely with customers, sales engineering, services, and support teams to bring new features from concept to launch and ensure successful adoption in the market.
* Collaborate cross-functionally with other product managers to define product strategy, priorities, and execution plans.

 **The skills you bring:**


Must-haves:

* Product management experience
	+ Strong business acumen to capture and convert must-have customer asks into clear requirements.
	+ Familiarity with Agile development processes and frameworks, backlog management
	+ Strong prioritization skills, roadmap definition, and executable strategies.
* Experience with 3GPP RAN technologies
	+ Familiarity with LTE, 5G, and private cellular networks
	+ Deep technical knowledge of RAN architecture and wireless protocols.
	+ Excellent understanding of radio KPIs, counters, parameters, and features, including optimization
* Experience with UX driven products, REST APIs, and network automation.
* Excellent analytical, problem-solving, and decision-making skills
* Strong interpersonal skills to work effectively with external and internal stakeholders.
* Flexibility to adjust to changing market conditions, customer needs, priorities, and technological advancements.
* Bachelor’s degree in Computer Science, Electrical Engineering, or a related technical field

  

Nice-to-haves:

* Experience with Ericsson RAN.
* Experience with LTE and 5G.
* Experience as a product owner of development teams.
* Knowledge of transport protocols and networking fundamentals.
* Familiarity with JIRA and Confluence for backlog management and documentation.
* Experience in delivering cloud-based software solutions in an agile development environment.
**Why Ericsson Enterprise Wireless Solutions?**
-----------------------------------------------



At Ericsson Enterprise Wireless Solutions, we are one team - all in on inclusion. Celebrating the uniqueness of our individual team members across the globe helps us build diverse teams where we all can thrive. Our connected, community-focused culture enables each one of us to perform at our best and fully be ourselves.

  

We are creating the future of global connectivity & community. Come join us. You belong here.

 **Application**  

We look forward to receiving your application, including your CV/resume in English.  

  

**Application deadline:** 22nd of September 2025.  

**Location:** Gothenburg, Sweden  

**Unit:** BEWS

  

Please be aware that this position is subject to a comprehensive background check and vetting process.

  

We will review applications prior to the closing date and conduct interviews in parallel with the application process. Therefore, you are welcome to express your interest as soon as you see the job ad.

**Why join Ericsson?**


At Ericsson, you´ll have an outstanding opportunity. The chance to use your skills and imagination to push the boundaries of what´s possible. To build solutions never seen before to some of the world’s toughest problems. You´ll be challenged, but you won’t be alone. You´ll be joining a team of diverse innovators, all driven to go beyond the status quo to craft what comes next.  

  

**What happens once you apply?**


Click Here to find all you need to know about what our typical hiring process looks like.


Encouraging a diverse and inclusive organization is core to our values at Ericsson, that's why we champion it in everything we do. We truly believe that by collaborating with people with different experiences we drive innovation, which is essential for our future growth. We encourage people from all backgrounds to apply and realize their full potential as part of our Ericsson team. Ericsson is proud to be an Equal Opportunity Employer. learn more.

**Primary country and city:** Sweden (SE) || Göteborg

**Req ID:** 771638
company_description: Do you want to be part of shaping the future? From making connectivity more accessible to the latest IoT solutions, you have an opportunity to be where it begins.

title: UX Design Lead
description:
**Position Overview:**
 We’re seeking an experienced UX Design Lead to drive the transformation of the
   

  

 user experience across our platform, with the design system as the core enabler.
   

  

 You will scale and evolve the system to be future-proof in an AI-driven product
   

  

 environment, grounded in user needs and research, ensuring it empowers both UX
   

  

 and engineering teams to deliver cohesive, consistent, and scalable experiences.
   

  

 This role requires strong leadership in systems thinking, user experience, and design
   

  

 systems, along with a deep interest in AI-enhanced product experiences. You will
   

  

 champion adoption across the organization, aligning stakeholders and enabling
   

  

 teams to design with speed, consistency, and quality.
   

  

**Key Responsibilities:**
* Lead the transformation of the user experience across the platform, with the


 design system as the enabler.
   

  

* Own, evolve, and govern the design system based on user needs and


 research, ensuring cohesive, consistent, and scalable experiences.
   

  

* Facilitate cross-functional collaboration, running workshops and alignment


 sessions across Sweden, India, and other regions.
   

  

* Equip and mentor design system users to effectively leverage the design


 system in their daily work.
   

  

* Partner with engineering to streamline design-to-development workflows


 using tools like Cursor and Storybook.
   

  

* Explore and integrate AI-driven design opportunities into the platform. 7.


 Advocate for user-centered design practices informed by research, data, and
   

  

 insights.
   

  

**Qualifications:**
* 5–7 years of experience in UX/UI design for SaaS products, including at least


 3 years in a design leadership role.
   

  

* Bachelor’s degree in design or equivalent.
* Proven track record of building and governing design systems for large-scale


 digital products.
   

  

* Experienced practitioner of Design Thinking methodology (double diamond)


 with strong facilitation skills, able to collaborate effectively with crossfunctional
   

  

 teams across multiple locations.
   

  

* Excellent communication skills, with the ability to align stakeholders and


 translate complex technical concepts into business value.
   

  

* Good analytical and problem-solving skills with a data-driven approach.
* Ability to design for human-AI collaboration and explore AI-driven design


 workflows.
   

  

 You get extra points if you have:
   

  

* Experience designing AI-native software or developing AI based automations.
* Knowledge of supply chain or compliance-driven industries.
* Familiarity with design tokens and front-end frameworks.


**What We Offer:**
* The opportunity to drive change and break new grounds to enhance and


 strengthen the visual identity of a growing global scale-up company, committed
   

  

 to accelerating sustainable transformation in fashion.
   

  

* A competitive compensation package, including benefits.
* A collaborative and innovative work environment where your ideas and


 contributions are valued.
   

  

* The chance to make a significant impact on the future of fashion and retail


 through technology.
   

  

* A hybrid work model with flexible working arrangements.


**About TrusTrace**
 Founded in 2016, TrusTrace offers a market-leading platform for supply chain traceability and compliance, enabling brands and suppliers around the world to standardise how supply chain and material traceability data is captured, digitised and shared. TrusTrace is leading global-scale traceability programs for many of the world’s largest brands. The company is headquartered in Stockholm, Sweden, with additional offices in India, France and the US.
   

  

**What do we offer?**
* The opportunity to drive change and break new grounds to enhance and strengthen the visual identity of a growing global scale-up company, committed to accelerate sustainable transformation in fashion.
* To be part of a great multicultural, multilingual team.

title: UX/UI designer (temporary, 1 year), Solna
company_industry: Transportation, Logistics, Supply Chain and Storage
description:
Be a part of creating the digital customer experiences of the future with us at PostNord. Join the UX design team in Stockholm!
   

  

 Join the UX team at PostNord and help shape outstanding customer journeys with a user-centered mindset. As a UX/UI designer, you’ll collaborate with fellow designers within a dedicated user segment, working on multiple services to create seamless and impactful experiences.
   

  

**Join us**
 We, the UX team, are working in an agile environment where the teams independently own the product from start to finish. Within the team, it is important that everybody has their say, and we always strive to improve our way of working.
   

  

 Our head office is in Solna, Stockholm. We make sure to meet each other in our office in Solna, at least three days per week.
   

  

 Find out more and follow us on LinkedIn!
   

  

**We are looking for you**
 As one of our members in the UX team is about to start their maternity leave, we are offering a temporary position with the possibility of extension. To be successful in this role, we believe that you are a UX/UI designer that wants to be a key player and take ownership. You will work closely with business, product owners, developers and other UX designers and make sure we build the best customer journeys.
   

  

 As a person, we believe that you are full of initiative and solution oriented. You have good communication skills and thrive when you get to work both practically and close to our users. You are no stranger with facilitating meetings or workshops and visualizing requirements.
   

  

 You have a great personal drive and adapt efficiently to new information and insights. Like us, you value teamwork and building great solutions together.
   

  

 ,
   

  

* Relevant education in UX design, interaction design, service design or equivalent field.
* Minimum 3 years of work experience as a UX/UI designer
* Facilitation skills and able to take ownership and get things done
* Design user flows and interfaces for our digital services in Figma
* The ability to analyze and design user flows based on insights collected via interviews and other mediums such as Hotjar/Google Analytics
* Experience in designing responsive user interfaces for web applications
* Experience in designing native mobile applications
* Understands graphic design and typography
* Understands designing for accessibility and WCAG requirements
* Experience in planning and conducting user tests
* Fluent in Swedish and English


**Job Responsibilities**
* Conducting user research, both qualitative and quantitative, as well as analyzing and presenting insights to revenant product teams and the whole department
* Analyzing and following up on user research
* Designing overall user flows and interfaces for our digital services on the web and native applications
* Working closely with product owners, other designers and other stakeholders within PostNord
* You’ll be responsible in aligning your work with other UX designers and user segments, on how it might affect PostNord’s multiple customer journeys.


**We offer you**
* A great team, you are part of a team with a focus on creating amazing customer-facing solutions at Postnord.
* Agile is our way of working, we have weekly’s, daily's, refinement meetings and sprint retros.
* Flexible hybrid workplace with an open working climate.
* To be part of a large organization with endless development opportunities for you as a UX designer and individual.
* Good insurance and occupational pension conditions.
* Wellness allowance and access to office gym and swimming pool.
* Employee benefits through PostNord's own employee foundation PostNord Plus.
* Employment according to a collective agreement.


**We make everyday life easier**
 PostNord is the leading supplier of communication and logistics solutions to, from, and within the Nordic region. We ensure the provision of a postal service to households and businesses in Sweden and Denmark. We aim to make everyday life easier and more sustainable for everyone who lives and works in the Nordic region. We are accountable, brave and committed, effectively leading change regardless of if we lead ourselves or others. We emphasize teamwork, sincerity and positive relationships in the workplace. We build on our success and learn from both colleagues and mistakes. People with different backgrounds work with us. You will therefore be part of a workplace with great diversity, which contributes to better results for the business. Visit us at www.postnord.com.
   

  

**Apply**
 What are you waiting for? Send your application. Selection is ongoing, so apply as soon as possible. If you have any questions about the position, email sonja.prest@postnord.com. We look forward to hearing from you!

title: Lead UX Designer
description:
The opportunity ✨
   

  

 Waitwhile is on a mission to eliminate the 1 trillion hours people spend waiting in lines every year. Our industry leading queue management and appointment scheduling platform empowers businesses to streamline their operations and deliver exceptional customer experiences.
   

  

 Waitwhile is trusted by 10,000 companies worldwide and has helped more than 250 million people enjoy a radically better waiting experience at places like IKEA, CHANEL, Costco, Delta Airlines, US Airforce and many more.
   

  

 We are now looking for a
 **Lead UX Designer** 
 in Stockholm to join our mission to eliminate waiting and improve customer journeys. You'll be joining a fast-paced, rapidly growing technology scale-up with awesome culture and benefits.
   

  

 The Role 💼
   

  

 We’re looking for a Lead UX Designer who can both design and lead teams. You’ll set the bar for product experience at Waitwhile — rolling up your sleeves on key flows while also helping other designers grow in their craft.
   

  

 This role is a mix of
 **hands-on design, research leadership, and team mentorship** 
 . You’ll guide how we discover user needs, shape our design system, and partner closely with product and engineering to ship work that feels simple and obvious to our users.
   

  

 It’s a great fit if you like switching between strategy and detail — one day running usability tests with enterprise clients, the next day tightening a flow in Figma, the next helping a teammate frame their work for an exec review.
   

  

 We’re building a design culture that is practical, curious, and a little bit obsessive about removing friction from the customer journey. You’ll play a key part in making that happen.
   

  

 What you'll be doing 🚀
   

  

 UX Strategy & Research
   

  

* Lead discovery work: interviews, usability tests, and digging into product data.
* Make sure insights are shared in a way that actually shapes product decisions, not just a research deck that gets filed away.
* Help the team focus on the most important user problems — not just what’s loudest.


 Team leadership & mentorship
   

  

* Coach other designers with regular feedback and support.
* Run critiques and workshops that raise the quality of everyone’s work.
* Be the design perspective in cross-team strategy discussions, OKRs, and planning.


 Design Execution & Direction
   

  

* Own design for key features and end-to-end journeys, from rough sketches to polished UI.
* Work closely with engineers so the final product feels as good as the prototype.
* Keep Waitwhile's design system - QI - evolving and make sure accessibility and usability are always part of the process.


 Design Operations & Systems
   

  

* Improve how we review, document, and ship design work so it’s consistent and fast.
* Partner with PMs and Eng leads to align priorities and keep delivery smooth.


**Experience**
 What skills you need 📖
   

  

* 8+ years in product/UX design with a strong track record of shipped web and mobile products.
* Comfortable running the full design process — from research to prototypes to final handoff.
* Strong portfolio that shows both craft (great UI/UX) and impact (how it moved the business or user experience forward).
* Experienced in B2B or SaaS products.


 Tools & methods
   

  

* Expert in Figma (components, prototyping, design systems), or equivalent.
* Proficient in planning and conducting qualitative and quantitative research.
* Comfortable leading cross-functional meetings, critiques, and workshops.
* Familiarity with front-end basics and ability to partner closely with engineering.


 Leadership Qualities
   

  

* Experience mentoring or guiding other designers.
* Strong communicator who can explain design decisions clearly to both designers and non-designers.
* Comfortable leading workshops, critiques, and cross-team discussions.
* More interested in building alignment than winning arguments.


**Bonus Skills ✨**
* Experience in a fast-growing startup or taking products from 0 → 1.
* Familiarity with tools like Amplitude, Mixpanel, or Looker.
* Service design or complex workflow design experience.
* Curiosity about how AI can improve design or research work.


 Benefits ❤️
   

  

* A high-trust environment where design has a seat at the table.
* The opportunity to shape design culture from the ground up at a fast-growing company with a product used by the world’s biggest brands
* Competitive compensation - including health insurance, ITP pension, bike lease and more - and a strong, stable financial backer.
* Remote-friendly culture, flexible work hours, and strong emphasis on well-being.
* Beautiful bright office on Kungsgatan 32 in central Stockholm

title: Product Designer - Kids shoes
description:
**Job Description**
 We are looking for an experienced Kids Shoe Designer with a strong creative eye, attention to finer detail and fashion sensibility to join us at H&M's head office in Stockholm, Sweden.
   

  

 You will be part of a fast-paced environment and work with youthful, elevated fashion products that welcome everyone! This role is designing across both Boys and Girls from Newborn, Baby, Child and Teenager.
   

  

 As a Product Specialist, you'll drive and identify key products, translating them into commercial collections. You should have strong design process skills and be able to communicate your vision clearly with a creative, fashion-forward focus.
   

  

**Who You’ll Work With**
 You'll collaborate with a team to provide diverse markets with the best products sold worldwide through H&M's omni channels. Your handwriting will demonstrate a strong fashion trend awareness and genuine passion for shoes! Maintaining a high fashion sense for style and trends for the target customer, while being cost-conscious throughout the design process, is essential. The role demands high energy, creativity, and experience in coaching and leading others to commercial success!
   

  

**Who You Are**
*We are looking for people with:*
* BA/MA or equivalent experience in Fashion Footwear/Product Design
* Minimum of 4 years’ work experience as a Designer with a strength in overall collection building
* High knowledge of materials, technical details, and processes of footwear
* A visionary mindset with true passion for women’s fashion, current and future trends
* A strong customer focus and commercial mindset for the H&M customer
* Experience working with suppliers/factories in Asia and Europe
* Skilled in working in Adobe Creative Suite programs
* 3D is meriting
* Demonstrated communication skills and true collaborative team player
* Leadership and coaching mindset
* Independent and proactive approach
* Able to set priorities with an organized & structured approach
* Flexible mindset and adaptable to changes in a fast moving & growing industry
* Fluent in English (Swedish not necessary)


**Who We Are**
 H&M Group is a global company of strong fashion brands and ventures. Our goal is to prove that there is no compromise between exceptional design, affordable prices, and sustainable solutions. We want to liberate fashion for the many, and our customers are at the heart of every decision we make.
   

  

 We are made up of thousands of passionate and talented colleagues united by our shared culture and values. Together, we want to use our power, our scale, and our knowledge to push the fashion industry towards a more inclusive and sustainable future.
   

  

**WHY YOU’LL LOVE WORKING HERE**
 At H&M Group, we are proud to be a vibrant and welcoming company. We offer our employees attractive benefits with extensive development opportunities around the globe.
   

  

 All our employees receive a staff discount card, usable on all our H&M Group brands in stores and online. Brands covered by the discount are H&M (Beauty and Move included), COS, Weekday, Monki, H&M HOME, & Other Stories, ARKET, Afound. In addition to our staff discount, all our employees are included in our H&M Incentive Program – HIP. You can read more about our H&M Incentive Program here
 *In addition to our global benefits, all our local markets offer different competitive perks and benefits. Please note that they may differ between employment type and countries.*
**JOIN US**
 Our uniqueness comes from a combination of many things – our inclusive and collaborative culture, our strong values, and opportunities for growth. But most of all, it’s our people who make us who we are. Take the next step in your career together with us. The journey starts here.
   

  

 If this sounds interesting and you fit the qualifications,
 **apply asap with CV and design portfolio** 
 (pdf max 10mb/uploading). Assessments will start immediately.
   

  

 All documents should be in English. This is a full time permanent position starting as soon as possible at our H&M Head office in Stockholm, Sweden working on site.
   

  

* We are committed to a recruitment process that is fair, equitable, and based on competency. We therefore kindly ask you to not attach a cover letter in your application.

title: UX Lead
description:
Telness Tech is on a mission to simplify and digitize the telecom industry. Our platform powers next-generation mobile providers—from traditional MVNOs to eSIM challengers and non-telecom brands embedding connectivity. With our roots in Stockholm and global ambitions, we’re building the future of telecom: fast, flexible, and customer-first.
   

  

 We’re looking for a UX Lead to ensure our platform remains intuitive and impactful as we scale across markets and user types.
   

  

**About The Role**
 As UX Lead at Telness Tech, you’ll shape our end-to-end product experience -bringing clarity to complexity and ensuring our platform is intuitive for customers, operators, and end-users. You’ll work closely with product managers, engineers, and stakeholders to design thoughtful, scalable solutions to technically complex problems.
   

  

 You’ll drive the design process from discovery to delivery, combining hands-on design with strategic leadership and contributing directly to high-impact product initiatives. You’ll be instrumental in aligning design with product strategy, evolving our design system, and embedding user-centric thinking into every stage of development.
   

  

**In this role, you will:**
* Own design strategy across products—balancing usability, scalability, and brand consistency.
* Design end-to-end flows and interfaces for complex systems with multiple user types.
* Partner with the CPO and PMs to explore, learn, and shape a forward-thinking product strategy that keeps us ahead of the market.
* Collaborate cross-functionally to align design with business goals and technical constraints.
* Lead and mentor a small design team, fostering a collaborative and high-performing team.
* Iterate based on feedback and data to continuously improve the user experience.


**What you bring to the table:**
* 8+ years of experience in product design with a strong emphasis on UX.
* A track record of designing intuitive solutions for complex products with multiple user types.
* Experience in high-growth product or SaaS environments; startup experience is a plus.
* Proven leadership experience, including mentoring and leading other designers.
* Expert proficiency in Figma and managing shared design systems.
* Skilled in user research, usability testing, and turning insights into actionable design.
* Able to communicate clearly with both technical and non-technical stakeholders.
* Comfortable balancing business goals with user needs to drive product success.
* Excellent verbal and written communication skills, with high proficiency in English.


**Why Telness Tech?**
 We’re not building for telco as it is—we’re building for how it should be: fast-moving, easy to use, and built for the people who use it. At Telness Tech, you’ll join a curious, ambitious, and transparent team. We work hard, we move fast, and we support each other every step of the way.
   

  

 Here’s what you can expect:
   

  

* Be part of an exciting startup journey with strong funding and international expansion.
* Play an active role in building one of the telecom industry’s most innovative companies.
* A high-trust, high-autonomy environment where you’ll be encouraged to take ownership and explore growth opportunities for both Telness Tech and your development.
* A friendly, positive, and supportive workplace that fosters collaboration and constructive challenge.
* Complimentary daily breakfast, regular "Friday" AWs, and fun activities!
* Hybrid/remote work setup with an office in central Stockholm.


 Sounds like your challenge? Let’s talk.
   

  

*Currently, we are not able to offer relocation or visa sponsorship.*

title: Website UX & Design Lead
description:
**Join our Team**
**About this opportunity:**
 Become a part of Ericsson's highly dynamic team as an
 **Digital UX & Design Director** 
 . In this role, you will get the opportunity to play an indispensable role in increasing Ericsson's competitiveness in the market.
   

  

**What you will do:**
 The Digital UX & Design Director joins our Website and Intranet team (mostly Stockholm), driving commercial digital ambitions to support company strategy. This hire will unify UX/design vision across public, extranet, and intranet platforms; elevate user-centricity; ensure strong Ericsson brand consistency; optimize user journeys; and foster data-driven design, collaborating with Brand and IT teams.
   

  

**The skills you bring:**
**Visionary UX & Design Leadership** 
 :
   

  

* Ability to develop and articulate a compelling user experience and design vision across the website, extranet, and intranet, aligned with Ericsson's overall business strategy and brand.
* Skill in setting strategic direction for UX and design initiatives, ensuring a consistent and high-quality user experience across


**Deep Understanding of User-Centered Design Principles** 
 :
   

  

* Comprehensive knowledge of user research methodologies, interaction design principles, information architecture, usability testing, and accessibility standards (WCAG).
* Skill in translating user needs, business goals, and technical constraints into effective design solutions.


 Extensive Experience Across Multiple Digital Platforms:
   

  

* Proven track record of leading UX and design efforts for diverse digital platforms, including public-facing websites, B2B extranets, and internal intranets.
* Deep understanding of visual design principles, typography, color theory, and branding guidelines.
* Ability to ensure that the visual design of all platforms reinforces the Ericsson brand and creates a positive user experience.


**Collaboration and Stakeholder Management:**
* Exceptional communication, presentation, and interpersonal skills to effectively collaborate with diverse stakeholders, including business leaders, product owners, IT teams, external vendors, and importantly, the Ericsson Brand & Design teams.
* Ability to articulate the value of UX and design and influence decision-making at a strategic level, ensuring alignment with brand guidelines and the consistent application of the Ericsson Design System.


**Knowledge of Digital Technologies and Trends** 
 :
   

  

* Awareness of current and emerging digital technologies, design trends, and best practices.
* Understanding of the technical feasibility of design solutions and the capabilities of different platforms.
* Ability to advocate for innovative and user-centric technology adoption.


**Why join Ericsson?**
 At Ericsson, you´ll have an outstanding opportunity. The chance to use your skills and imagination to push the boundaries of what´s possible. To build solutions never seen before to some of the world’s toughest problems. You´ll be challenged, but you won’t be alone. You´ll be joining a team of diverse innovators, all driven to go beyond the status quo to craft what comes next.
   

  

**What happens once you apply?**
 Click Here to find all you need to know about what our typical hiring process looks like.
   

  

 Encouraging a diverse and inclusive organization is core to our values at Ericsson, that's why we champion it in everything we do. We truly believe that by collaborating with people with different experiences we drive innovation, which is essential for our future growth. We encourage people from all backgrounds to apply and realize their full potential as part of our Ericsson team. Ericsson is proud to be an Equal Opportunity Employer. learn more.
   

  

**Primary country and city:** 
 Sweden (SE) || Stockholm
   

  

**Req ID:** 
 768844

title: Marketing Designer
description:
**Location:** 
 Stockholm (In office)
   

  

**Company:** 
 360Player
   

  

**Job Type:** 
 Full-time
   

  

**Join the Global Leader in Sports Technology**
 At
 **360Player** 
 , we are redefining how sports clubs operate, develop players, and manage teams. As the world’s leading
 **all-in-one Club Operating System** 
 , we help clubs streamline every aspect of their operations—from scheduling and payments to player development and video analytics. Trusted by top clubs such as
 **Rush Soccer, FC Barcelona** 
 and
 **Rafa Nadal Academy** 
 , our platform is transforming the sports world. With offices in Stockholm, Barcelona and the US, we’re looking for passionate, driven individuals to join our team as we continue to grow globally.
   

  

**About The Role**
 We’re looking for a creative and hands-on
 **Marketing Designer** 
 to join our growing team. In this role you’ll work closely with our marketing team. You will visually communicate our message across a wide range of channels—from presentations and social media to trade shows. You’ll also help shape the visual identity of our internal and external web presence. This is a great opportunity for someone early in their design career who wants to grow, learn, and be part of a collaborative and fast-moving environment.
   

  

**What You’ll Do**
* Design engaging content for presentations, social media, trade shows, and marketing campaigns
* Create graphics for video
* Contribute to the visual design of our website and internal platforms
* Set up templates and design systems for recurring content (ads, slides, visuals)
* Collaborate with team members across departments and support internal stakeholders
* Work closely with our marketing and product teams to ensure brand consistency


**What We’re Looking For**
* At least 3 years of experience in graphic or marketing design, and a relevant education
* Strong skills in the Adobe Creative Suite: InDesign, Illustrator, Photoshop, as well as in Canva
* Experience with layout tools – experience with Figma is a plus
* Experience in web design – experience in Webflow is a plus
* Experience with motion graphics and simple animations - experience in After Effects is a plus
* Fluent in English, both spoken and written
* Spanish language skills is a nice-to-have, not a must-have


**Personal Qualities**
* A team player who enjoys working with others and exchanging ideas
* Positive and proactive attitude – you’re not afraid to try new things
* Service-minded and communicative – you enjoy supporting others and making things look great
* Curious and open to feedback – you want to grow and evolve in your role


**Why 360Player?**
* Be part of a fast-growing company with opportunities for advancement.
* Be part of a collaborative, friendly, and fast-paced team
* Learn from experienced marketers while shaping your own path
* Help define how we visually communicate with the world


**How To Apply**
 Excited about this opportunity? If you have a passion for design and marketing, apply your
 **portfolio** 
 (attached or via link), resume, and a short cover letter explaining why you’re the right fit for this role. We review applications on a rolling basis – don’t wait to apply!

title: Product Designer - H&M Womenswear Light Woven
description:
**Job Description**
 Exciting new opportunity to join H&M as a Fashion Designer within our Womenswear Light Woven department. As a Product Designer, you'll lead the way in identifying key products and crafting the perfect assortment for our target customers. We seek a passionate Designer skilled in building strong collections.
   

  

 Able to communicate your vision and product ideas in a clear way with a creative, fashion forward and commercial focus. Essentially you will have the ability to work close to season with a high pace proactive approach and able to build & maintain strong relationships both internally and with external partners.
   

  

 If you're a Designer who loves to collaborate, work in a team, and provide diverse markets with the best products sold worldwide than H&M could be the brand for you. This role will be handling a collection with a focus on light wovens across dresses, blouses, skirts and light trousers. It is key to have a high fashion sense of style and trends for our target customer, while maintaining a cost-conscious awareness throughout the design process.
   

  

 The role requires strong drive, high energy, creativity, and experience in coaching & leading others to commercial success!
   

  

**Qualifications**
 A minimum of a BA/MA or equivalent experience in Fashion/Textile Design
   

  

* Minimum of 3 years’ work experience as a Designer for Light Woven product types
* Background from an aspirational global brand or retailer
* International experience is meriting
* Attention to detail with strong knowledge on light woven products
* A creative mindset with sharp eye for both current and future trends
* Strong customer focus and commercial mindset for H&M´s global womenswear customer
* Experience working closely with suppliers/factories in Asia and Europe
* Strong skills in and used to working in Adobe Creative Suite programs
* 3D CLO is meriting
* Demonstrated communication skills and true collaborative team player
* Leadership and coaching mindset
* Independent, driven & proactive with “one step ahead” mindset
* Organized & structured, able to set priorities and follow timelines
* Flexible mindset and adaptable to changes in a fast moving & growing industry
* Fluent in English (Swedish not necessary)


**Additional Information**
 This position is based in Stockholm, to start asap. You will report into the department Assortment Manager and work with a like-minded team of passionate Designers/Product Developers and Planners.
   

  

 If your experience, skills, and ambitions are right for this role,
 **please send your application including CV and relevant portfolio work** 
 (pdf max 10mb/uploading) Portfolio should include vision/mood boards, full design process and final collections and products from a variety of fashion design projects. All documents should be in English. Please ensure to include some work clearly relatable to the aspirational H&M Women’s target customer.
   

  

**Benefits**
 We offer all our employees at H&M Group attractive benefits with extensive development opportunities around the globe. All our employees receive a staff discount card, usable on all our H&M Group brands in stores and online. Brands covered by the discount are H&M (Beauty and Move included), COS, Weekday, Monki, H&M HOME, & Other Stories, ARKET, Afound. In addition to our staff discount, all our employees are included in our H&M Incentive Program – HIP. You can read more about our H&M Incentive Program here.
   

  

*In addition to our global benefits, all our local markets offer different competitive perks and benefits. Please note that they may differ between employment type and countries.*
**Inclusion & Diversity**
*H&M is a part of H&M Group. At H&M Group, we’re determined to create and maintain inclusive, diverse, and equitable workplaces throughout our organisation. Our teams should consist of a variety of people that share and combine their knowledge, experience, and ideas. Having a diverse workforce leads to a positive impact on how we address challenges, on what we perceive possible and on how we choose to relate to our colleagues and customers all over the world. Hence all diversity dimensions are taken into consideration in our recruitment process.*
*We strive to have a fair and equal process and therefore kindly ask you not to attach a cover letter in your application as they often contain information that easily can trigger unintentional biases.*
**Company Description**
 H&M is a fashion brand that offers the latest styles and inspiration, from fashion pieces and unique designer collaborations to affordable wardrobe essentials. Our business idea is fashion & quality at the best price in a sustainable way. Learn more about H & M here.

title: Design Engineer (Remote)
description:
*This is a fully remote role, but you’ll need to be based in Europe.*
**What we’re building at Xata:**
 We're building a database platform for companies that rely on PostgreSQL at scale. And by “at scale,” we don’t just mean large volumes of data or high server counts, we also mean growing teams and the operational complexity that comes with them: staging and developer branches with data, data anonymization and privacy, zero-downtime schema changes, and more.
   

  

 In every feature we build, we optimise for developer experience, high performance, and flexibility. This gives our customers the confidence to rely on us for one of the most critical pieces of their cloud infrastructure.
   

  

 The AI wave of developer tools presents exciting opportunities and challenges - and PostgreSQL and Xata are well-positioned to be at the center of it. We’re a transparent company, maintaining several popular open-source projects, and we enjoy writing technical blog posts about how we solve various challenges.
   

  

**What you’ll be doing:**
 You’ll be joining our Product team as a design engineer, working closely with the frontend engineering team. You’ll be responsible for the overall product UX, DX, and visual design. This includes defining design guidelines, creating shared styles and components, and ensuring consistency across the product and public website.
   

  

 At implementation time, you’ll contribute directly to the codebase or pair with frontend engineers. Our design process typically starts with simple wireframes and moves straight into coded prototypes (we usually skip high-fidelity mockups in Figma).
   

  

**We work with:**
* Next.js
* Shadcn
* Tailwind v4
* React flow
* Whimsical
* Figma
* v0


**In this role, you will:**
* Be an active contributor to our core product and public website.
* Collaborate in multifunctional project teams (with frontend engineers, marketing, and PMs) to create new features or improve existing ones - optionally leading such projects.


**About you:**
* You have a sharp eye for aesthetics.
* Experience with developer tools is a big plus.
* You’re a self-starter who takes responsibility.
* You’re comfortable working with design systems (preferably based on Shadcn and Tailwind).
* You have at least a basic knowledge of React.
* You’re open to leveraging AI tools like v0 to speed up development.
* You have strong CSS skills.
* You're comfortable working with Git and GitHub.


**Nice to haves:**
* Solid engineering skills - coding expertise is a big plus. Familiarity with APIs, HTML, CSS, JavaScript (React), and accessibility (A11y) is a bonus.
* Basic data visualisation skills (e.g. knowing what type of chart best represents data).
* Any experience with databases (MySQL, Postgres, MongoDB) - maybe you've built something with one.
* Experience working on open-source projects.
* Interest in the startup world - you’re a shipper!
* Basic illustration skills (we do everything in Figma - no Illustrator or complex vector tools).


**Working at Xata:**
* We’re stable. We’ve raised $35M and have years of runway.
* We're remote-first, with a team distributed around the world, mainly in Europe and on the East Coast of the USA.
* Be part of a healthy culture, one that genuinely supports innovation, empowers individuals, and cares deeply about its people.
* We work asynchronously. We don’t do agile. The team meets weekly to check in, and we use GitHub, Notion, and Slack to stay aligned.
* You'll have autonomy to lead features and projects and bring your ideas to the table.
* Our team is diverse.
* Xata is female-founded and the first developer platform with an all-female board of directors.
* We encourage conference meet-ups.


**What we offer all of our employees:**
* Competitive salary and stock options.
* Friendly, diverse, and inclusive work environment.
* 30 vacation days (not including local public holidays).
* 2 months of fully paid parental leave.
* Flexibility, autonomy, and real impact.
* Budget for home office setup + coworking space stipend.
* Continuous learning support - budget for conferences, courses, and books.
* Healthcare coverage.
* Two company offsites per year, with partners and kids welcome. So far, we’ve been to Italy, Greece, Spain, Portugal, and Iceland!
* Ample opportunity for career growth - there are no boundaries to your development at Xata.


**Our investors:**
 Xata is well-financed by amazing investors, including Guillermo Rauch (founder of Vercel), Shay Banon (co-founder and CEO of Elastic), Neha Narkhede (founder of Confluent), Elad Gil, Christian Bach, and Mathias Biilmann (founders of Netlify), and many others.
   

  

 We’ve raised a $30 million Series A from top investors (Index Ventures and Redpoint), having the first ever 100% female board for such a technical company.
   

  

**We care about diversity in tech:**
 If you come from an underrepresented background in tech, we strongly encourage you to apply. We believe that our success is driven by the talented and diverse team we’ve brought together from a variety of backgrounds, cultures, and countries. We’re always challenging ourselves to build an inclusive culture that enables us to create innovative and successful products.
   

  

 Our founder, Monica Sarbu, also founded a non-profit organisation called Tupu, which helps tech companies support diversity in tech through mentorship.
   

  

 We're eager to hear from you, and if you decide to apply, we're rooting for you!
   

  

**How To Apply**
 If this role sounds like a fit, we’d love to hear from you! When applying, please include a link to your personal website or portfolio, along with your GitHub profile. Or, anywhere else we can see examples of your work that blend design and code.
   

  

 🌍 This is a fully remote role, but you’ll need to be based in Europe.🌍 This is a fully remote role, but you’ll need to be based in Europe.

title: UX/UI designer (LIA), Solna
company_industry: Transportation, Logistics, Supply Chain and Storage
description:
Want to make a difference for millions of users? Join PostNord’s UX team as an intern.
   

  

 We, the UX team, are working in an agile environment where the teams independently own the product from start to finish. Within the team, it is important that everybody has their say, and we always strive to improve our way of working.
   

  

 Our head office is in Solna, Stockholm. We make sure to meet each other in our office in Solna, at least three days per week. Find out more and follow us on LinkedIn!
   

  

 Are you curious about UX design and eager to gain experience in a large company whose digital services are used by both private individuals and businesses? Then PostNord is the right place for you.
   

  

 As an intern, you’ll be part of our UX team and work closely with developers, product owners, and other specialists to create simple and user-friendly experiences. With us you will
   

  

* Gain experience from projects that make a difference for our users
* Get insights into the full UX process, from research and analysis to prototypes and usability testing.
* Receive support and guidance from experienced UX designers who are happy to share their knowledge


 We believe an internship should be more than just practice. It should give you valuable experience and a true understanding of what it’s like to work in a dynamic and constantly evolving organization.
   

  

**We make everyday life easier**
 PostNord is the leading supplier of communication and logistics solutions to, from, and within the Nordic region. We ensure the provision of a postal service to households and businesses in Sweden and Denmark. We aim to make everyday life easier and more sustainable for everyone who lives and works in the Nordic region. We are accountable, brave and committed, effectively leading change regardless of if we lead ourselves or others. We emphasize teamwork, sincerity and positive relationships in the workplace. We build on our success and learn from both colleagues and mistakes. People with different backgrounds work with us. You will therefore be part of a workplace with great diversity, which contributes to better results for the business. Visit us at postnord.com.
   

  

  

  

**Apply**
 Send us a short presentation about yourself, why you’d like to do your internship with us, and the period you are available.
   

  

 We look forward to hearing from you!

title: Senior product designer
description:
Bruce Studios is on a mission to redefine how people train, recover, and feel good – every day.
   

  

 With thousands of members and over 1,000 partner studios across the Nordics, we offer the most flexible way to stay active and well. And we’re just getting started.
   

  

 We’re now looking for a Senior Product Designer to join our team in Stockholm, Sweden.
   

  

**Your mission**
 As our Senior Product Designer, you’ll oversee the full product design process – from early concepts to final implementation. You’ll take ownership of the customer journey across all touchpoints, ensuring that every interaction with Bruce is seamless, intuitive, and delightful. Working closely with our CPO, product managers, tech, support, and marketing teams, you’ll combine strategy, research, and design execution to create product experiences that both meet user needs and drive business impact.
   

  

**What You´ll Do**
* Lead the implementation of our product design strategy (together with our CPO)
* Design wireframes, prototypes, and high-fidelity solutions for mobile and web
* Ensure all customer-facing design delivers excellent usability and experience
* Conduct user research and gather insights from data and support teams
* Define relevant KPIs to measure the impact of new product features
* Own and refine the customer journey across all channels and products
* Collaborate cross-functionally with product, tech, marketing, and support
* Facilitate seamless handoffs to development teams and ensure QA of design delivery
* Stay up-to-date with design tools, trends, and AI-driven workflows (Figma Make, Lovable, etc.)


**What We Want You To Bring**
* 7–10 years of experience in UX, UI and product design (SaaS or mobile apps a strong plus)
* A strong portfolio showcasing user-centered, strategic, and innovative design work
* Mastery of modern design tools (Figma is our core)
* Experience conducting user research, usability testing, customer journey mapping and data-informed design
* Excellent communication skills in English (Scandinavian language a plus)
* Degree in design, HCI, or related field; certifications in design thinking/UX research
* Bonus: interest in fitness and wellness is a plus


**As a person** 
 , you thrive on collaboration and easily build strong relationships across functions, communicating with stakeholders at every level. You bring leadership that inspires creativity and cross-function collaboration, while your strategic mindset ensures that design vision is always aligned with business goals.
   

  

**Our values at Bruce Studios**
 At Bruce Studios, our values guide everything we do—from how we work together to how we engage with our community.
   

  

* Own it – We take responsibility, make decisions, and follow through. We’re proactive, honest, and always learning from our mistakes.
* Be engaged – We’re all in. We respect each other’s time, stay curious, and continuously strive to improve.
* Be real – Authenticity is key. We communicate openly, support each other, and create a safe space where everyone can be themselves.
* Be adaptable – Change is constant, and we embrace it. We find solutions, stay flexible, and innovate together.
* Be bold – We challenge the status quo, take risks, and push boundaries while treatingeach other with kindness and respect.


 Want to be part of a team that lives these values every day? Apply now.
   

  

**What We Offer You**
* Fully renovated top-floor office with terrace, ideally located in central Stockholm
* 30 days of vacation
* Pension benefits
* Hybrid work setup with three office days per week
* A welcoming company culture and supportive team
* A Bruce Epic membership (yes, you get to workout too!)


**How To Apply**
 Does this role sound like the right fit for you? Great – we’d love to hear from you!
   

  

 Apply directly via Teamtailor by uploading your CV (in English or Swedish) and adding a short personal note about why you're excited about this opportunity and how you’d contribute to the team.
   

  

 We value a diverse and inclusive workplace, and we warmly welcome applicants of all gender identities, ages, backgrounds, and abilities.

title: Web Editor Intern
description:
**Vill du lära dig hur en premium e-handelsaktör bygger engagerande content, optimerar kundresan och jobbar med starka internationella varumärken inom design och inredning?** 




  





 Vi på Nordiska Galleriet Group söker nu en praktikant till vårt Content-team under hösten 2025.
 



  





 Det här är en chans för dig som vill få praktisk erfarenhet av att arbeta i en modern och snabbfotad digital miljö – och samtidigt bidra till vår vision om att skapa världens bästa e-handel inom möbler och inredning.
 



  





 Du kommer att få praktisk erfarenhet av:
 


* Publicering av kampanjer, startsidor och nyheter i våra CMS
* Uppdatering och kvalitetssäkring av innehåll på våra sajter
* Enklare bildhantering för digitala plattformar
* Testning av sajterna ur ett användarperspektiv
* E-handel i praktiken – hur vi optimerar innehåll för att inspirera och konvertera
* Arbete i vårt PIM-system – strukturera och förbättra produktdata, bilder och texter
* Digital merchandising och curation – bidra till att våra sortiment och kategorisidor blir inspirerande, relevanta och optimerade för konvertering
* Förståelse för hur vi kopplar ihop content, produktdata och bildmaterial för att skapa en helhet i kundresan



  





**Om Praktiken** 




 Vi lägger stor vikt vid att din praktik ska vara lärorik och relevant för dina studier – och ett bra steg mot din framtida karriär. Hos oss får du en handledare, nära kontakt med teamet och möjlighet att ta ansvar i riktiga projekt. Du får insyn i hur ett av Nordens ledande premiumvaruhus online arbetar med design, affär och digital utveckling – och chans att se dina idéer gå live.
 



  





**Vi söker dig som:** 



* Studerar digital marknadsföring, media, kommunikation, e-handel eller liknande
* Har en LIA- eller praktikperiod på minst 12 veckor under hösten 2025
* Behärskar svenska i tal och skrift
* Har ett intresse för digitala kanaler, innehåll, PIM och e-handel



  





 Meriterande:
 


* Erfarenhet av att arbeta i något innehållshanteringssystem
* Tidigare erfarenhet av PIM, digital merchandising eller bildhantering
* Kunskaper i norska, finska, danska eller nederländska



  





 Praktiken är för hösten 2025 och sker på plats på vårt huvudkontor på Brahegatan 21, Östermalm i Stockholm.

title: Data Strategist
description:
**Company Overview**
 Vaimo is a full-service omnichannel agency that helps brands, retailers, and manufacturers worldwide to succeed in delivering fluid customer experiences, through end to end e-Commerce, experience management and optimised product-, asset- & customer data management. By combining strategic, UX & design principles with advanced data visualisation & analysis we are able to understand and fully optimise the customer journey across touchpoints driving business results.
   

  

**We are looking for a talented and experienced Data Strategist to join our team!**
 As a
 **Data Strategist** 
 at Vaimo, you will play a pivotal role in shaping the data strategy to support our client's data-driven goals, with a focus on Customer Journey and Analytics. Your primary responsibility will be to develop and execute data-driven strategies for those clients, ensuring that data is leveraged effectively to drive business success across different industries.
   

  

**Key Responsibilities**
* Data Strategy Development: Collaborate with cross-functional teams to design and implement data strategies and customer journeys that align with the company's mission and vision, with a specific focus on customer-centric use case enablement
* Data Governance: Establish and enforce data governance practices, ensuring data quality, accuracy, and compliance with regulations.
* Data Analysis: Analyse large customer datasets across touchpoints to identify trends, insights, and opportunities for improvement.
* Data Integration: Work on integrating data from various sources to create a unified data ecosystem (ie: in a CDP)
* Data Visualization: Create compelling data visualisations to communicate insights and findings to both technical and non-technical stakeholders.
* Performance Metrics: Identify and help organisations monitor their key performance metrics, making data-driven recommendations for continuous and timely improvement.
* Data Security: Recommend data security measures to protect sensitive information and ensure compliance with data protection regulations.
* Team Collaboration: Collaborate with data operational or executive-level teams to achieve data-related goals.
* Communication: Present findings and recommendations with key stakeholders, and empower them to take actions in various areas (journey orchestration, media plan, UX design, promotion, CRO, etc)


**Qualifications Required**
* Minimum of 3 to 5 years of experience in analytics
* CDP and journey orchestration or marketing automation tools (eg: Segment, Hubspot, Klaviyo, Adobe Journey Optimizer, etc)
* BI and Visualisation tools (eg: PowerBI, QlikSense, Tableau, Looker)
* Journey and UX analytics tool (eg: CRM, Google Analytics, Adobe Journey Analytics, Adobe Analytics, Hotjar, ContentSquare, etc)
* Expertise in campaign management and media analytics is a plus
* Master's or Bachelor's degree in Economics or Marketing (or equivalent experience)
* Proficiency in data analysis tools and techniques, with a specific focus on journey, marketing automation, CRM programs and customer data analysis and statistics
* Knowledge of data manipulation language such as Python, SQL or R is a plus
* Eagerness to learn and improve in the field of data strategy.
* Results-oriented mindset.
* Team-player


**What Offer**
* A full-time job
* Competitive salary package
* Remote or flexible working arrangement available
* Working in an international environment, with frequent travel to client site (across Europe)
* You will join a young, flexible and dynamic scale-up focused on data-driven marketing strategy & solutions
* You will be part of a team managing challenging customer data projects for large international organisations
* You will have the opportunity to develop your skills & knowledge in a challenging and fast-growing domain. Where needed you will be guided & trained by senior experts.
* Frequent training & education is provided, regarding latest data technologies or innovative analytics use cases

title: Product Lead
description:
**About MAG (in brief!)**
 At MAG Interactive we make mobile games that feel good. As a part of this fun and dynamic industry, it’s our mission to spread joy to players around the world. With over 350 million downloads globally, we credit our success to our awesome colleagues and we hope you'll join the team!
   

  

**The Role - Product Lead**
 We are looking for a Product Lead to join one of our live game teams here at MAG. In this role, you’ll help nurture the game’s vision, set inspiring goals, and guide the team toward creating experiences our players truly love.
   

  

 Teamwork is at the heart of everything we do at MAG. As Product Lead, you’ll support your teammates by bringing clarity, helping to prioritize tasks, and encouraging collaboration so that together you can find the best solutions. Your curiosity, analytical skills, and care for our players will give you a clear, big-picture view of the game, helping the team make thoughtful and impactful decisions.
   

  

 You’ll also be the bridge between your team and the rest of the studio by sharing insights, celebrating progress, and making sure everyone’s aligned. This role is perfect for someone who enjoys being at the center of the action, thrives on collaboration, and loves the idea of keeping a much-loved live game fresh, fun, and rewarding for our players.
   

  

**What You’ll Be Doing:**
**Communicating vision and goals**
* Shape and share an inspiring vision for the game, making sure goals reflect both player needs and business objectives.
* Keep the team and stakeholders aligned and moving in the same direction.


**Planning and guiding the roadmap**
* Build and maintain a clear roadmap with the team, translating vision into achievable plans.
* Help prioritize through stand-ups, retros, and planning sessions, keeping focus on what matters most.
* Keep the backlog organized so the team can deliver smoothly.


**Driving progress and supporting delivery**
* Track progress against goals, ensuring milestones and live game improvements stay on course.
* Make thoughtful decisions to keep updates on schedule—finding the right balance between quality and timely delivery, so polishing doesn’t outweigh progress.
* Spot challenges early, solve problems quickly, and make sure the team has what they need to succeed.
* Encourage continuous improvements in how the team collaborates and delivers.


**Connecting the dots across the studio**
* Act as the bridge between your team and the wider studio, sharing updates and celebrating wins.
* Work closely with teams such as Marketing, UA, Backend, BI, and Management to align efforts, manage dependencies, and keep everyone moving forward together.


**Championing teamwork and team health**
* Foster a supportive, collaborative team culture where ideas and learning are encouraged.
* While 1:1s sit with the Head of Production, you’ll play a key role in day-to-day care and support making sure that the team is happy and working well together.


**Skills and Experience:**
* Experience in the games industry, with live games involving regular updates, new features, and ongoing improvements.
* A proactive and resourceful mindset, with the ability to prioritize effectively and adapt when challenges arise.
* Background in roles such as Producer, Game Designer, Product Owner, or Product Manager, with experience guiding teams and supporting collaboration.
* Comfortable shaping roadmaps, setting inspiring goals, and maintaining a clear game vision.
* Skilled in project management tools (we use Click-Up, but Jira or similar is welcome).
* Strong relationship-builder who enjoys working closely with teams like BI, Marketing, and Design.
* Curious and analytical, able to combine insights from multiple sources to guide decisions.
* A collaborative team player who thrives in small, close-knit environments.
* A genuine passion for games, especially mobile.


**Bonus Skills**
* Experience with in-game economies in F2P games.
* An eye for spotting opportunities and analyzing the overall “health” of a live game.


**Perks and Benefits:**
* Generous company bonus
* Company mobile phone and contract
* Favorable pension and private health insurance package
* Flexible work hours
* Seasonal kick-offs
* Gym allowance
* Generous learning and development budget
* Monthly after works
* Enhanced parental leave
