You´ll be joining a team of diverse innovators, all driven to go beyond the status quo to craft what comes next.
   

  

**What happens once you apply?**
 Click Here to find all you need to know about what our typical hiring process looks like.
   

  

 Encouraging a diverse and inclusive organization is core to our values at Ericsson, that's why we champion it in everything we do. We truly believe that by collaborating with people with different experiences we drive innovation, which is essential for our future growth. We encourage people from all backgrounds to apply and realize their full potential as part of our Ericsson team. Ericsson is proud to be an Equal Opportunity Employer. learn more.
   

  

**Primary country and city:** 
 Sweden (SE) || Göteborg
   

  

**Req ID:** 
 771638

title: Nordea Investment Banking - Capital Markets internship spring 2026
description:
**Job ID: 30679**
 We are looking for ambitious and talented individuals to join our Debt Solutions and Capital Markets teams for a 20 weeks full-time internship in Stockholm, an unique opportunity to gain hands-on experience in one of the leading financial institutions in the Nordic region.
   

  

**About Our Team**
 Meet the Debt Solutions and Capital Markets teams. Our role is to arrange, structure, underwrite and execute a variety of financing transactions for Corporate clients. We offer our clients a broad range of financing solutions including syndicated, club and bilateral loans, investment grade and high yield bonds, as well as capital structure advisory.
   

  

 Our Debt Solutions and Capital Markets teams are part of Nordea Investment Banking, comprising around 100 professionals located across our offices in Stockholm, Copenhagen, Helsinki, and Oslo. We work closely with other divisions within Nordea, ensuring seamless and comprehensive services to our clients.
   

  

 Collaboration. Ownership. Passion. Courage. These are the values that guide us in how we work and how we make decisions – and that we imagine you share with us.
   

  

**Main responsibilities in this role:**
* Explore Financial Markets: Gain hands-on experience in credit analysis, financial modeling and debt capital markets
* Collaborate on Real Projects: Work with experienced colleagues on live deals, from creating sales pitch materials to structuring complex debt financings
* Build a Strong Foundation: Develop a competitive skill set that will serve you throughout your career, whether you continue in investment banking or explore other financial paths


**Who You Are**
 This is the right role for you if you are proactive, self-driven and eager to learn. You thrive in a fast-paced, collaborative environment and are passionate about Capital Markets. You are ready to take ownership of tasks while working as part of a team to deliver outstanding results.
   

  

**Your background and skills include:**
* Bachelors degree in Finance, Economics, Business or a similar field is a prerequisite. It would be ideal if you are enrolled in a Master’s degree
* Curiosity & Passion: You have a genuine interest in finance and are excited to contribute your unique perspective
* Strong Academic Background: You’re committed to excellence in your studies and ready to apply your knowledge in a real-world setting
* Analytical & Strategic Thinking: You enjoy diving into data and solving complex problems
* Team Player: You thrive in collaborative environments and are eager to learn from others


 You also need to be fluent in Swedish and English. The role is based in Stockholm, and you will be part of our pan-Nordic team of highly skilled professionals who always walk the extra mile to provide our clients with best possible advice and service.
   

  

**What We Offer**
**People** 
 come here when they want to get somewhere. For some, it’s to take their career to the next level. For others, it’s to break new ground within their area of expertise – in other words, with us, you will always move forward.
   

  

**A culture** 
 that fosters performance and growth in one of the largest Nordic banks, offering various opportunities to evolve, develop and learn from brilliant colleagues with diverse backgrounds in a vibrant working environment.
   

  

**Diversity and inclusion** 
 are a natural part of our daily work. We know that an inclusive workplace is a sustainable one. We genuinely believe that our diverse backgrounds, experiences, characteristics and traits make us stronger together. Every day we strive to find new ways to improve diversity and inclusion within our community e.g. we have signed the European Diversity Charters in the countries where we operate to show our commitment and engage with others to continue learning and improving.
   

  

 If this sounds like you, get in touch!
   

  

**Next steps**
 Submit your application no later than 30/09/2025. For more information, you’re welcome to contact Catharina Boström at catharina.bostrom@nordea.com.
   

  

**We enable dreams and aspirations for a greater good.**
**We build relationships.** 
 We add a personal touch to everything we do – when advising our customers, collaborating with colleagues, and meeting our potential candidates.
   

  

**We learn and develop.** 
 We take pride in being experts and thinking ahead. We use our expertise to meet our customers’ needs, from the simplest to the most complex. We bring a growth mindset to our work that enables us to focus on a broader perspective in our daily challenges.
   

  

**We lead change.** 
 We are responsible and aware of the impact of our decisions, both for our customers and for our local and global communities. Mindful of our responsibility towards current and future generations, we have made sustainability an integrated part of our business strategy.
   

  

**We are Nordea.** 
 We have a 200-year history of supporting and growing the Nordic economies and our values are deeply rooted in these open, progressive and collaborative societies. As one of the biggest employers in the Nordics, Poland and Estonia, you have excellent opportunities to evolve, develop and move forward with us.
   

  

 For union related information, contact Finansförbundet on finansforbundet@nordea.se or SACO on saconordea@nordea.com.

title: Software Engineer
description:
**About Us**
 At Medius, we believe managing finance should be about strategy, not stress. That same mindset shapes not only the solutions we build, but also the culture we create for our people. We remove complexity, embrace innovation, and give our teams the freedom to focus on what truly matters — whether that’s transforming the future of finance with AI or finding balance to go home on time.
   

  

 Founded in Sweden in 2001, Medius has grown from a local startup into a global leader in cloud-based spend management solutions. Today, thousands of organizations worldwide trust us to simplify accounts payable and spend management processes. Our journey has been driven by continuous innovation, a passion for technology, and above all — the people who make it happen.
   

  

 We’re more than a software company. We’re a team of problem-solvers, innovators and collaborators working together to reinvent the category of accounts payable. Our solutions use Artificial Intelligence to eliminate manual work, bring clarity, confidence, and control, and empower finance teams of the future.
   

  

**At Medius,** 
 our values guide how we work and grow together:
   

  

* Connect – We believe in the power of people—individually and collectively—and our success depends on understanding and respecting each other. We appreciate that ‘empowering finance teams of the future’ is an exciting endeavor, and we share it with everyone around us.
* Question – We enjoy the challenge of our work and the thrill of collaboration. We are not afraid to question ourselves and each other because we believe diverse perspectives can lead to better outcomes and that there is great power in resolution.
* Own – We are thorough, thoughtful, and decisive. We anticipate what’s next, what a customer might need, and then we deliver. That’s how we get things done. And that’s how we remain a leader. Customers trust us to do our job so that they can focus on what they do best.


 At Medius, you’ll join a diverse, global community where curiosity is celebrated, ideas matter, and innovation never stops. If you’re passionate about technology, eager to make an impact, and ready to grow alongside a team that lives its values, Medius is where you can do your best work — and still have time to live your best life.
   

  

 Lear more at www.medius.com
   

  

**Job Overview**
 We are looking for a Senior Software Engineer, Tech Lead, or Architect with a proven track record in building and operating cloud-native systems. The ideal candidate is an analytical problem-solver who thrives in debugging complex, distributed applications in production and is passionate about creating secure, reliable, and scalable solutions.
   

  

**Responsibilities And Duties**
* Design, develop, and operate cloud-native applications with a focus on automation and observability.
* Debug and troubleshoot complex distributed applications in production environments.
* Collaborate with cross-functional teams in an agile development environment.
* Ensure system reliability, security, and scalability are maintained across all applications.
* Contribute to architectural decisions and technology strategy, particularly around cloud-native solutions.


**Qualifications**
* Proven experience as a Senior Software Engineer, Tech Lead, or Architect.
* Strong proficiency in C# and .NET.
* Hands-on experience with cloud-native solutions, ideally including Service Fabric, AKS, Azure Storage, and Elasticsearch.
* Strong analytical and problem-solving skills for complex distributed systems.
* Familiarity with agile methodologies and cross-functional team collaboration.
* Passion for architecture, security, reliability, and scalability, with experience designing for automation and observability.

title: Product Lead
description:
**About MAG (in brief!)**
 At MAG Interactive we make mobile games that feel good. As a part of this fun and dynamic industry, it’s our mission to spread joy to players around the world. With over 350 million downloads globally, we credit our success to our awesome colleagues and we hope you'll join the team!
   

  

**The Role - Product Lead**
 We are looking for a Product Lead to join one of our live game teams here at MAG. In this role, you’ll help nurture the game’s vision, set inspiring goals, and guide the team toward creating experiences our players truly love.
   

  

 Teamwork is at the heart of everything we do at MAG. As Product Lead, you’ll support your teammates by bringing clarity, helping to prioritize tasks, and encouraging collaboration so that together you can find the best solutions. Your curiosity, analytical skills, and care for our players will give you a clear, big-picture view of the game, helping the team make thoughtful and impactful decisions.
   

  

 You’ll also be the bridge between your team and the rest of the studio by sharing insights, celebrating progress, and making sure everyone’s aligned. This role is perfect for someone who enjoys being at the center of the action, thrives on collaboration, and loves the idea of keeping a much-loved live game fresh, fun, and rewarding for our players.
   

  

**What You’ll Be Doing:**
**Communicating vision and goals**
* Shape and share an inspiring vision for the game, making sure goals reflect both player needs and business objectives.
* Keep the team and stakeholders aligned and moving in the same direction.


**Planning and guiding the roadmap**
* Build and maintain a clear roadmap with the team, translating vision into achievable plans.
* Help prioritize through stand-ups, retros, and planning sessions, keeping focus on what matters most.
* Keep the backlog organized so the team can deliver smoothly.


**Driving progress and supporting delivery**
* Track progress against goals, ensuring milestones and live game improvements stay on course.
* Make thoughtful decisions to keep updates on schedule—finding the right balance between quality and timely delivery, so polishing doesn’t outweigh progress.
* Spot challenges early, solve problems quickly, and make sure the team has what they need to succeed.
* Encourage continuous improvements in how the team collaborates and delivers.


**Connecting the dots across the studio**
* Act as the bridge between your team and the wider studio, sharing updates and celebrating wins.
* Work closely with teams such as Marketing, UA, Backend, BI, and Management to align efforts, manage dependencies, and keep everyone moving forward together.


**Championing teamwork and team health**
* Foster a supportive, collaborative team culture where ideas and learning are encouraged.
* While 1:1s sit with the Head of Production, you’ll play a key role in day-to-day care and support making sure that the team is happy and working well together.


**Skills and Experience:**
* Experience in the games industry, with live games involving regular updates, new features, and ongoing improvements.
* A proactive and resourceful mindset, with the ability to prioritize effectively and adapt when challenges arise.
* Background in roles such as Producer, Game Designer, Product Owner, or Product Manager, with experience guiding teams and supporting collaboration.
* Comfortable shaping roadmaps, setting inspiring goals, and maintaining a clear game vision.
* Skilled in project management tools (we use Click-Up, but Jira or similar is welcome).
* Strong relationship-builder who enjoys working closely with teams like BI, Marketing, and Design.
* Curious and analytical, able to combine insights from multiple sources to guide decisions.
* A collaborative team player who thrives in small, close-knit environments.
* A genuine passion for games, especially mobile.


**Bonus Skills**
* Experience with in-game economies in F2P games.
* An eye for spotting opportunities and analyzing the overall “health” of a live game.


**Perks and Benefits:**
* Generous company bonus
* Company mobile phone and contract
* Favorable pension and private health insurance package
* Flexible work hours
* Seasonal kick-offs
* Gym allowance
* Generous learning and development budget
* Monthly after works
* Enhanced parental leave
* Company wide carbon off-setting and CSR initiatives


**At MAG, we want all of our employees to feel valued, appreciated and empowered to bring their true selves to work!**
**Our recruitment processes are designed to prevent bias and discrimination against people regardless of; gender identity or expression, sexual orientation, religion, ethnicity, age, neurodiversity, disability status, or any other aspect.**

title: SEB’s Corporate & Investment Banking Summer Internship 2026 – Legal Department
description:
Are you ready to explore the dynamic world of banking and finance? Step into the world of banking and finance with SEB’s Corporate & Investment Banking (CIB) division. This summer internship offers a unique opportunity to gain hands-on experience, take on real responsibilities, and make a meaningful impact — all while working within our CIB Legal Department in Stockholm.
   

  

 The programme kicks off with an engaging Introduction Week, where you’ll get to know SEB, meet professionals across the CIB division, and start building your network.
   

  

 Throughout the internship, you’ll be supported by a dedicated tutor and collaborate with internal stakeholders. We wrap up the experience with a Closing Day to reflect, share, and celebrate your journey.
   

  

**What You Will Do**
 Being a lawyer within SEB’s division CIB means working closely with the business units to provide legal advice, produce documentation for the various products and services offered to customers and handle governance and business development matters in an international environment.
   

  

 CIB Legal is the division’s in-house legal department which provides high quality business enhancing legal services to all business units within the division, based on such units’ and customers’ various needs and requirements. The key responsibilities as a lawyer includes advising and liaising with business units, structuring, reviewing, drafting and negotiating agreements and various other legal documentation and engaging in legal research and business development projects.
   

  

**Who are you?**
 To be successful in your internship with us, you need to have a genuine interest in financial markets, finance- and banking law and corporate law. You are a service-minded team player with a constructive and solution-oriented mindset combined with high integrity. To have completed at least four semesters of the law degree before the internship start is required, as well as excellent skills in spoken and written Swedish and English.
   

  

**About**
**Learn more about working at SEB www.sebgroup.com/career**
 It is our fundamental belief that inclusion and diversity is crucial for our future success. We strive to have an inclusive, value-driven culture where employees feel valued, respected and involved irrespective of who they are, what they believe in or where they come from.
   

  

**Welcome with your application**
 Make sure to include your CV (not LinkedIn profile), cover letter and grade transcripts (university and high school). The cover letter shall be in English, all other documents may be in Swedish. Applications without an attached CV will not be considered. Please submit your application as soon as possible, but no later than October 12th, 2025 at 23:59 CET. The internship is paid. If you have questions about the recruitment process, please contact Astrid Henriksson, astrid.henriksson@seb.se

title: Quantitative Analyst to Market Quants
company_industry: Financial Services and IT Services and IT Consulting
description:
**Job Description**
*We are seeking a passionate Front Office Quantitative Analyst to join our Stockholm office. Join our Markets Quant Centre of Excellence and shape the future of quantitative analytics at Danske Bank!*
 The Markets Quant Centre of Excellence at Danske Bank is a highly motivated team working with applied mathematics in the financial industry. Our team is at the forefront of our field and has an international vibe with approximately 40 employees from various nationalities working out of Copenhagen, Stockholm, and Vilnius.
   

  

**About Us**
 The Quant Centre of Excellence is part of the Markets Cluster development organization. Located on the trading floor, we are responsible for the full stack of development, from problem formulation and equation solving to numerical implementation of solutions for pricing, quoting, and risk management applications.
   

  

 Quants at Danske provide top-quality industry-level analytics, unified across asset classes using our award-winning pricing and risk management library, SuperFly. Our analytics and solutions support efficient Fixed-income, Foreign Exchange, and Equity Derivatives trading and are used in various businesses and purposes, such as XVA, Loans, Treasury, Market Risk, Regulatory, and settlements.
   

  

 Qualified candidates will join a motivated team at a time when the bank is scaling its platform and expanding our market-leading trading franchise and quantitative setup. We believe the coming years will be exciting and rewarding, offering a wealth of possibilities and experience.
   

  

**About The Role**
 This position offers a rare opportunity to join our Stockholm office. You will sit on the trading floor and engage daily with Sweden’s leading Fixed Income and/or Equity Derivatives trading division office. You will be one of two to three Quants on site and will work closely with the rest of the Quant and IT teams, mainly located in Copenhagen. Supported by leading industry analytics, you will develop solutions and workflows for pricing and risk management.
   

  

**What Are We Looking For?**
 We seek open-minded and committed candidates with a collaborative spirit and strong work ethic. You possess strong skills in combining Mathematics, Finance, and Programming and are comfortable with:
   

  

* Probability theory, stochastic analysis, and partial differential equations, with an intuitive approach to mathematical analysis and modelling
* Financial markets modelling, ideally with experience in derivatives pricing
* Programming in Python and C++ or C#


 You enjoy practical problem-solving, numerical implementation, and application building. Typically, this is demonstrated through an MSc or PhD in a relevant subject.
   

  

**Interested?**
 For further information, please reach out to Johan Hydén hyd@danskebank.dk, Head of FIC Quant Applications.
   

  

  

  

 We are going through applications on an ongoing basis, so do not hesitate – apply for the position right away!
   

  

 Last day to apply is 23rd of September. We look forward to your application!
   

  

**About Us**
 Danske Bank is a Nordic bank with bridges to the world around us. For 150 years, we have supported people and businesses in releasing their potential. A career with us is an opportunity to join a community of 22,000 colleagues in a culture where we are committed to Teaming Up, Owning It and Being Open. Together, we are on a journey to transform Danske Bank into a better bank. For our customers, our employees and the societies around us.

title: Influence - Bloom 26
description:
We are now recruiting for our graduate program, Bloom, starting September 2026. The program will kickstart your career and provide you with great opportunities as you begin your journey to become a successful management consultant, colleague, and leader. You’ll learn the craft alongside some of the best, most experienced consultants in the business and get the chance to explore our research-based method for creating value - Collective Intelligence.
 



  





**Who are we looking for?** 




 Management consultants at Influence are driven by solving complex problems for our clients, have a great interest in human behavior and how we best can leverage our different skills and experiences.
 



 We are looking for individuals who are courageous, curious, entrepreneurial, and have great analytical skills.
 



 The role is best fit for a creative team player who wants to be involved in developing effective collaborations.
 



 You have a higher education at master’s level or equivalent studies or experience.
 



 You can communicate fluently in both Swedish and English.
 



  





**About Influence** 




 Influence is a management consultancy company leading the way - for a wiser tomorrow. Combining strategic thinking and realization ability, we help our clients with complex challenges. Through research in Collective Intelligence, we create high impact with sustainable results through creating teams that thrive. We have the privilege of working with some of Sweden's largest organizations, helping them realize their potential and develop their capabilities. Our primary delivery areas are strategy development and execution, maximizing the effect of transformations and implementations, organizing for adaptiveness, and customer-centric business development. Influence is constantly evolving, but our core in all we do stays firm – Genuine Hearts, Great Minds and Sustainable Results.
 



  





**About Bloom** 




 Bloom is a unique, two-year tailored career development program. It’s a true people-centric learning journey: a chance to develop your skills and grow toward your goals by working on complex, challenging projects for our most exciting clients. Bloom offers you extensive, experience-based training as you learn and craft alongside some of the best, most respected consultants in the business. During the program, you will have a mentor that will support you in developing your consulting skills. Our peer-to-peer leadership culture means we welcome new opinions: you’ll be involved from day one in business development discussions and strategic planning, emboldened to ask difficult questions, and encouraged to explore your own entrepreneurial ideas as you create your own path to success. In short, we’ll give you everything you need to bloom.
 



 Influence runs Bloom together with our affiliate companies in Newground Alliance. You will be an Influence employee and regularly get opportunities to share and discuss experiences and ideas with other participants working across Newground Alliance. The alliance consists of independent niche consulting companies based in Stockholm with clients around the world. This means you’ll be able to build a broad and solid foundation in consulting.
 



 Does Influence sound like a good match for your profile? Apply now!
 



  





**About The Recruitment Process** 




 The Application period opens 15th Sept. Candidates will enter our initial qualification process, which is done continuously.
 **The application period** 
 ends October 12.
 


* Initial qualification phase: Online personality and logic test as well as 1st interview (incl. case)
* Successful candidates are invited to a recruitment day, during November.
* Final qualification phase: Preference test and CEO interview



  





 We expect to sign our next Bloom colleagues in mid-December. If you have any questions about the program, our company, or the recruitment process, you are welcome to contact talent@influence.se
 



 #InfluenceAB

title: Copy of Engineering Manager
description:
**OM ROLLEN**
 Vi söker en Engineering Manager / Utvecklingschef Som konsult hos oss arbetar du med en bred variation av kunder och branscher. Vi delar med oss av vår kompetens och inspirerar med vår passion för agilt ledarskap och agil utvecklingsmetodik. Är du redo att leda och inspirera lösningsorienterade utvecklare, designers, testare och agila ledare? Vill du vara en del av en innovativ arbetsplats där dina idéer och din expertis spelar en central roll i företagets framgång?
   

  

 Som vår Engineering Manager kommer du att:
   

  

* Leda och coacha ett team av utvecklare, designers, testare och agila ledare.
* Ansvara för att planera, genomföra och följa upp projekt.
* Samarbeta nära med produktägare och andra avdelningar för att säkerställa att våra lösningar möter kundens behov.
* Driva teknisk innovation och kontinuerlig förbättring av arbetsprocesser.


**ERFARENHET**
* Personalhantering med gedigen erfarenhet av ledarskap och mentorskap
* Erfarenhet från antingen Scale-up bolag eller större organisationer
* Bakgrund inom mjukvaruutveckling eller produktutveckling
* Du har lett utvecklingsteam med högt tempo
* Du är van att leda "one-to-one" och "one-to-many"-kommunikation med förmågan att göra strategi levande
* Du är en emaptisk personalchef som håller dina löften och tror på transparens när du kommunicerar med teamet och andra intressenter
* Du drivs av att göra det möjligt för människor att utvecklas och bli mer effektiva på vad de gör
* Gedigen erfarenhet av att praktisera/implementera Agila metoder i utvecklingsteam
* Utvecklingschef / Engineering Manager


**VI ERBJUDER**
* En dynamisk och inkluderande arbetsmiljö.
* Möjligheter till personlig och professionell utveckling.
* Konkurrenskraftig lön och förmåner.
* Flexibla arbetstider och möjlighet till distansarbete.

title: Analyst at PIR - Bloom 26
description:
Starting your career is an exciting time, you get the opportunity to think of what happens next and what kind of future you want. In the fall of 2026, we at Procure It Right (PIR) offer graduates a rocket-start to a consulting career with Newground Alliance Bloom graduate program
   

  

**WHO ARE WE?**
 PIR is a boutique management consultancy specializing in Procurement & Supply Chain. With extensive expertise in Cost Optimization, Procurement Transformation and Sustainability, we help our clients do better business with their suppliers. With a firm belief that developing the right types of relationships is essential for effective allocation of tomorrow’s resources.
   

  

 PIR is a part of Newground Alliance, an alliance of niche consultancy experts united by a shared belief in a new way of management consulting. By joining us at PIR, you will also be part of Newground's Bloom graduate program.
   

  

**WHO ARE WE LOOKING FOR?**
**Role**
 We are looking for exceptionally talented and service-minded people who, just like us, want to create value and commit to the success of our clients. At PIR, we expect you to be a team player, initiative-taker, and value-adder to our clients through delivery of Procurement & Supply Chain projects. You are comfortable with sharing your opinion and you are excited to shape the future of PIR. You probably have a master's degree in engineering and/or economics from a university in Sweden or abroad. To be successful in your role you possess:
   

  

* Excellent analytical skills
* Curiosity and a desire to learn & develop
* Exceptional collaboration and communication skills, and the ability to work effectively in a team
* Fluent verbal and written communication skills in Swedish & English


**WHAT CAN YOU EXPECT?**
 As an Analyst at PIR, you are part of Bloom – the graduate consultancy development program from the Newground Alliance companies. It’s a unique, people-centric learning journey providing young consultants with everything they need to begin a successful career.
   

  

 Instead of classroom learning, Bloom is a true consulting apprenticeship. From day one you’ll work on real projects with real clients together with your PIR and Newground colleagues. You’ll learn your craft alongside some of the best, most experienced consultants in the business – and get the chance to make suggestions, shake things up and forge your own career path.
   

  

 With regular opportunities to share and discuss with your network within Newground, Bloom is more than just a first job: it’s a broad and solid foundation for a consulting career in any sector. And it’s a chance to work and grow in an environment where you can bloom and keep on blooming. For as far as your talent will take you.
   

  

 We are ready to invest in your future by supporting you as far as your abilities, enthusiasm and dedication can take you. We are ready to help you bloom. Are you?
   

  

**DO YOU WANT TO MAKE A DIFFERENCE WITH US?**
**Our recruitment process is ongoing** 
 and the last day to apply is
 **the** 
**19th of October** 
 . Do you have questions about the role, our company, the recruitment process, or just want to have an informal digital fika with one of last year’s graduates, please contact anton.andersson@procureitright.com
   

  

 #ProcureItRight
   

  

*Please note that if you apply to more than one Bloom role within Newground Alliance, your assessment results may be shared internally across our group of companies as part of the Bloom Program. This is done solely to support your application process. For more details on how we use and protect your data, please see our Privacy Notice here.*

title: Senior Data Engineer to Sogeti Stockholm
description:
Sogeti Stockholm is hiring semi-senior/senior Data Engineers to be part of a team with a major client in the banking and finance sector. Do you enjoy challenges and want to be part of Sogeti and our customer on the journey into the future of Data and BI?
   

  

 Then this opportunity is the next step for you!
   

  

**Job Description:**
 We are looking for more senior members to grow the team of sharp consultants who want to be involved in building and developing future solutions. We strongly believe that the future is very much about Data Management, and by working with Data/BI, you will play a key role and, together with your colleagues, develop innovative solutions for our customer.
   

  

**In this role you will play a key role in:**
* Building and delivering solutions for large data sets based on customer needs.
* Working closely with others in the team and finding new ways to do things.
* Seeing opportunities where others see problems and thriving in a dynamic environment where there’s always something happening.
* Working independently within your area while also being eager to learn from others or help elevate the group's knowledge.
* Setting up and developing new data warehouse solutions and pipelines.
* Driving migration from on-prem to cloud and handling enormous amounts of data.


**Your Profile:**
* At least 5 years of experience as a Data Engineer.
* Experience with technologies such as SQL, Teradata, Informatica, Mainframe, ODI, and Ab Initio.
* Fluent in Swedish or English, both spoken and written.
* Experience working in an international environment.
* Experience working with CI/CD pipelines (e.g., Jenkins, Azure DevOps).
* Knowledge of Microsoft Services and SOAP/REST-based services and tools.
* Experience working with AI-driven test tools or frameworks, such as tools for generating test cases based on machine learning.
* Independent, proactive, and a problem solver who balances details with a holistic perspective.


**What we believe you will enjoy about working here:**
* Innovative environment: With us, you get the chance to work with the latest technology and be part of a dynamic team that loves to create value through innovation.
* Career development: We care about your future and offer development programs and certifications in the latest technologies so that you can grow and become the best version of yourself.
* Flexible work: We understand that life is more than just work. Therefore, we offer opportunities for remote work and flexible working hours so that you can feel good and thrive.
* Team spirit: We are like a big family with a great team spirit. By living by our values of courage, passion, teamwork, and entrepreneurship, we create a work environment where everyone can thrive.


**Application:**
 We warmly welcome your application today, selection is ongoing! If you have questions about the position or the recruitment process, please contact Team Manager Johan Alsén at: johan.alsen@sogeti.se
   

  

 As we step into the summer season and many of us take some well-deserved time off, things might move a little slower than usual. But don’t worry — we’ll get back to you as soon as we’re back from vacation! Thank you so much for your patience and for showing interest in Sogeti. We truly appreciate it and wish you a wonderful summer filled with sunshine, relaxation, and joy!
   

  

**About Us**
 Sogeti Sweden, part of the Capgemini Group, with 21 offices and 1300 employees, creates business value with technology for organizations that need to implement innovation quickly and that want a local partner with global scalability. With a hands-on culture and proximity to customers, Sogeti implements solutions that help organizations work faster, better, and smarter. By combining agility and fast implementation through a DevOps approach, Sogeti delivers innovative solutions in testing and quality assurance, the cloud, and systems development, enhanced by AI, data, and automation.

title: Growth Marketer
description:
**About Qasa**
 Qasa was founded in 2014 out of frustration with a housing market that simply didn’t work for everyone. We believe in housing equality — that everyone deserves a safe and fair place to live. That’s why we’re building smarter, safer rental experiences that make it easier for people to find their place. Today, Qasa is Sweden’s largest home rental service, — and we're now growing fast in Finland and Norway. With us, you’ll be part of our ambition to tackle the housing crisis and create more opportunities for people — one rental at a time.
   

  

**About The Role**
 We are seeking a Growth Marketer with a blend of analytical thinking and a strong interest in data-driven decision-making — someone who’s ready to take the lead on performance marketing while also setting up and driving growth marketing initiatives across the full customer journey. If you’re currently in a performance-focused role and have already begun expanding into growth tactics like lifecycle marketing, this could be the perfect next step. You’ll gain ownership and the opportunity to make a significant impact on our growth.
   

  

* Immediate priority: Own and optimise paid acquisition


 You’ll work closely with our Head of Marketing and Performance Agency to take charge and optimise our paid performance efforts in all our markets (Sweden, Finland, Norway). Your goal is to drive digital acquisition, identify areas for improvement, and maximise ROAS.
   

  

* Next Step: Help build our Growth Marketing engine


 As you become more embedded in Qasa, you’ll transition to a broader growth marketing role—identifying opportunities across the entire user journey (acquisition, activation, retention, and referral) as well as helping shape the tools, tech stack, and processes that support it. You’ll translate insights into strategy and execution to drive customer lifecycle improvements.
   

  

**Your experience:**
**Core Skills & Requirements**
* Hands-on experience from roles such as performance marketing manager, e-com manager or similar roles from in-house or agencies
* Strong analytical mindset — confident using data to inform decisions
* Experienced with tools like Google Analytics, Amplitude
* Comfortable with experimentation and iteration — testing, learning, and optimising growth channel


**Growth Experience We’re Looking For**
 These reflect the kind of experience you need as the role evolves:
   

  

* Proven track record of owning both paid performance and at least two other growth levers (SEO, CRO, lifecycle marketing, referral, etc.).
* Experience setting up growth processes, tools, and frameworks without heavy internal support.
* Comfortable collaborating directly with product and tech to drive growth initiatives.


**Why join us?**
 This role is perfect for someone eager to transition from performance marketing into a broader growth marketing role. You'll have ownership, allowing you to make an impact and grow alongside the company.
   

  

**Location:** 
 Stockholm, Medborgarplatsen.
   

  

**Language:** 
 You’ll need to be fluent in English. If you also speak Swedish, Finnish, or Norwegian — even better.
   

  

 Please note that we are reviewing applications continuously.

title: Senior Fullstack Data Engineer
description:
Vi har nu ett nytt behov och söker därför en konsultkollega med nedan kvalifikationer. Tjänsten är en del av vår konsultverksamhet vilket innebär att du blir anställd av oss och arbetar hos kund alt. interna projekt och åtaganden.
   

  

**Din profil (Skall krav)**
* Flera års erfarenhet som Data Engineer/Utvecklare inom Business Intelligence
* Gedigen erfarenhet av SQL
* Erfarenhet av Databricks i kombination med dbt
* Erfarenhet av Microsofts produkter SQL Server on-prem och Azure SQL
* Erfarenhet av Power BI, gärna även CI/CD för rapportdistribution
* Erfarenhet av CI/CD-pipelines i Azure DevOps, GitHub Actions eller motsvarande
* Erfarenhet av modellering enligt Kimball eller Inmon
* Flytande svenska och engelska i tal och skrift


**Meriterande**
* Erfarenhet av design och lösningsarkitektur
* Erfarenhet av Medallion Architecture (bronze, silver, gold) eller motsvarande
* Kunskap om Infrastructure as Code (Terraform/ Bicep) och Databricks Asset Bundles
* Erfarenhet av Python
* Erfarenhet av automatiserade tester och datakvalitetskontroller
* Dokumenterad erfarenhet av DevOps-principer
* Erfarenhet av Data governance och säkerhet i molnet
* Erfarenhet från större organisationer


**Sista ansökningdatum:** 
 24-09-2025
   

  

**Om Deploja**
 Vi sysselsätter idag erfarna konsulter, inom bl.a. Systemutveckling, Test, Arkitektur, IT-Projektledning, IT-Säkerhet.
   

  

 Att jobba på Deploja är något helt annat än att arbeta på ett vanligt konsultbolag – och det är vi riktigt stolta över. Vad är det då som gör oss unika?
   

  

 Vi erbjuder helt enkelt mer än bara hög lön och större frihet, det är bara början. Hos oss hittar du den arbetsmiljö och de möjligheter du förtjänar. Välkommen till Deploja, där gräset faktiskt är grönare!
   

  

**Vi erbjuder dig följande, Valet är ditt!**
 🚀 Spännande uppdrag hos våra många kunder. Vi fokuserar på långsiktiga uppdrag, vilket ger dig möjlighet att skapa värde för kunden samtidigt som du utvecklas själv.
   

  

 🌟 En trygg månadslön – tillsammans bestämmer vi en grundlön baserad på dina uppdrag.
   

  

 🚗 Tjänstebil – vi uppmuntrar dig att välja en elbil för en mer hållbar framtid.
   

  

 💼 Tjänstepension och stora möjligheter till löneväxling.
   

  

 🌴 Semester - Önskar du mer än 30 dagar semester, kanske 60 dagar?
   

  

 🏥 Privat sjukvårdsförsäkring, olycksfallsförsäkring och livförsäkring för ökad trygghet.
   

  

 📚 Kompetensutveckling – du får själv sätta din budget och välja vilka utbildningar du vill delta i.
   

  

 🕑 Livskvalitet - Har du kanske svårt att få ihop pusslet i vardagen och önskar arbeta lite mindre och ändå kunna tjäna lika mycket om inte mer?
   

  

* Vi hanterar ansökningar löpande, med hänsyn till höga arbetstrycket är det extra viktigt med en kort motivering för tjänsten som förklarar hur man möter kraven.

title: MAIT Manager - OHB Sweden
description:
**OHB Sweden develop, build, test, and commission satellites and subsystems for space missions in areas such as communication, Earth observation, and space research for institutional and commercial customers within and outside Europe.**
 Join our dynamic team as an enthusiastic and dedicated MAIT Manager to oversee our production and testing operations (MAIT: Manufacturing, Assembly, Integration, Test). We are seeking a team player who can work independently to meet project needs and requirements. You should be organized, meticulous, quality-conscious, and positive. Problem-solving and initiative are essential qualities, along with a pragmatic approach to maintaining quality and meeting deadlines. The role involves regular international travel, 1–5 trips per year.
   

  

**Your Tasks:**
* Plan and organize daily project work in spacecraft production in a structured and efficient manner with a forward-looking perspective.
* Lead and motivate production teams.
* Act as the internal and customer contact.
* Solve technical problems.
* Actively develop and improve processes.
* Write technical documentation in English.
* Work largely independent.


**Your Qualifications:**
* Engineering degree, ideally in the aerospace industry.
* Good planning skills.
* Strong quality and cost awareness.
* Excellent communication skills and a strong sense of responsibility.
* Enjoy working with sensitive components.
* Very good knowledge of written and spoken English.
* Legal authorization to work in Sweden.
* At least 5 years work experience in industries with high-quality standards such as aerospace or medical equipment.


**Advantageous:**
* Experience working in clean rooms.
* Experience handling highly sensitive and valuable products.
* Knowledge of aerospace standards and requirements.


**Why Join Us?** 
 Be part of a forward-thinking team that is shaping the future of space exploration. We offer a collaborative work environment, opportunities for professional growth, and the chance to work on innovative projects.
   

  

 We welcome candidates from other countries to apply. When hiring, we follow Export control's rules, which are based on your country of birth. This is not something we at OHB cant affect at all, is regulated by Export control and we need to follow it.

title: Demand Generation Content Manager
description:
The opportunity ✨
   

  

 Waitwhile is on a mission to eliminate the 1 trillion hours people spend waiting in lines every year. Our industry leading queue management and appointment scheduling platform empowers businesses to streamline their operations and deliver exceptional customer experiences.
   

  

 Waitwhile is trusted by 10,000 companies worldwide and has helped more than 250 million people enjoy a radically better waiting experience at places like IKEA, Louis Vuitton, Costco, Delta Airlines, Tribeca Film Festival and many more.
   

  

 In this role, you’ll be responsible for building scalable content marketing programs and campaigns to drive awareness, consideration, adoption, and expansion from our largest Enterprise customers and prospects. From case studies to white papers, you'll lead the charge to equip Waitwhile with content that's tailored to our Enterprise buyer profiles.
   

  

 You’ll also be a major contributor to broader cross-functional campaigns, working closely with other teams, including Product, Customer Success, and Sales.
   

  

 What you'll be doing 🚀
   

  

 Content & SEO Strategy
   

  

* Develop and execute a consistent content marketing and SEO plan aligned with growth goals to drive organic traffic and inbound leads.
* Create a high-quality content drumbeat (blog posts, case studies, white papers, ebooks, press releases, explainer video scripts, and other types of collateral) that resonates with key decision-makers in Enterprise B2B SaaS.
* Optimize website content to improve rankings and increase discoverability for high-intent keywords.
* Work cross-functionally to ensure content aligns with the buyer’s journey and is effectively distributed to reach decision-makers at the right time.


 Sales & Demand Generation Support
   

  

* Develop conversion-focused content that supports demand generation campaigns, email marketing, top, middle, & bottom of funnel conversion, and sales enablement efforts.
* Support Account-Based Marketing (ABM) initiatives by helping craft personalized content for high-value Enterprise accounts.
* Collaborate with Sales teams to align content efforts with ABM campaigns, ensuring messaging resonates with key accounts.
* Work closely with the Sales and Customer Success teams to create targeted content that accelerates the sales cycle and nurtures leads.
* Assist in the development of vertical-specific messaging that aligns with our key industries.


 Social Media & Thought Leadership
   

  

* Manage and grow Waitwhile’s social media presence (LinkedIn, YouTube, Twitter/X, Tik Tok) by creating and curating engaging content for B2B audiences.
* Stay updated on social media trends and platform algorithms to optimize organic social strategies.
* Engage with the B2B community, influencers, and potential clients to build brand authority and foster relationships.


 PR & Brand Awareness
   

  

* Support PR efforts to increase media coverage and industry recognition.
* Explore opportunities to partner with industry events, podcasts, and blogs to expand brand reach.


**What Skills You Need 📖**
* 2+ years of experience in content marketing, SEO, or demand generation (B2B SaaS preferred).
* Strong writing and storytelling skills in content marketing, including social media, writing/editing long-form and short-form content that engages and converts.
* Strategy and execution experience in demand generation, including content for lead magnets, campaign funnels and lead scoring, personalized nurture journeys, and sales enablement.
* Knowledge of enterprise sales cycles and content’s role in the buying journey.
* Experience with SEO best practices, keyword research, and content optimization.
* Ability to think strategically while executing day-to-day content initiatives.
* Experience collaborating cross-functionally to create impactful content.
* A self-starter mentality - comfortable working in a fast-paced startup environment and wearing multiple hats.


 Bonus skills & attributes 🙌
   

  

* Familiarity with ABM strategies and crafting content for high-value accounts.
* Experience with marketing automation tools (HubSpot, Marketo, or similar).
* Previous exposure to PR or influencer marketing in a B2B setting.
* Experience incorporating AI into workflows.


 Benefits ❤️
   

  

 We want Waitwhile to be an incredible place to work. We offer great benefits and perks, flexible working hours and lots of interesting challenges. We believe in making work fun and rewarding and care about your development and are committed to your success. Our benefits & perks programs include, but are not limited to:
   

  

* Competitive salary and equity in a fast-growing start-up
* Regular compensation reviews - we reward great work!
* Great vacation policy and flexible holidays so you can take time off when you need it.
* Generally Accepted benefits plan offering customary to the employee's home country.
* A collaborative, supportive team that values curiosity, innovation, and impact.


*Waitwhile has a positive, diverse, and supportive culture - we look for people who are curious, inventive, and work to be a little better every single day. In our work together we aim to be smart, humble, hardworking and, above all, collaborative. If this sounds like a good fit for you, why not say hello?*

title: Ecom & CRM Manager
description:
**Job Purpose**
 As an E-commerce & CRM Manager, you are responsible for maintaining and optimizing the website to ensure a seamless and engaging shopping experience for our customers. This includes everything from merchandising the site and enriching product information to uploading content and ensuring the website is always up to date, on-brand, and user-friendly. Your work plays a key role in supporting online sales and delivering a smooth digital journey that reflects CHIMI’s identity and values.
   

  

**Key Responsibilities**
 In this role, you will be responsible for managing and updating product information on the website, including descriptions, images, and metadata such as titles and descriptions. You will merchandise the site to support product launches, campaigns, and seasonal changes, as well as upload and publish content such as homepage banners, landing pages, and campaign assets. To ensure a seamless customer experience, you will monitor the website daily to confirm that all pages are functioning correctly and that content is always up to date.
   

  

 You will support the execution of sales campaigns, promotions, and product launches by coordinating with logistics and operations teams to ensure product availability and accurate delivery information. On the marketing side, you will create and send newsletters, promotional emails, and automated flows, segmenting customer data to enable targeted communication. You will also monitor email performance and help optimize campaigns for engagement and conversion.
   

  

 Additionally, you will be responsible for key e-commerce KPIs such as traffic, conversion rate, and average order value. You will report bugs or issues with the website and follow up with internal or external tech teams to secure timely fixes. Collaboration will be central to your role, as you will work closely with marketing, design, operations, and customer service to align website and CRM activities, while coordinating content and campaign timing across departments.
   

  

**Qualifications**
* Degree in E-commerce or Marketing, Digital Communication.
* 2-3 years of experience in e-commerce.
* Hands-on experience with e-commerce platforms (Centra and Storyblok are a plus).
* Interest or some exposure to CRM systems (Klaviyo is a plus)
* Hands-on experience from working with and owning digital performance metrics (Traffic, conversion rate, average order value, open rate).
* Curious about how data can be used to improve customer experience and drive sales.
* Fluent in English (Swedish is a plus).


**Key Competencies**
 You have a strong attention to detail, particularly when it comes to handling product information and content, ensuring accuracy and consistency at all times. With a structured and organized approach, you are comfortable managing multiple small tasks simultaneously without losing track of priorities. Collaboration comes naturally to you, and you thrive as a team player who enjoys working closely with colleagues across marketing, design, tech, and other functions.
   

  

 You bring a proactive mindset and a willingness to learn by doing, always looking for ways to improve processes and outcomes. Commercially driven and with a clear customer-first perspective, you balance business goals with delivering value to the end user. At the same time, you are curious about exploring new tools and approaches - such as leveraging AI - to work more effectively in everyday tasks and to find smarter solutions.
   

  

**Main KPIs**
* Ecom budget
* Conversion rate
* Average order value
* Bounce rate
* Add-to-cart rate
* Retention rate
* CRM share of business


**Personal Attributes**
* Eager to learn and grow in the e-commerce and CRM space.
* Calm under pressure and able to prioritize effectively.
* Innovative and forward-thinking, with a strong interest in fashion-tech.
* Positive, proactive, and solution-oriented.
* Comfortable asking questions and taking initiative


 This role is based at our Stockholm HQ and reports to our CEO.

title: Konsult inom förvaltningsrådgivning med fokus digitalisering
description:
Har du erfarenhet av fastighetsförvaltning och gillar att driva digital utveckling?
   

  

**Är du trygg i fastighetsaffären och brinner för hur digitalisering kan förändra förvaltning och arbetssätt?** 
 Svefa söker nu en konsult inom
 **förvaltningsrådgivning** 
 till vårt kontor i Stockholm – en strategisk roll där du blir fastighetsägarens partner i både förvaltnings- och systemfrågor.
   

  

 Hos oss får du arbeta nära kunderna med
 **förändringsledning, digitalisering och utveckling av fastighetsförvaltning** 
 . Kanske arbetar du idag på en IT-avdelning inom fastighetssektorn, som projektledare med fokus på digitala lösningar, eller hos en etablerad systemleverantör och känner att du vill ta nästa steg i karriären.
   

  

 ✨ Det här erbjuder vi dig
   

  

* En plattform där du får leda förändrings- och digitaliseringsprojekt inom fastighetsförvaltning.
* Möjlighet att utvecklas i en roll som kombinerar strategi, förvaltning och systemfrågor.
* Ett team med hög kompetens inom förvaltningsrådgivning, där vi stöttar och lär av varandra.
* En kultur präglad av professionalism, engagemang och vilja att skapa verklig nytta.
* Enligt oss Stockholms finaste kontor, mitt i city, fullt av kunniga kollegor inom fastighetsrådgivning.


 🛠️ Det här kommer du göra
   

  

 Som konsult hos oss kommer du att:
   

  

* Stötta kunder i strategiska frågor kring organisation, processer och fastighetssystem.
* Leda workshops, hålla presentationer och skapa samsyn mellan förvaltare, ekonomer, tekniker och IT-specialister.
* Hjälpa kunderna i deras digitaliseringsresa, från nuläge till framtida arbetssätt.
* Delta i analyser, utredningar och implementering av nya arbetssätt och system som utvecklar kundens förvaltning och verksamhet.
* Bidra till Svefas position i branschen genom kunddialoger och medverkan i olika forum.


 📌 Mer om jobbet
   

  

 Vi arbetar med en bred mix av uppdrag där vi ofta kombinerar
 **helikopterperspektiv** 
 med att gå på djupet i specifika frågor. Det gör rollen både omväxlande och utvecklande.
   

  

 Du blir en del av vårt team inom förvaltningsrådgivning i Stockholm och kommer arbeta tillsammans med kollegor med hög kompetens och stort engagemang.
   

  

 👤 Det här söker vi
   

  

 Vi söker dig som har erfarenhet av att jobba med
 **fastighetsförvaltning** 
 i allmänhet, och
 **digitaliseringsfrågor** 
 i synnerhet, gärna på en strategisk nivå. Har du erfarenhet som konsult är det såklart meriterande, men det är inget måste. Det viktigaste är att du är trygg i att driva förändring, kan bygga förtroende hos olika målgrupper och har intresse för digitaliseringens möjligheter.
   

  

 Vi tror att du har:
   

  

* Djup erfarenhet inom fastighetsförvaltning eller närliggande roller.
* Vana av projektledning eller förändringsarbete.
* Kunskap om systemstöd och informationsflöden kopplat till förvaltning.
* God kommunikativ förmåga och trivs med att bygga och vårda relationer, både med nya och etablerade kontakter.
* Akademisk examen inom exempelvis civilingenjör, fastighetsekonomi eller IT.


 📩 Är du intresserad?
   

  

 Vad roligt! Skicka in din ansökan i form av CV och en kort motivation.
   

  

 För frågor, kontakta:
   

  

* Henrik Engqvist, affärschef – 010-603 87 39, henrik.engqvist@svefa.se
* Julia Wengse, HR-specialist – 010-603 87 42, julia.wengse@svefa.se


 Vi arbetar med löpande urval och behandlar alla ansökningar konfidentiellt. Slutkandidater genomgår tester i samarbete med AON samt bakgrundskontroll.

title: Solution Architect - Integration
description:
Choosing Capgemini means choosing a company where you will be empowered to shape your career in the way you’d like, where you’ll be supported and inspired by a collaborative community of colleagues both locally and around the world, reimagining what’s possible. For this role you will be part of the Cloud and Custom Application (C&CA) area at Capgemini, you will work with the latest technologies in Cloud, Integration, AI, and software development. We develop tailored applications and manage complex integrations to maximize the potential of technology. Join us and collaborate with the world's leading organizations to realize the full value of technology through innovative solutions.
   

  

**Your role**
 As an Integration Architect with Capgemini, you will be involved in leading the development and implementation of integration solutions, leveraging your expertise to drive platform transitions and support various transformation initiatives.
   

  

 In this role, you will play a key role in:
   

  

* Managing integrations and preferably transitioning to Azure Integration.
* Addressing general platform anxiety and facilitating moves between tech platforms.
* Conducting assessments and developing strategies to future-proof integration methods and establish Centers for Enablement.
* Supporting other transformations such as ERP to accelerate delivery.


**Your profile**
 Integration architect with at least 5 years of experience. Used to act forward leaning, and confident driver of change and/or excellence. Solution-oriented with a platform mindset. We prefer you to have a full professional proficiency in English and Swedish.
   

  

 Expert in some of these areas, and preferable handle several:
   

  

* Azure Integration
* iPaaS (MuleSoft, Boomi, Apigee)
* Open source integration
* Middleware (BizTalk, Tibco/IBM/etc)
* Nice to have, other hyperscale’s integration services e.g. AWS & GCP and of course an interest in generative AI


**Application**
 Excited to embark on a new career journey? We can't wait to hear from you! Apply now – we review applications continuously. Throughout the process, you'll have the opportunity to visit our office, meet with our hiring manager, and ask any questions you may have to our recruiter. We are committed to making your path to the job as seamless and fulfilling as possible. Are you the candidate we're searching for? We look forward to meeting you!
   

  

*As part of our recruitment process, where identity and background checks may be conducted, we kindly ask you to bring valid identification to this interview in order to verify your identity.*
**What We Belive You Will Enjoy About Working Here**
* We recognize the significance of flexible work arrangements to provide support. Be it remote work, or flexible work hours, you will get an environment to maintain healthy work life balance.
* At the heart of our mission is your career growth. Our array of career growth programs and diverse professions are crafted to support you in exploring a world of opportunities.
* Equip yourself with valuable certifications in the latest technologies
* Our Values: Honesty, Boldness, Trust, Freedom, Team spirit, Modesty and Fun


**About Capgemini**
 Capgemini is a global business and technology transformation partner, helping organizations to accelerate their dual transition to a digital and sustainable world, while creating tangible impact for enterprises and society. It is a responsible and diverse group of 340,000 team members in more than 50 countries. With its strong over 55-year heritage, Capgemini is trusted by its clients to unlock the value of technology to address the entire breadth of their business needs. It delivers end-to-end services and solutions leveraging strengths from strategy and design to engineering, all fueled by its market leading capabilities in AI, generative AI, cloud and data, combined with its deep industry expertise and partner ecosystem. The Group reported 2024 global revenues of €22.1 billion.
   

  

**Get The Future You Want** 
 | www.capgemini.com

title: Head of Sales till Camai
description:
**Driv affärer och forma framtidens IT med oss på Camai! 🚀**
 Camai är inte bara ett IT-konsultbolag; vi är en samling hjältar som tror på individens potential att göra verklig skillnad. Sedan vår etablering 2022 har vi strävat efter att inte bara leverera tjänster, utan också skapa meningsfulla möjligheter för både kunder och våra IT-experter. Nu söker vi en Head of Sales som vill vara med oss på resan mot att bli branschledande och forma framtidens IT-landskap.
   

  

**Om rollen:**
 Som Head of Sales hos Camai kommer du att spela en central roll i att driva tillväxten av vårt företag genom att utveckla befintliga kundrelationer samt identifiera nya affärsmöjligheter. Du kommer att arbeta nära dina kollegor och ha ansvar för hela försäljningsprocessen från att finna ett behov till att säkra avtal. Detta innefattar att genomföra marknadsanalyser, skapa och presentera skräddarsydda lösningar för befintliga och potentiella kunder, förhandla avtal och säkerställa att våra kunder får en förstklassig service och support genom hela säljcykeln. Utöver det operativa arbetet kommer du att arbeta strategiskt tillsammans med vår VD; för att ta Camai till nästa nivå.
   

  

 Denna roll kräver en hög grad av självständighet, initiativtagande och förmåga att arbeta i en snabbt föränderlig miljö. Du kommer att ha möjlighet att påverka och driva ditt eget arbete samtidigt som du får stöd och vägledning från vårt erfarna team.
   

  

**Vi söker dig som:**
 För att lyckas i rollen ser vi att du kommer från IT-Konsult- och/eller IT-bemanningsbranschen med erfarenhet av framgångsrik försäljning, samt att du har en ådra för att hitta unika lösningar för våra kunder. Det är meriterande om du har eftergymnasial utbildning inom IT och/eller försäljning.
   

  

 Vi ser gärna att du har ett operativt säljansvar idag och vill ta nästa steg i din karriär. Hos oss kommer du att få möjligheten till att vidare utveckla dina säljfärdigheter men även utveckla dina strategiska kunskaper inom försäljning.
   

  

 Vi söker en lagspelare med mycket god samarbetsförmåga som brinner för försäljning och att skapa långsiktiga relationer. Du är kommunikativ och har känslan för att sätta dig in i processer på ett effektivt sätt. Du tar eget ansvar och har ett strukturerat arbetssätt.
   

  

**Varför Camai:**
 På Camai tror vi på att belöna hårt arbete och engagemang. Vi erbjuder generösa utvecklingsmöjligheter och förmåner för våra medarbetare samt en stimulerande arbetsmiljö där ingen dag är den andra lik. Hos oss är du inte bara en anställd, du är en hjälte som bidrar till vår gemensamma framgång.
   

  

**Vårt löfte:**
 När du blir en del av Camai-familjen kan du förvänta dig mer än bara ett jobb – du blir en del av en dynamisk gemenskap som värdesätter din personliga och professionella utveckling. Vi är inte bara ett företag, vi är en kraftfull rörelse som strävar efter att skapa en arbetsmiljö där varje individ kan blomstra och nå sin fulla potential.
   

  

 Vi lovar att ge dig de verktyg och resurser du behöver för att lyckas, inklusive generösa utvecklingsmöjligheter, kontinuerlig träning och stöd från en erfaren mentor inom branschen. Vi tror på att belöna hårt arbete och engagemang, och som en del av vårt team kommer du att få tillgång till en rad förmåner och belöningar som erkänner dina prestationer och bidrag till vår gemensamma framgång.
   

  

 På Camai är du inte bara en anställd, du är en hjälte som spelar en avgörande roll i att forma framtidens IT-landskap. Är du redo att ta nästa steg i din karriär och bli en del av vårt inspirerande team? Välkommen till Camai – där dina ambitioner möter oändliga möjligheter!
   

  

*Vi ser fram emot att välkomna dig till Camai!* 
 🌟
   

  

**Start** 
 :
   

  

 Omgående start med hänsyn till uppsägningstid. Vi värderar rätt person framför datum.
   

  

**Placeringsort:**
 Stockholm/Hybrid. Vi är 3 dagar/vecka på kontoret.
   

  

**Ansökan:**
 Intervjuer sker löpande och tillsättning sker vid rätt match.
   

  

**Vad vi står för:**
 Vi på Camai erbjuder ett av marknadens branschledande anställningsvillkor med stor frihet som ledord. Vi drivs av att hitta det bästa uppdraget för våra medarbetare. Det roligaste som finns är att hitta en perfekt matchning mellan konsult och kund. Vi vet att alla har ett drömarbete, och vi är ett tight entreprenörsdrivet team som arbetar för att se till att du tycker att det är roligt att gå till jobbet, varje dag. Vi tror att kompetenta människor dras till varandra och vill jobba med likasinnade i spännande kunduppdrag.
   

  

 Vi har en av marknadens mest förmånliga ersättningsmodell anpassad för en modern konsultorganisation med mycket frihet. Vi har helt enkelt kul tillsammans!
   

  

**Varför ska du välja oss?**
 Med många års erfarenhet i konsultbranschen har vi valt våra tre värdeord med omsorg; kommunikation, ambition och balans. För att lyckas tror vi att våra medarbetare får vara med och forma sitt arbete efter prioriteringar och intresse i livet. Med din ambition och rätt verktyg från oss ser vi till att du utvecklas och samtidigt belönas på vägen.
   

  

*Vill du vara en del av vår fortsatta tillväxt?*

title: Digital Marketing Entrepreneur – Remote Opportunity in the Wellbeing Space
description:
Are you looking for a more meaningful and flexible way to work, where you can build your own digital business while aligning with values like balance, wellbeing, and freedom?
   

  

 We’re looking for experienced professionals with a passion for marketing, independence, and growth. This is an opportunity to step away from the traditional 9–5 and create something of your own—fully remote, on your terms, with support and systems in place.
   

  

**What You'll Do**
* Build and manage your own online business in the wellbeing sector
* Leverage marketing strategies to increase visibility and engagement (training provided)
* Identify and connect with individuals seeking meaningful lifestyle change
* Use digital tools and CRM systems to track your activity and progress
* Contribute to a supportive community of purpose-driven entrepreneurs
* Commit to ongoing personal and professional development


**Who This Is For**
* Independent, proactive professionals who want to start or grow a flexible online business
* Individuals with marketing, business development, communications, or project management experience
* People who value autonomy, purpose, and contribution
* Fluent English speakers with strong communication skills and at least 5 years of work experience
* Those ready to take full ownership of their professional direction


**Key Benefits**
* 100% remote and self-paced
* Performance-based role
* Business aligned with wellbeing and values-based living
* Clear systems, training, and peer support
* Not a salaried position – full entrepreneurial freedom


 This is not a traditional job—it’s an opportunity to build a purpose-driven business supported by proven frameworks, with the freedom to work from anywhere.
   

  

**Ready to Make a Change?**
 If you’re a motivated, marketing-minded professional looking for a new direction with more freedom and purpose, we invite you to apply and discover what’s possible.

title: Franchisees for new areas in Spain
description:
*Are you looking for a new business opportunity? Do you live in Spain with experience of the housing market and knowledge of the Nordic languages? Are you interested to start up an office for us in a city where we are not represented today? Then we are happy to hear from you.*
 We are always looking for people who are passionate about what we do, who can build teams that want to win together and who strive to always give the right feeling to the customer. If you also have experience in the housing market in Spain or other valuable qualifications and are ready for a new step in your career by starting your own Franchise business - then as an established partner we can offer you a unique opportunity!
   

  

 Svensk Fastighetsförmedling has supported people with their housing dreams for over 85 years and in 2020 we established our first office in Spain - today we are on the Costa del Sol, Costa Blanca and Mallorca. Here we work today with both Swedish and international clients to find their dream homes. We are now looking for several Franchisees who want to join our journey of success and build their own teams, all around Spain - from the well-known tourist destinations and its beaches to the big cities or areas we have not yet seen or visited ourselves.
   

  

 YOUR NEXT CHALLENGE
   

  

 As a franchisee with us, you represent a safe and qualitive brand for the customer. You are offered unique conditions to succeed. Our collective experiences have led us to a way of working that includes commitment, innovative thinking, thoughtfulness and, not least, business mind. This has resulted in satisfied and returning customers in both Sweden and Spain. As a leading Real Estate company, Svensk Fastighetsförmedling can offer you all the advantages that a large company has. For several years in a row, we have been named one of Sweden's most attractive employers.
   

  

 As a Franchisee, you can both take on the challenge alone or start together with others.
   

  

 WHO ARE WE LOOKING FOR?
   

  

 As a Franchisee, you are creative and driven - both in business and in team building. You will work independently to run and manage your office. As support there is a strong brand, a network of other Franchisees and a Regional Manager who continuously supports and coaches your business. Since we are Swedish company, we need you or your partner to have some knowledge of Swedish or other Nordic language.
   

  

 In order to succeed in the role of Franchisee, we believe that you have previously been leading, running and/or establishing businesses. We see it as important that you have experience of the Spanish housing market in one way or another, and if you have also worked locally in the location you are interested in, you will quickly be able to settle into the role and deliver.
   

  

 DOES THIS SOUND INTERESTING?
   

  

 Submit your application as soon as possible and we will get back to you with more information. Do you have questions about the role? Please contact Sara Scardia by phone at +46 76-066 11 64.
   

  

 Of course, we handle your application confidentially.

title: Senior och Junior Biologer – Nulägesanalys biologisk mångfald
description:
**"Vi söker talanger – bli en del av VIPAS AB"**
 "Är du en driven IT-professionell som vill utvecklas i en dynamisk konsultmiljö? Bli en del av VIPAS AB och arbeta med projekt som utmanar och inspirerar."
   

  

**Vår Verksamhet**
 "Vi på VIPAS AB kombinerar teknisk expertis med affärsfokus för att leverera lösningar som verkligen gör skillnad. Genom modern teknik som Java och Python och med vår erfarenhet inom mjukvaruutveckling och DevOps skapar vi innovativa, skalbara lösningar som hjälper våra kunder att nå sina mål."
   

  

**Om rollen**
 Trafikförvaltningen ansvarar för en hållbar, säker och pålitlig kollektivtrafik i Region Stockholm. Som del i detta arbete behöver vi genomföra en nulägesanalys av den biologiska mångfalden inom och i anslutning till våra fastigheter. Fokus ligger på inventering av invasiva arter och värdefulla naturmiljöer, framför allt i miljöer nära trafikspår såsom banvallar och depåer.
   

  

 Resultaten ska bidra till en långsiktig planering för skötsel, förvaltning och bekämpning där så krävs. Uppdraget påbörjas snarast och leverans av slutrapport ska ske senast december 2025.
   

  

**Roller och ansvarsområden**
**Senior Biolog (1 konsult)**
* Leder och planerar inventeringsarbetet
* Kvalitetssäkrar leveranser och metodik
* Deltar i möten med Trafikförvaltningen och ansvarar för granskning


**Junior Biolog (2–5 konsulter)**
* Genomför huvuddelen av fältinventeringen
* Dokumenterar och skriver rapporter
* Deltar vid behov i möten


**Leveranser**
* Skriftlig rapport med beskrivning av metod och resultat
* Kartor i PDF- och GIS-format (Shape, GeoPackage eller motsvarande)
* Data som kan integreras i BESTA för framtida förvaltnings- och skötselplaner


**Kvalifikationer**
**Obligatoriskt:**
* Relevant akademisk bakgrund inom biologi eller närliggande område
* Erfarenhet av artinventering, gärna med fokus på invasiva arter
* God förmåga att dokumentera och rapportera på svenska
* Förmåga att arbeta självständigt och i team


**Meriterande:**
* Erfarenhet från inventering i spårmiljö eller motsvarande
* GIS-kompetens (framtagning av kartor och artdata)
* Kännedom om regionala eller nationella förvaltningsplaner för biologisk mångfald


**"Bli en del av vårt framgångsrika team"**
 "På VIPAS AB värdesätter vi drivna och engagerade medarbetare. Vi erbjuder attraktiva villkor och en arbetsmiljö som främjar kompetensutveckling och karriärtillväxt. Hos oss får du arbeta med spännande projekt inom flera branscher och bidra till banbrytande IT-lösningar tillsammans med ett erfarent och innovativt team."
   

  

**"Vi vill höra från dig"**
 "Tveka inte – skicka din ansökan till
 **pooja@vipas.se** 
 och upptäck möjligheterna hos VIPAS AB."
   

  

**Behörighet för ansökan :-** 
 "För att kunna ansöka krävs svenskt medborgarskap eller ett giltigt arbetstillstånd för Sverige."
   

  

**Din ansökan**
 "Intresserade kandidater uppmanas att skicka in CV och personligt brev. Observera att rekryteringen sker löpande, vilket innebär att tjänsten kan tillsättas innan sista ansökningsdatum."

title: Pop-up Store Assistant - Stockholm
description:
*At Happy Socks we have made it our mission to spread happiness everywhere, and you only have to spend a few minutes with us to realize how seriously we take it!*
 We are now looking for several flexible, part-time Sales Assistants for the holiday season (working around 15-30h week) to work in our holiday pop-ups in central Stockholm, Täby Centrum and Nacka Forum. You will be part of a fun-loving and driven multicultural company of people from all over the world.
   

  

 Tasks & Responsibilities
   

  

* Opening & closing the store depending on the shift
* Restocking and making sure the store is neat and tidy at all times
* Giving all customers the very best Happy Socks experience
* Supporting store happenings and events
* Supporting store stocktaking
* Assisting Store Managers with rolling out campaigns and store windows


**Requirements & Skills**
* Some experience from customer facing roles, preferably in retail
* Fluent in Swedish and English, both spoken and written
* For this position, you need to have a work permit or be a Swedish/EU citizen


 Most importantly, you have the personality to fit a somewhat crazy, fun work environment where we believe in color and playfulness, a place where you can expect the unexpected and you are a source of creative weirdness. You're passionate about delivering excellent customer service and you love our products! You're positive and solution-oriented and align with Happy Socks brand values. It’s important to us that you’re flexible, adaptable and able to take shifts at short notice.
   

  

 Please state your availability (full days, weekends, evenings) in your application as well as approx. how many hours per week you can work.
   

  

 Interested, and fitting into this profile? We would love to hear from you as soon as possible since we’re going through applications continually!
   

  

*We care a lot about Diversity at Happy Socks and would love to see a range of genders, ages and various backgrounds apply.*

title: Marketing Motion Designer (12m FTC)
description:
**About MAG (in brief!)**
 At MAG Interactive we make word and trivia mobile games that feel good. As a part of this fun and dynamic industry, it’s our mission to spread joy to players around the world. With over 350 million downloads globally, we credit our success to our awesome colleagues and we hope you'll join the team!
   

  

**The role: Marketing Motion Designer**
 We’re looking for a creative, results-driven Motion Designer to join our friendly Ad Creative team in Stockholm for a 12-month parental leave cover.
   

  

 At MAG Interactive, ideas quickly turn into measurable results. You’ll have the freedom to explore new ad concepts, see them tested within days, and learn from every outcome. Working in a supportive, inclusive team, you’ll bring your vision to life and see the real impact of your creativity in an innovative culture that values experimentation and growth.
   

  

**What You’ll Be Doing**
* Design and deliver high-performing video ads for our mobile games.
* Keep an eye on competitor ads and industry trends for fresh inspiration.
* Test, learn, and refine quickly based on ad performance.
* Welcome feedback from the team and use it to continuously improve your work.
* Use your animation expertise alongside gameplay capture to craft engaging ads.
* Balance innovative thinking with reliable production work. Sometimes developing bold new ideas, other times adapting existing assets.
* Create ads for prototype games, even when gameplay isn’t yet available.
* Collaborate with our User Acquisition team to deliver strong, measurable results.
* Contribute to creative production across networks and ASO materials.


**What We’re Looking For**
* 5+ years of experience in marketing for games or apps.
* Proven experience creating video ads for user acquisition.
* Strong skills with Adobe Creative Suite, especially After Effects.
* Confident using Figma.
* Organized, efficient, and curious about new tools and ways of working.
* Creative and innovative, while also comfortable with day-to-day production.
* You can recognise ‘good enough’ and avoid over-polishing where it’s unnecessary.
* Experienced in using AI tools to generate ideas and streamline production.
* You are eager to be part of a supportive, high-performing team.


**Nice-to-haves (but not essential!)**
* Illustration and layout skills for key art and feature images.
* Experience developing playable ads.


**Perks And Benefits**
* Company mobile phone and contract
* Favorable pension
* Flexible work hours
* Seasonal kick-offs
* Monthly After works
* Company wide carbon off-setting and CSR initiatives


**At MAG, we want all of our employees to feel valued, appreciated and empowered to bring their true selves to work!**
**Our recruitment processes are designed to prevent bias and discrimination against people regardless of; gender identity or expression, sexual orientation, religion, ethnicity, age, neurodiversity, disability status, or any other aspect.**
**About MAG**
 We are MAG Interactive – a leading mobile developer and publisher of casual mobile games built on a wealth of creativity and passion.
