title: Senior Gen AI Engineer
description:
**Senior Fullstack GenAI Engineer** 




 📍 Location: Stockholm (Hybrid)
 



 🏢 SaaS Scale-Up | Cloud-Native CCMS Platform
 



  





**About the Company**




 We are a market-leading SaaS scale-up in the field of Component Content Management Systems (CCMS). Our cloud-native platform helps global teams create, manage, publish, and translate technical documentation in real time.
 



 Trusted by some of the world’s largest organisations — including global enterprises, European institutions, and high-growth tech companies — we are on a mission to become the #1 solution in our industry through continuous product innovation, exceptional user experience, and customer success.
 



  





**Why We’re Hiring**




 We’re making a major strategic and financial investment in AI to transform our product and the way our customers use it. While our engineering team already has AI competence, we’re now building a brand-new AI function — starting with this Senior Fullstack GenAI Engineer role.
 



 You’ll be the first senior hire into this team, helping to define the roadmap, build the AI infrastructure, and deliver new AI-powered features that will set us apart in the market.
 



  





**Your Role**




 As our Senior Fullstack GenAI Engineer, you will:
 


* Define and drive the AI roadmap in collaboration with engineering leadership, product, and senior stakeholders.
* Design and build AI infrastructure from scratch to power agentic workflows for internal teams and external customers.
* Develop AI agents that integrate with internal/external tools, MCP servers, and customer systems.
* Work hands-on with LLMs, RAG, AWS Bedrock, microservices, and IaC to bring GenAI to production at scale.
* Act as a technical mentor and set best practices as the AI team grows.



  





 This is not a people-management role today, but there’s clear potential to step into a formal lead position as the team expands.
 



  





**What We’re Looking For**



* A senior software engineer with hands-on experience implementing GenAI into real-world products.
* End-to-end knowledge across software engineering and the AI lifecycle: from experimentation to scaled deployment.
* Experience designing AI infrastructure and workflows for adoption in product development.
* Strong backend development skills in Node.js/TypeScript, Go, Python, or PHP.
* Cloud experience — especially with AWS and microservices architectures.
* Familiarity with LLMs, RAG, agentic AI, and AWS Bedrock.
* A collaborative, humble, and pragmatic personality, someone who can influence and mentor without ego.



  





**What We Offer**



* Salary 70,000–80,000 SEK/month
* 30 days’ vacation.
* Wellness allowance: 4,000 SEK/year.
* Home office allowance: 2,500 SEK/year.
* ITP1 pension plan, life and occupational insurances.
* Hybrid flexibility (must be based in Stockholm and able to join on-site planning/roadmap sessions).



  





**Why Join Us?**



* Shape the future of a market-leading SaaS product trusted by global enterprises.
* Join at the start of the AI journey, with real autonomy and influence on the roadmap.
* Be part of a collaborative, people-first engineering culture where learning and innovation thrive.



  





**The Process**



1. Intro meeting with VP of Engineering or Ops Engineering Manager
2. Take-home coding test
3. Technical discussion & review
4. Personality & logic test



  





**📩 Interested?**




 If you’re ready to build next-generation AI-powered workflows and transform how global teams collaborate on technical content, we’d love to hear from you.

title: Data Engineer Insight
description:
**Data Engineer**
**Do you want to build the next datamodels för AI, ML and datawarehouse empowered solutions?**
 Nexer Insight, a Microsoft partner, invites you to embark on a journey as a Data Engineer where you'll be part of an extraordinary team, engage in exciting activities, work with fascinating clients, tackle varied and challenging tasks, and enjoy exceptional benefits. We are committed to leveraging cutting-edge technologies such as Databricks to drive innovation and excellence in everything we do.
   

  

**Do you want to be our next ”Data Ninja”?**
 Joining Nexer Insight means becoming a vital part of a company that embodies entrepreneurship and innovation. Here, you'll have the chance to engage with cutting-edge technology from Microsoft, Databricks, and DBT Labs, as we proudly partner with them. We're committed to investing in our employees, empowering them to excel in their fields through professional growth and development opportunities. Collaboration is at the heart of our approach, as we value teamwork and foster a vibrant community spirit. Dive into the exciting intersection of data engineering and data science, where you'll have the chance to make a meaningful impact.
   

  

**Key Responsibilities:**
* Develop and operate scalable and robust analytical models.
* Set up data platforms and build data models and pipelines.
* Innovate and collaborate with customers to learn and find new business opportunities.
* Become a champion in best practices regarding architecture, data quality, reliability, and performance.
* Be at the forefront of the latest data engineering technology.
* Leveraging Microsoft Azure services for data processing, transformation, and storage.
* You propel progress and ensure delivery by constructing top-tier cloud solutions, empowering our customers to adopt a data-driven approach.


**Based on our criteria för the role, we expect you to have:**
* Hands-on project experience of working with cloud solutions (Azure, AWS or GCP)
* Minimum 2 years experience working with ETL tools such as Azure Data Factory, Databricks, DBT, Snowflake
* Experience with Data Lakes or Lakehouse Architecture
* In-depth knowledge of SQL syntax
* Experience in information and dimensional modelling
* Good knowledge of DevOps processes with git version control and CI/CD methodology
* Speaks English and Swedish fluently


**Meritorious** 
**experience:**
* Platform modernisation
* Tabular cubes and DAX
* Data Vault modelling
* Experience in setting up Azure, AWS or GCP Infrastructure

title: AI Sales Internship (Native European Language Speakers)
description:
We’re looking for ambitious and relentless
 **AI Sales Interns (SDRs)** 
 to join our fast-growing team and be on the front lines of AI transformation. If you're a native speaker of
 **English,** 
**Dutch, Danish, German, French** 
 , or any other European language—and not afraid of cold calling—this is your chance to make a real impact. You'll be working directly with our founders to identify and connect with high-potential prospects, driving new business and helping reshape how companies use AI in customer communications.
   

  

**Company Description**
 Our vision is to create the
 **world's smartest AI agent for Customer Support** 
 in the B2B SaaS sector. Our aim is to get B2B companies to
 **ticket zero by the end of 2026** 
 .
   

  

 Only a single-digit percentage of SMEs have adopted AI in their customer-facing teams. We’re already trusted by over 200 paying companies, including
 **Mynt, Yabie, Steelwrist, SVAB** 
 , and many more.
   

  

 We’re building
 **end-to-end support automation** 
 with a bold mission: to deliver
 **100% fully autonomous customer support** 
 . From triage to resolution, our AI handles the entire support flow—freeing up human teams to focus on strategy and innovation.
   

  

 Join us in building the world’s smartest and most accurate AI brain across customer domains—and beyond.
   

  

**Why You’ll Love This Role**
* Real Impact: You’re not here to watch—you’re here to close. Every meeting you book contributes directly to our growth.
* Fast-Paced Learning: Get trained by experienced sales managers, work with cutting-edge tools, and gain real-world sales experience in B2B SaaS and AI.
* Ownership: You’ll manage the full outbound process from lead sourcing to first contact and meeting booking.
* Autonomy: As a native speaker, you’ll localize and adapt our scripts and approaches to your home market.
* Performance-Driven: This is a pay-by-performance internship where effort = earnings.


**Key Responsibilities**
* Source leads and contact information—hunting creatively for phone numbers and emails without relying on automated prospecting tools.
* Own and execute the entire cold prospecting process, especially cold calling, to book qualified sales meetings.
* Tailor outreach messaging, pitch, and cold call scripts to your specific language and market.
* Record and document all sales calls, capture relevant notes, and upload recordings for internal use.
* Conduct administrative work related to your outreach—keeping everything organized and updated for handoff to sales managers.
* Maintain a high volume of outbound activity every day—this is a hustle-first, results-driven internship.
* Meet or exceed performance targets for meetings booked and qualified leads generated.


**What We’re Looking For**
* Native Speaker: You are fluent in one or more of the following: Dutch, Danish, German, French, or another major European language.
* Cold Calling Confidence: You’re not just comfortable picking up the phone—you thrive on it.
* Resourceful: You can dig deep and figure out how to find contact info even when tools aren’t provided.
* Sales Hustle: You’re motivated by targets, excited to hear “yes,” and not discouraged by “no.”
* Ambition & Drive: You want to break into the world of tech sales and are willing to work hard to make it happen.
* Attention to Detail: You stay organized and accurately document every touchpoint.


**Bonus Points For**
* Previous sales or outreach experience.
* Experience with cold calling in a B2B environment.
* Interest in AI, SaaS, or startup growth.


**Renumeration**
* 500 SEK per qualified meeting.
* 15% commission for sales closed and invoiced (commission can range from 5000 - 150,000 SEK per deal for qualified deals).


**Why Join Us?**
* Innovative Environment: Work with some of the most exciting minds in AI, in a team that values action, creativity, and results.
* Autonomy & Impact: You’ll take ownership from Day 1 and make a real impact—measurable in booked meetings and revenue influence.
* Earn What You’re Worth: Performance-based compensation means your hustle pays off—literally.

title: Senior Data Engineer to Sogeti Stockholm
description:
Sogeti Stockholm is hiring semi-senior/senior Data Engineers to be part of a team with a major client in the banking and finance sector. Do you enjoy challenges and want to be part of Sogeti and our customer on the journey into the future of Data and BI?
   

  

 Then this opportunity is the next step for you!
   

  

**Job Description:**
 We are looking for more senior members to grow the team of sharp consultants who want to be involved in building and developing future solutions. We strongly believe that the future is very much about Data Management, and by working with Data/BI, you will play a key role and, together with your colleagues, develop innovative solutions for our customer.
   

  

**In this role you will play a key role in:**
* Building and delivering solutions for large data sets based on customer needs.
* Working closely with others in the team and finding new ways to do things.
* Seeing opportunities where others see problems and thriving in a dynamic environment where there’s always something happening.
* Working independently within your area while also being eager to learn from others or help elevate the group's knowledge.
* Setting up and developing new data warehouse solutions and pipelines.
* Driving migration from on-prem to cloud and handling enormous amounts of data.


**Your Profile:**
* At least 5 years of experience as a Data Engineer.
* Experience with technologies such as SQL, Teradata, Informatica, Mainframe, ODI, and Ab Initio.
* Fluent in Swedish or English, both spoken and written.
* Experience working in an international environment.
* Experience working with CI/CD pipelines (e.g., Jenkins, Azure DevOps).
* Knowledge of Microsoft Services and SOAP/REST-based services and tools.
* Experience working with AI-driven test tools or frameworks, such as tools for generating test cases based on machine learning.
* Independent, proactive, and a problem solver who balances details with a holistic perspective.


**What we believe you will enjoy about working here:**
* Innovative environment: With us, you get the chance to work with the latest technology and be part of a dynamic team that loves to create value through innovation.
* Career development: We care about your future and offer development programs and certifications in the latest technologies so that you can grow and become the best version of yourself.
* Flexible work: We understand that life is more than just work. Therefore, we offer opportunities for remote work and flexible working hours so that you can feel good and thrive.
* Team spirit: We are like a big family with a great team spirit. By living by our values of courage, passion, teamwork, and entrepreneurship, we create a work environment where everyone can thrive.


**Application:**
 We warmly welcome your application today, selection is ongoing! If you have questions about the position or the recruitment process, please contact Team Manager Johan Alsén at: johan.alsen@sogeti.se
   

  

 As we step into the summer season and many of us take some well-deserved time off, things might move a little slower than usual. But don’t worry — we’ll get back to you as soon as we’re back from vacation! Thank you so much for your patience and for showing interest in Sogeti. We truly appreciate it and wish you a wonderful summer filled with sunshine, relaxation, and joy!
   

  

**About Us**
 Sogeti Sweden, part of the Capgemini Group, with 21 offices and 1300 employees, creates business value with technology for organizations that need to implement innovation quickly and that want a local partner with global scalability. With a hands-on culture and proximity to customers, Sogeti implements solutions that help organizations work faster, better, and smarter. By combining agility and fast implementation through a DevOps approach, Sogeti delivers innovative solutions in testing and quality assurance, the cloud, and systems development, enhanced by AI, data, and automation.

title: Director of Business Solution
description:
*At NCAB Group, it’s our people who make us unique. As Director of Business Solutions, you will be part of a global and growing company with highly engaged individuals in an environment that fosters continuous learning. NCAB Group IT is looking for someone who is committed, driven, and positive, and who wants to join us on our transformation journey toward modern cloud-based system solutions.* 




  





**What You’ll Do as Director of Business Solution?** 




 As Director of Business Solution, you’ll drive innovation and efficiency, working with both strategic initiatives and daily operations to ensure our business solutions are future-proof. Collaborating with both internal experts and external partners, you’ll optimize processes, boost productivity, and enhance the customer experience.
 



  





 As a leader, you’ll manage a team of five, report directly to the Chief Digital Information Officer, and be part of the IT management team. You’ll work closely with colleagues across departments and our suppliers, always keeping user needs at the forefront. The role is based in Stockholm and includes some travel.
 



  





**Main Responsibilities:** 



* Lead and develop the Business Solutions team, securing the right competences and operational model for the future.
* Ensure efficient management, further development, and support of our business systems (Dynamics, Azure, MS365, etc.).
* Drive change management and training initiatives to increase IT maturity across the organization.
* Work closely with the business and business resources to identify needs, clarify requirements, and prioritize improvements that shape the roadmap for the business solutions with a focus on both technology and business value
* Manage relationships with external partners and vendors.
* Contribute to developing our data and analytics capabilities, including data governance and AI initiatives.
* Be a key person in our continued global rollout and transformation.



  





**Are You the One We’re Looking For?** 




 As NCAB is on a growth journey, your role as Director of Business Solutions is crucial to the company’s continued success. We are looking for someone with experience in a similar role, preferably with a background from midsized international companies and working with partners.
 



  





 You have broad IT experience in general and expertise ERP and CRM systems preferably from Microsoft. You are curious and willing to try new solutions, constantly learning new things, and committed to staying up to date with technology and leadership development as well as bringing the people around you on the journey. It is of importance that you manage to switch between strategic work and operational tasks.
 



  





 You have a desire to understand and support the business in how we can provide better service to our customers. You thrive in a leadership role, both in good times and challenging ones, and have an enthusiastic attitude toward change. You are good at building relationships and passionate about delivering excellent service and continuously develop. As a person, you enjoy a non-hierarchical environment where teamwork and transparency are valued.
 



  





 We are looking for someone who wants to help take NCAB to the next level, both technically and organizationally. You do not need 10+ years of experience, but you should be dedicated, curious, and have the right attitude.
 



  





**Who are we?** 




 NCAB Group is a leading global PCB supplier founded in 1993 in Sweden. Today, we have local presence in 19 countries in Europe, Asia and North America and customers in 45 countries worldwide. Revenue in 2024 amounted to 342,000,000 USD. Our mission is to produce PCBs for demanding customers, on time with zero defects, sustainably at the lowest total cost.
 



  





 We offer our employees opportunities to develop in a fast-growing environment and provide an attractive salary package. At NCAB Group, our people make us unique. Our shared values are the foundation of an empowering working environment.
 



  





**Sounds Interesting?** 




 In this recruitment NCAB Group is collaborating with Novare Executive Search. If you have any questions about the position, you are welcome to contact Charlotta Skogar at charlotta.skogar@novare.se. Please note that we don’t accept applications via e-mail. Selection is ongoing, so don’t wait to apply!

title: Backend Developer
description:
At Ingrid, we’re not just building software—we’re transforming how people experience delivery. Our platform powers seamless, intelligent logistics solutions for merchants and customers worldwide. As we continue to grow, we’re looking for a motivated backend developer to join our team and help us expand our plugin integrations for Ingrid’s return, checkout, and tracking products.
   

  

**Why You’ll Want to Build With Us**
**Work With Go and Modern Tools**
 We’re a Go-first company with a microservices architecture. You’ll get hands-on experience with modern backend technologies and learn how to build efficient, scalable services.
   

  

**Contribute to Real Products**
 You’ll be developing and improving plugins that connect Ingrid’s products to merchant systems—directly impacting how retailers and customers experience delivery.
   

  

**Learn and Grow With the Team**
 You’ll collaborate with experienced engineers, gaining mentorship and guidance while contributing your own ideas. We value learning, knowledge sharing, and supporting each other’s growth.
   

  

**Modern Stack**
* Cloud Native: Google Cloud, Kubernetes
* Observability: Prometheus, Grafana
* Data Layer: PostgreSQL, MySQL, Redis, Google PubSub
* Dev Experience: GitHub, GitHub Actions, Terraform
* Delivery Culture: Continuous delivery and iteration


**Experience**
**What We’re Looking For**
* 2–4 years of experience in backend development
* Comfortable working with at least one backend language (Go, PHP, Java, Python, or TypeScript are especially relevant).
* Some familiarity with APIs, integrations, or plugin development is a plus.
* Previous experience with plugin development for e-commerce platforms such as Shopify, Magento or WooCommerce is meritorious


**Mindset & Approach**
* Curious, proactive, and eager to learn.
* Enjoys problem-solving and building reliable, practical solutions.
* Collaborative team player with good communication skills.


**Education**
* Degree in Computer Science or equivalent practical experience.


**A Culture You’ll Thrive In**
* Trust & Growth: We give you responsibility and support you to grow in your role.
* Learning Mindset: We encourage experimenting, learning from feedback, and improving together.
* Flexibility & Balance: Remote-friendly setup, flexible hours, and generous vacation.
* Well-being & Security: Wellness allowance and occupational pension plan.
* Team Spirit: Knowledge-sharing sessions, team events, and a supportive environment.


**Ready to Make an Impact?**
 If you’re excited about developing integrations that shape the delivery experience and want to grow your skills with modern technologies in a collaborative environment, we’d love to hear from you.
   

  

**About Ingrid**
 Ingrid is a leading shipping software platform that empowers online retailers to offer seamless, personalized delivery experiences. Since 2015, we’ve helped over 250 retailers across Sweden increase conversion rates and build stronger customer loyalty.
   

  

 What makes us unique:
   

  

* Extensive network: 400+ shipping options and carriers across 80 countries and 42 languages.
* Customer-first: We see delivery as part of the shopping experience, not just the end of it.
* Data-driven: We provide valuable insights to help retailers optimize performance and pricing.
* Innovation: We constantly develop new features to stay ahead in e-commerce logistics.

title: Javautvecklare till Tavana Tech
description:
Vi på Tavana Tech växer och söker flera duktiga utvecklare till vårt team.
   

  

**OM OSS**
 Tavana är ett konsultbolag som startades 2013 med ca 100 medarbetare idag. Tavana ingår i större koncern med ca 350 medarbetare och 6 systerbolag. Vi har arbetat i branschen tillräckligt länge för att veta att långsiktiga samarbeten ofta beror på att rätt person är på rätt plats. Vi jobbar för att både våra kunder och våra konsulter ska vara nöjda. Därför lägger vi mycket fokus på matchmaking när vi kopplar samman konsult med uppdrag. Kanske är det också därför som vi har en av branschens bästa siffror när det kommer till att behålla våra konsulter. Det här gör att vi kan erbjuda långsiktiga samarbeten för våra kunder och utvecklande möjligheter för våra konsulter
   

  

**VI SÖKER DIG SOM**
 Vi söker just nu en fullstackutvecklare med cirka 3 års erfarenhet.
   

  

 Vi ser gärna att vår nya kollega har erfarenhet av följande:
   

  

 3+ år inom Java EE, Java SE & Java 8+
   

  

 JavaScript (Angular, React eller liknande)
   

  

 Cloud (AWS / Azure / GCP)
   

  

 Microservices
   

  

**Meriterande:**
 Erfarenhet inom CI/CD pipelines, Jenkins och Docker
   

  

 Bachelor’s i Computer Sc. and Engineering (eller liknande)
   

  

 Kan kommunicera flytande på svenska och engelska
   

  

 Kunskap inom testing (Xunit / Selenium eller TDD)
   

  

**LÅTER DET INTRESSANT?**
 Då välkomnar vi dig att ansöka till oss så snart som möjligt då vi hanterar ansökningar löpande. Skicka in ditt CV till oss redan idag via ”Skicka ansökan”.
   

  

 Har du frågor gällande tjänsten, vilka Tavana är eller konsultrollen så är du välkommen att skicka mail till info@tavana.se
   

  

 Vi ser fram emot din ansökan!

title: Senior Fullstack Developer
description:
**Bli en del av Sveriges snabbast växande techbolag**
 Vi har vuxit från idé till närmare 200 konsulter på bara fyra år – för att vi kombinerar teknisk spets med äkta samarbetskultur. Vi tror på frihet med ansvar, på entreprenörsdriv i vardagen, och på att teknik blir som bäst när människor får utrymme att påverka. Och det fungerar. Förra året blev TechSeed Sveriges snabbast växande konsultbolag – och nu siktar vi på 400 medarbetare nästa år.
   

  

 TechSeed är inte ett vanligt konsultbolag. Vi bygger banbrytande, uppkopplade lösningar från grunden, med teknik som sträcker sig över FPGA, IoT, Edge Computing, Cyber Security, AI och XR. Vi skapar lösningar som inte bara är ligger i teknisk framkant - utan är användardrivna, hållbara och verkligt värdeskapande.
   

  

 Nu söker vi en
 **senior fullstackutvecklare** 
 som vill vara med i ett passionerat och innovativt team. Du har stark kompetens inom både front- och backend, och ett intresse för framtidens teknologier – gärna även XR. Här får du arbeta nära erfarna utvecklare, designers och tekniska projektledare i uppdrag som gör skillnad.
   

  

**Vad du får hos TechSeed**
* Möjlighet att påverka – både projekt, team och TechSeeds framtid
* En inkluderande och lärande kultur där varje perspektiv räknas
* Flexibilitet och självständighet i vardagen
* Bonus- och delägarprogram som låter dig ta del av framgången
* Möjligheten att växa inom områden som matchar dina ambitioner – från teknik till ledarskap


**Vi söker dig som har**
* Gedigen erfarenhet av front-end (React, Angular, HTML/CSS/JS)
* Erfarenhet av back-end-utveckling (Node.js, .NET, Python)
* Kunskap om databaser (MySQL, MongoDB, SQL Server)
* Van att jobba med molntjänster (AWS, Azure, GCP)
* Analytisk förmåga och driv att lösa komplexa problem
* Flytande svenska och engelska
* Bonus: erfarenhet av XR (Unity, Unreal), samt konsultroll eller scale-up-miljö


**Vill du vara med på vår resa och skapa framtidens uppkopplade lösningar tillsammans med oss?** 
 Eller kanske bara nyfiken på att veta mer? Hör av dig redan idag – vi ser fram emot att prata med dig!

title: Azure Big Data Architect with Microsoft Fabric
description:
**About the Role** 




 We are seeking an experienced
 **Azure Big Data Consultant** 
 to design, develop, and deliver cutting-edge cloud data solutions. The ideal candidate will have proven expertise in
 **Microsoft Fabric** 
 ,
 **Power Platform** 
 , and
 **Azure services** 
 , along with strong skills in data integration, modeling, and web application development. This is a hands-on role requiring both technical depth and excellent stakeholder engagement skills.
 



  





**Key Responsibilities** 



* Architect and implement scalable
 **Azure Big Data solutions** 
 leveraging
 **Microsoft Fabric**
* Design and optimize
 **data pipelines, integrations, and models** 
 for performance and scalability
* Develop solutions using
 **Power Platform** 
 (Power BI, Power Apps, Power Automate)
* Build and maintain web applications using
 **JavaScript/TypeScript, HTML/CSS, React, or .NET**
* Implement
 **serverless solutions** 
 with Azure Functions, Logic Apps, and API integrations
* Collaborate with stakeholders to gather requirements and translate them into technical solutions
* Ensure best practices in security, governance, and data lifecycle management
* Contribute to
 **Agile delivery** 
 using Scrum methodology and tools such as JIRA
* Mentor junior team members and share technical expertise within the team



  





**Essential Skills & Experience** 



* **10+ years** 
 of experience in data engineering, architecture, or consulting roles
* Proven track record in
 **Microsoft Azure Big Data ecosystems**
* Strong hands-on experience with
 **Microsoft Fabric**
* Expertise in
 **data integration, pipeline design, and data modeling**
* Proficiency in
 **Power BI, Power Apps, and Power Automate**
* Development experience with
 **JavaScript/TypeScript, HTML/CSS, React, or .NET**
* Solid knowledge of
 **Azure Functions, Logic Apps, and API integrations**
* Experience in

 (Scrum, JIRA)

title: Tech Lead (.NET) - BESS Cloud Platform
description:
Seeking a Tech Lead to shape the future of smart energy
   

  

 The European energy system is in the midst of a green transition, where battery energy storage systems will play a central role, and we need you to make it happen!
   

  

 Capture Energy, a fast-growing Swedish company founded in 2023 and with 38 employees currently, aims to become a market leader in the Nordics in providing battery energy storage systems (BESS) for energy flexibility services - a market that is expected to experience significant growth in the coming years. With innovation at our core, we're building the digital infrastructure that powers the clean energy transition - starting with our next-generation platform, Capture Cloud.
   

  

 As a small company today, we are able to operate very differently compared to the larger players on the market, which gives us a great competitive position. We are committed to bringing good energy to every setting where we operate: from our customers, partners, to our employees.
   

  

**About The Role**
 We are seeking a
 **hands-on Tech Lead** 
 to join our team in Stockholm and drive the
 **development of our cloud platform** 
 supporting battery energy storage solutions (BESS). The platform combines scalable backend services with modern web applications, enabling reliable and secure energy management. This role blends deep
 **.NET development utilizing Azure cloud services** 
 with
 **technical leadership, architecture design** 
 , and close collaboration with product stakeholders. You will mentor engineers, shape the product vision from a technical perspective, and ensure security, scalability, and quality in everything we deliver.
   

  

 Key Responsibilities
   

  

* Lead, mentor, and coach a team of software engineers, fostering best practices and high-quality deliverables.
* Collaborate with Product Manager, Product Designer, and stakeholders to align technical solutions with product vision and business goals.
* Define and oversee solution design, architecture, and technical implementations for both backend services and web applications.
* Conduct code reviews and provide guidance on architecture, scalability, performance, and cybersecurity.
* Contribute to feature discovery by providing technical insights and developing Proof of Concepts (PoCs) where needed.
* Drive the team towards a continuous delivery setup with DevOps and CI/CD practices.
* Oversee software release management and contribute to product documentation.
* Stay up to date with emerging technologies and recommend improvements to tools, processes, and system architecture.
* Balance hands-on coding with leadership responsibilities to ensure timely and efficient delivery.


**Skills And Qualifications**
* 9+ years of software development experience, including at least 2 years in a leadership or team lead role.
* Strong, hands-on experience with .NET / C#, building and maintaining scalable backend services and REST APIs.
* Practical experience working with cloud platforms (preferably Azure) and event-driven architectures.
* Strong understanding of software architecture, cloud-native design, and cybersecurity best practices.
* Experience with relational databases such as PostgreSQL.
* Experience with time-series databases and big data analysis in large-scale environments.
* Understanding of how to apply AI and machine learning techniques in data-intensive platforms (e.g., forecasting, anomaly detection, optimization).
* Good understanding of infrastructure as code concepts (e.g., Terraform) and ability to collaborate with DevOps engineers.
* Experience with identity and access management solutions.
* Familiarity with modern frontend frameworks is a plus.
* Good experience in planning integrations with external systems.
* Experience in IoT environments, with knowledge of protocols such as MQTT or Modbus, is a plus.
* Excellent communication and leadership skills in an Agile environment, with the ability to mentor and inspire team members.
* Fluency in English.


 Why Join Us?
   

  

 As a part of our team, you will have the opportunity to work in an environment that encourages personal and professional growth. We are committed to supporting our employees, offering opportunities for training and progression to those who show dedication and enthusiasm in their roles. Our team is our most valuable asset, and we strive to ensure each member feels valued, supported, and inspired.
   

  

 We offer
   

  

* An opportunity to shape both the technical direction and product vision of a platform at the core of renewable energy storage solutions
* An inspiring workplace where people are at the heart of everything we do, driving us toward our vision
* Hands-on work with modern technologies in a cloud-native, IoT-driven environment
* Competitive salary
* Maximized wellness contribution
* Pension and health insurance


 Application Process
   

  

 If you believe you have the responsibility, independence, and drive we are looking for, please submit your CV and a covering letter detailing your suitability for the role. We welcome applicants from all backgrounds and are committed to creating a diverse and inclusive workplace.
   

  

 We look forward to hearing from you and possibly welcoming you to our team.
   

  

**About The Company**
 Capture Energy, established in 2023, aims to be a major player in large-scale battery energy storage systems for flexibility services. We distinguish ourselves by providing turnkey solutions with smart services.
   

  

 Visit our website for more information: www.captureenergy.eu

title: LLM Trainer
description:
\*Job Title\* :
 



 LLM Trainer – Agentic tasks – Swedish
 



 Approvals:
 



  





 Programming + AI/ML/LLM integration.
 



  





 Swedish proficiency + technical skills.
 



  





 Fullstack/backend profiles with APIs/cloud exposure.
 



  





 Rejections:
 



  





 QA, project management, compliance-heavy profiles.
 



  





 Developers with no LLM or conversation simulation.
 



  





 Missing Swedish language fit.
 



  





 Sourcing Focus:
 



 Target bilingual Swedish developers with Python/Java + AI/ML or conversational system exposure.
 



  





 \*Role Overview:\*
 



 This position is within a project with one of the foundational LLM companies. The goal is to assist these foundational LLM companies in enhancing their Large Language Models.
 



 One way we help these companies improve their models is by providing them with high-quality proprietary data. This data serves two main purposes: first, as a basis for fine-tuning their models, and second, as an evaluation set to benchmark the performance of their models or competitor models.
 



 For example, in the case of Agent Completion (AC) data generation, your task will be to simulate high-quality multi-turn conversations between a user and a smart assistant that utilizes function-calling tools to accomplish user goals. You will craft these dialogues by playing both the assistant and the user, while simulating tool use where necessary to guide the assistant through complex decision-making and real-world reasoning scenarios.
 



  





 \*What does day-to-day look like:\*
 



 \* Design multi-turn conversations that simulate real interactions between users and AI assistants using apps like calendar, email, maps, and drive.
 



 \* Emulate both the user and the assistant, including the assistant's tool calls (only when corrections are needed).
 



 \* Carefully select when and how the assistant uses available tools, ensuring logical flow and proper usage of function calls.
 



 \* Craft dialogues that demonstrate natural language, intelligent behavior, and contextual understanding across multiple turns.
 



 \* Generate examples that showcase the assistant’s ability to gracefully complete feasible tasks, recognize infeasible ones, and maintain engaging general chat when tools aren’t required.
 



 \* Ensure all conversations adhere to defined formatting and quality guidelines, using an internal playbook.
 



 \* Iterate on conversation examples based on feedback to continuously improve realism, clarity, and value for training purposes.
 



 \* Collaborate with peers and reviewers to maintain consistency and high standards in deliverables.
 



 \*Requirements:\*
 



 \* 3+ years of overall professional experience in a technical or analytical field.
 



 \* Experience in any programming language or tech stack is acceptable; a strong grasp of APIs, data formats (e.g., JSON), and logical thinking is more critical than specific toolsets.
 



 \* Strong general technical reasoning skills and the ability to model real-world assistant behavior using tool-based APIs.
 



 \* Ability to break down complex tasks and simulate realistic dialogues that reflect user expectations and assistant limitations.
 



 \* Excellent written communication skills in English, with a focus on clarity, tone, and instructional coherence.
 



 \* Creativity and attention to detail in crafting realistic scenarios and responses.
 



 \* Experience working with or around LLMs, virtual assistants, or function-calling frameworks is a plus.
 



 \* Ability to follow detailed guidelines and formatting standards with high consistency.
 



 Native or professional proficiency in at least one of the following 16 locales is required:

title: 5g Core-developer
description:
**🚀 Join Our Team VIPAS AB as a 5g Core-developer 🚀
   

  

 Do you have what it takes to thrive in the vibrant world of IT consulting? VIPAS AB, a burgeoning company, proudly invites you to embark on your next engaging project as our 5g Core-developer**
**About VIPAS :**
 Imagine a world where your business technology perfectly aligns with your goals—efficient, scalable, and innovative. At VIPAS AB, that’s exactly what we strive to create. As an IT consulting company, we don’t just offer services; we deliver tailored solutions using cutting-edge technologies like Java and Python. Our team is well-versed in software development, DevOps, and engineering, bringing years of experience and expertise. Think of us as your trusted guide, leading your organization through the landscape of modern tech adoption, ensuring every step is taken with confidence and foresight.
   

  

**Job Description:**
 The 5G Core Developer will design, develop, and maintain advanced 5G core network functions for telecom infrastructure. The role requires expertise in both cloud-native environments and deep knowledge of 5G Core architecture, with hands-on abilities to troubleshoot and optimize network functions.
   

  

**Key Responsibilities:**
* Design, develop, and maintain modules and microservices for 5G Core (Standalone/Non-Standalone) and LTE/EPC network functions.
* Implement and optimize User Plane Function (UPF), Session Management Function (SMF), Access and Mobility Management Function (AMF), Network Repository Function (NRF), and Policy Control Function (PCF).
* Work with protocols such as HTTP/2, SCTP, Diameter, PFCP, GTP-U, NGAP, gRPC.
* Develop and troubleshoot network functions in C/C++, Java, or Go, with strong command of data structures and algorithms.
* Use tools and platforms like Docker, Kubernetes, OpenStack, CI/CD for cloud-native and containerized environments.
* Read and interpret 3GPP specifications to ensure standards-compliance.
* Optimize system reliability, performance, and security in real-time telecom environments.
* Collaborate with cross-functional teams, participate in architecture discussions, and integrate new solutions.
* Analyze and interpret key network KPIs and provide reports to stakeholders.


**Requirements:**
* Several years (preferably 3+) experience in 5G Core and/or LTE/EPC development.
* Strong programming background in C/C++, Java, or Go.
* Hands-on experience with Virtual Network Functions (VNFs) and Cloud-Native Network Functions (CNFs).
* Deep understanding of network flows, 5G protocols, and core architecture.
* Familiarity with Kubernetes, Docker, CI/CD pipelines.
* Good understanding of 3GPP standards and ability to interpret them.
* Problem-solving, debugging, and independent troubleshooting skills.
* Experience with network simulators or testing tools (Keysight, Spirent, dsTest) is a plus.
* Database experience (SQL/NoSQL) beneficial.


**Preferred Qualifications:**
* Experience with open-source 5G Core frameworks (Open5GS, UERANSIM).
* Formal training or certifications in telecom or 5G technologies.
* Experience working in an enterprise or consulting setting is a plus.


**Why Join Us?**
 Vipas AB offers attractive employment packages for IT consultants, aligned with the Teknikföretagen (Almega) collective agreement. Clients Working with us provides opportunities in diverse industries, allowing you flexibility and growth. If you’re driven and eager to face new challenges, join the VIPAS family.
   

  

 You'll be part of an innovative team driving the future of telecom, Automotive, Retail, and Banking. If you're ready to take on challenging projects and grow your career in a cutting-edge environment, this is the opportunity for you!
   

  

 Apply Now & Please feel free to reach me at kumud@vipas.se
   

  

 Note: Please do apply if you have Sweden PR/ citizenship OR a Sweden work permit.
   

  

**How to Apply:**
 Interested candidates are encouraged to apply by submitting their resume and cover letter. Join us in driving innovation in the VIPAS AB!
   

  

 Please note! We offer continuously. That means that we sometimes remove the assignments before the deadline. If you are interested we recommend that you apply immediately.

title: Mobile App Platform Engineer - React Native
description:

title: Senior System Verification Engineer
description:
**About Us**


If you are passionate about people and how groups work together, we encourage you to apply! Applications will be reviewed on an ongoing basis.

**Description**


**The opportunity**


We are looking for a Senior System Verification Engineer to join our team. This role offers the chance to work with diverse systems, expand your knowledge through engaging tasks, and contribute to a highly skilled and professional team.


Over 60 years ago, Hitachi Energy revolutionized long-distance electricity transmission with High Voltage Direct Current (HVDC) technology. Today, HVDC systems can deliver up to 12 gigawatts of power at voltage levels of up to 1,100 kV, spanning distances over 3,000 kilometers.


You will play a key role in the success of the Modular Advanced Control for HVDC (MACH™) — the heart of HVDC stations. MACH™ provides unmatched computational capacity and integrates all control and protection functions, including advanced fault registration and remote-control capabilities. Designed to operate continuously for over 30 years, MACH™ ensures reliable control and protection throughout the system’s lifetime.


As part of our global R&D organization, you’ll collaborate daily with colleagues from MACH teams in Sweden, Poland, and India. You’ll contribute to the development of the next generation of MACH™ systems, working in a team led by Marcus Bergblomma.

**How you’ll make an impact**

* Work with embedded real-time systems to prepare test environments, test code, and applications based on system requirements and international standards
* Build test environments using MACH Control System components, including computers, servers, I/O boards, and simulation tools
* Develop test cases and scenarios to verify system requirements, focusing on non-functional aspects such as communication and data acquisition
* Investigate system limits and performance through targeted test scenarios
* Execute test cases for various software and hardware releases in the test lab
* Map test cases to system requirements
* Design and implement new or improved test automation functions (e.g., instrument control, software loading, data evaluation)
* Automate tests using our test automation framework and ensure ongoing maintenance
* Take on additional responsibilities within the system verification team, such as lab maintenance, license management, and customer support

**Your background**

* Bachelor’s or master’s degree in computer science, Electrical Engineering, Electronics Engineering, or a related field — or equivalent experience
* ISTQB or SSDLC certification, and 5+ years of experience in embedded system development or testing is a strong advantage
* Familiarity with graphical programming tools such as LabVIEW, MATLAB Simulink, LTspice, HiDraw, and the MACH platform
* Experience working with large modular systems similar to MACH™
* Knowledge of Git is a plus
* Proficient in Python and C# with solid object-oriented design skills; familiarity with SOLID principles is beneficial
* Fluent in English; Swedish is a plus

 **What we offer**

* Collective agreement
* Flexible working time
* Health care and wellness allowance
* Fantastic career possibilities within Hitachi Energy both within Sweden and globally
* Mentor to support you throughout onboard phase
* Various trainings and education supporting employee development
* Diversified company with over 70+ nationalities working in Sweden
* Supplementary compensation for parental leave
* Employee Benefit Portal with thousands of discounts and perks

**More About Us**


If you are passionate about people and how groups work together, we encourage you to apply! Applications will be reviewed on an ongoing basis.


Talent Acquisition Partner: Agnieszka Borkowska, +41 76 317 40 67, agnieszka.borkowska@hitachienergy.com will answer your questions about the position.


Union representatives – Sveriges Ingenjörer: Mikael Hjort, +46 107-38 25 73; Ledarna: Frank Hollstedt, +46 10 7387048; Unionen: Fredrik Holmgren, +46 107-38 21 85.

**Qualified individuals with a disability may request a reasonable accommodation if you are unable or limited in your ability to use or access the Hitachi Energy career site as a result of your disability. You may request reasonable accommodations by completing a** **general inquiry form** **on our website. Please include your contact information and specific details about your required accommodation to support you during the job application process.**

title: Customer Support Engineer – LC/LCMS HPLC – Göteborg
description:
**Job Description**
-------------------


Agilent inspires and supports discoveries that advance the quality of life. We provide life science, diagnostic and applied market laboratories worldwide with instruments, services, consumables, applications and expertise. Agilent enables customers to gain the answers and insights they seek –– so they can do what they do best: improve the world around us. Information about Agilent is available at www.agilent.com.  

  

Every day, Agilent Customer Support Engineers help customers solve issues at labs where scientists are making discoveries that enhance the quality of life. Through our work, we deliver insights and provide support that keep labs running smoothly and more efficiently. Join our dynamic organization to be a part of this rewarding work.

 **Location: Sweden**

  

As a Customer Support Engineer in Sweden, you will work at a variety of labs supporting customers using our chromatography product line. You will have worked with chromatography instrumentation, methods and applications and are looking to become an expert with our products.


Applying your creativity, complex problem-solving skills, and can-do attitude is essential. Compliance and reporting are also important responsibilities, such as documenting and ordering components using a variety of databases. Having a natural instinct to deliver the highest-levels of customer service is vital.  

  

**Your tasks:**  

Responsible for supporting customers through on-site activities such as installation, implementation, maintenance and repair of company and multi-vendor systems solutions which may include hardware, software and networking products as well as operating systems.

* Installs and optimizes hardware/software/network products and configurations at customer sites.
* Diagnoses and resolves product performance problems.
* Performs maintenance and repair services.
* Ensures customer satisfaction by advising customers on preventive maintenance and configurations, which may impact product performance.
* Proactively responds to potential equipment or software issues to prevent unplanned interruption of customers' business.
* Delivers (does not design) fully integrated solutions, which may include peripherals, communications, operating systems and applications software.
* Serves as an internal resource on technical issues and manages product escalations Collaborates with Agilent teams such as Support, Sales, Marketing and R&D to provide solutions to customers.
* May have knowledge of third-party products.
* May deliver internal technical training and maintenance seminars and workshops for field engineers or customers.
* May train other field engineers or customers.
* May calibrate equipment on-site for large volume customers.
* May qualify leads.
* Must consent to participate and meet Agilent approved customer/vendor credentialing
* Requirements necessary to gain access to customer sites. Requirements may include, but are not limited to, proof of identification, proof of certification to
* Perform the work required, customer health and safety requirements, etc.

**Qualifications**
------------------

**Apart from these more technical skills, we are also looking for:**

* a strong desire to learn and expand your skill set,
* enjoy engaging and visiting customers on-site,
* a strong attention to detail and processes, ensuring compliance with Agilent's Quality standards,
* ability to handle customer expectations and balance customer requirements with business needs,
* valid driving license


Proximity to an international airport would be an advantage for travelling.

**Your profile:**  

* You have a degree in the fields of Chemistry, Biochemistry or similar
* Good knowledge in Chromatography – both LC and LCMS and special valves is a plus.
* Experience with the Agilent solutions is a plus but not a requirement
* Excellent verbal and written communication skills
* Fluent in English & Swedish
* You enjoy travelling and meeting customers every day

  

Application:  

Please forward your application and CV as soon as possible via our online recruitment system.**Additional Details**


This job has a full time weekly schedule. It includes the option to work remotely.
Our pay ranges are determined by role, level, and location. Within the range, individual pay is determined by work location and additional factors, including job-related skills, experience, and relevant education or training. During the hiring process, a recruiter can share more about the specific pay range for a preferred location. Pay and benefit information by country are available at: https://careers.agilent.com/locations

title: C++ Engineer
description:
Engineering
Client C++
Permanent
Stockholm
We are looking for a highly motivated and aspiring Software Engineer with a proven understanding of C++ to join our team. In this role, you will be responsible for developing, crafting, and maintaining software systems that integrate well with Spotify’s playback ecosystem and generate consumption datasets. We are a strongly collaborative team, and the majority of our work is centered around communication, brainstorming and looking for phenomenal solutions together. We work closely not only with software engineers, data scientists, product managers, finance team across the business as our mission is producing large volumes of high quality data.
What You'll Do

* Design, develop, test, and maintain solutions in C++.
* Collaborate with multi-functional teams to capture requirements and build data products.
* Perform root cause analysis on data and processes in order to answer business questions and find opportunities for improvement.
* Evolving our systems towards technical excellence by improving quality through testing, tooling and continuously evaluating performance at scale.
* Have a lot of fun and work with phenomenal people!

Who You Are

* You have experience designing, refactoring, writing and maintaining C++ code.
* You are curious about data and have experience writing SQL/BigQuery queries to debug, validate, and analyze event data.
* You are curious about mobile development architecture; experience on android and/or iOS development is a plus.
* You value learning a diverse set of tools and enjoy solving different kinds of problems.
* You like working in collaboration.
* You are happy to work with a highly async and distributed team.

Where You'll Be

* This role is based in Stockholm.
* We offer you the flexibility to work where you work best! Our team is located in Stockholm, Gothenburg and London. There will be some in person meetings, but still allows for flexibility to work from home.

Learn about life at Spotify


Spotify is an equal opportunity employer. You are welcome at Spotify for who you are, no matter where you come from, what you look like, or what’s playing in your headphones. Our platform is for everyone, and so is our workplace. The more voices we have represented and amplified in our business, the more we will all thrive, contribute, and be forward-thinking! So bring us your personal experience, your perspectives, and your background. It’s in our differences that we will find the power to keep revolutionizing the way the world listens.  

At Spotify, we are passionate about inclusivity and making sure our entire recruitment process is accessible to everyone. We have ways to request reasonable accommodations during the interview process and help assist in what you need. If you need accommodations at any stage of the application or interview process, please let us know - we’re here to support you in any way we can.  

Spotify transformed music listening forever when we launched in 2008. Our mission is to unlock the potential of human creativity by giving a million creative artists the opportunity to live off their art and billions of fans the chance to enjoy and be passionate about these creators. Everything we do is driven by our love for music and podcasting. Today, we are the world’s most popular audio streaming subscription service.
Our global benefits


Extensive learning opportunities, through our dedicated team, GreenHouse.
Flexible share incentives letting you choose how you share in our success.
Global parental leave, six months off - for all new parents.
All The Feels, our employee assistance program and self-care hub.
Flexible public holidays, swap days off according to your values and beliefs.

title: After Sales Technical Specialist
description:
W ABB pomagamy przemysłowi wyprzedzać konkurencję - działać sprawniej i ekologicznie. U nas postęp to standard – dla Ciebie, Twojego zespołu i całego świata. Jako globalny lider dajemy Ci to, czego potrzebujesz, by to osiągnąć. Nie zawsze będzie łatwo, rozwój wymaga determinacji. Ale w ABB nigdy nie będziesz działać sam. Zarządzaj tym, co porusza świat.


Stanowisko to podlega:


Technical Support Manager **Your Responsibilities**

* Customer Support & Diagnostics: Assist customers with our products by analyzing issues, reviewing logs, performing remote diagnostics, and reproducing problems in lab environments.
* Cross-Functional Collaboration: Work closely with R&D, front-end teams, and end customers to resolve challenges and improve product support.
* Technical Enablement: Contribute to software development by integrating supportability features such as fault tracing tools, guides, and logging mechanisms.
* On-Site Engagements: Occasionally participate in field activities to troubleshoot complex issues and perform system health checks.
* Continuous Growth & Autonomy: Stay updated on product and technology developments while enjoying a flexible role that encourages technical discussions and personal influence over your workday.

 **Your Background**:

* Relevant Experience: Background in process automation, system servicing, maintenance, or commissioning—or a degree in a related technical field.
* Technical Proficiency: Familiarity with ABB PA PCP products and technologies like Microsoft platforms, virtualization, network communication, Red Hat OpenShift, and Kubernetes.
* Curiosity & Drive: Strong interest in digital solutions, paired with self-motivation and a desire to continuously learn new technologies.
* Collaborative Mindset: Proven ability to take ownership and work effectively both independently and within a team.
* Communication & Flexibility: Proficient in Swedish and English, and open to domestic and international travel when needed.

**What’s in it for you?**

We empower you to take initiative, challenge ideas, and lead with confidence. You’ll grow through meaningful work, continuous learning, and support that’s tailored to your goals. Every idea you share and every action you take contributes to something bigger.

**More about us:**


Join our global team as a Technical Support Specialist, where you will work with cutting-edge process automation products within the Energy, Process, and Marine industries. This role offers a unique blend of independent work and collaborative problem-solving, allowing you to influence your workday and engage with a variety of technical challenges.

title: Radioingenjör inom säker kommunikation
description:
**Är du en radioingenjör med intresse för säker kommunikation och spännande projekt inom Totalförsvaret? Combitech söker ingenjörer till vårt expanderande affärsområde med fokus på radioteknik och säker kommunikation. Med placeringsort i Växjö, Göteborg eller Helsingborg får du möjlighet att arbeta med kravspecificering, tester och integration av avancerade kommunikationssystem. Ta chansen och bli en del av vårt team och bidra till att stärka kommunikationslösningar** **inom Sverige.**

**Din roll som radioingenjör inom säker kommunikation**
-------------------------------------------------------


Som radioingenjör hos oss får du möjlighet att arbeta med en rad olika intressanta uppgifter, såsom provning och utvärdering av kommunikationssystem. Du kan även arbeta med design och utveckling av testutrustning för både hård- och mjukvara och support och service hos kund av införda system.  

  

Du kommer vara delaktig i flera faser av projekten, från kravspecificering och utvärdering till tester, verifiering och integration av systemlösningar. Efter driftsättning kommer du även att erbjuda teknisk assistans, driftstöd samt genomföra både förebyggande och avhjälpande underhåll.

  

Vi erbjuder även teknisk expertkompetens, administrativt stöd och projektledning till våra kunder. Omfattningen av dessa uppgifter varierar beroende på projektets art och fas. Huvudfokus ligger på SDR, Software Define Radio, men även områden som drift, underhåll och säkerhet förekommer. Du kan komma att arbeta med frågor inom radio- och satellitkommunikation, IP-kommunikation, vågutbredning eller antennteknik.


Du kommer ingå i flera grupperingar som stöttar dig för att du ska få bästa möjliga förutsättningar. Arbetet kan utföras på något av våra kontor, men tjänsteresor är en naturlig del av jobbet. Resor sker mestadels inom Sverige, men internationella resor kan förekomma.

**Vem är du?**
--------------


Vi söker dig med radiokompetens eller teknisk bakgrund inom området, även andra ingenjörsområden är av intresse. Du kan vara en bit in i karriären eller i början, båda alternativen är intressanta. Erfarenhet av arbete inom försvarsmakten/försvarsindustrin är meriterande.

  

B-körkort är önskvärt men inget krav, då vissa tjänsteresor underlättas av bilkörning. Flytande svenska och engelska i tal och skrift är ett krav, eftersom arbetet ofta dokumenteras i rapportform och kan innebära kontakt med både nationella och internationella aktörer.

  

Vi söker dig som är bekväm med att arbeta självständigt och har en förmåga att ta egna initiativ. För att lyckas hos oss är det viktigt att du är tekniskt intresserad och har en god teknisk förståelse. Vi värderar personliga egenskaper så som intresse och engagemang för det du företar dig, samt viljan att lära dig nya saker.

**Då tjänsten innebär arbete som omfattas av försvarssekretess krävs det att du genomför och godkänns i en säkerhetsprövning med registerkontroll.**

 **Urval sker löpande. Vi ser fram emot din ansökan!**

**Kom & gör skillnad**
----------------------


Vi tror att man gör ett bättre jobb om man kan fokusera på rätt saker, därför gör vi det lätt att kombinera jobbet med vardagen. Vi satsar på våra medarbetare, de utgör kärnan, hjärnan och hjärtat i vår verksamhet. Dessutom står vi på en stadig grund av högteknologi, forskning och anställningstrygghet med försvars- och säkerhetskoncernen Saab som ägare.


För oss handlar det om hållbarhet - vi vill bli branschens mest hållbara företag; och för att vara ett hållbart företag i en hållbar framtid behöver vi investera i våra medarbetare. För oss är din återhämtning, dina utvecklingsmöjligheter och din trygghet lika viktigt som företagets framgång - utan våra medarbetare står vi stilla.

**Vill du veta mer om hur det är att arbeta hos oss? Kolla in** våra karriärsidor!


Kontaktperson: Emil Joelsson +46 73 4375190


Vi undanber oss rekryteringssamarbeten.

title: Senior System Verification Engineer
description:
**Location:**

Ludvika, Dalarna County, Sweden
**Job ID:**

R0100806
**Date Posted:**

2025-09-23
**Company Name:**

HITACHI ENERGY SWEDEN AB
**Profession (Job Category):**

Engineering & Science
**Job Schedule:**

Full time
**Remote:**

No
**Job Description:**

**The opportunity**

We are looking for a Senior System Verification Engineer to join our team. This role offers the chance to work with diverse systems, expand your knowledge through engaging tasks, and contribute to a highly skilled and professional team.


Over 60 years ago, Hitachi Energy revolutionized long-distance electricity transmission with High Voltage Direct Current (HVDC) technology. Today, HVDC systems can deliver up to 12 gigawatts of power at voltage levels of up to 1,100 kV, spanning distances over 3,000 kilometers.


You will play a key role in the success of the Modular Advanced Control for HVDC (MACH™) — the heart of HVDC stations. MACH™ provides unmatched computational capacity and integrates all control and protection functions, including advanced fault registration and remote-control capabilities. Designed to operate continuously for over 30 years, MACH™ ensures reliable control and protection throughout the system’s lifetime.


As part of our global R&D organization, you’ll collaborate daily with colleagues from MACH teams in Sweden, Poland, and India. You’ll contribute to the development of the next generation of MACH™ systems, working in a team led by Marcus Bergblomma.


**How you’ll make an impact**

* Work with embedded real-time systems to prepare test environments, test code, and applications based on system requirements and international standards
* Build test environments using MACH Control System components, including computers, servers, I/O boards, and simulation tools
* Develop test cases and scenarios to verify system requirements, focusing on non-functional aspects such as communication and data acquisition
* Investigate system limits and performance through targeted test scenarios
* Execute test cases for various software and hardware releases in the test lab
* Map test cases to system requirements
* Design and implement new or improved test automation functions (e.g., instrument control, software loading, data evaluation)
* Automate tests using our test automation framework and ensure ongoing maintenance
* Take on additional responsibilities within the system verification team, such as lab maintenance, license management, and customer support

**Your background**

* Bachelor’s or master’s degree in computer science, Electrical Engineering, Electronics Engineering, or a related field — or equivalent experience
* ISTQB or SSDLC certification, and 5+ years of experience in embedded system development or testing is a strong advantage
* Familiarity with graphical programming tools such as LabVIEW, MATLAB Simulink, LTspice, HiDraw, and the MACH platform
* Experience working with large modular systems similar to MACH™
* Knowledge of Git is a plus
* Proficient in Python and C# with solid object-oriented design skills; familiarity with SOLID principles is beneficial
* Fluent in English; Swedish is a plus

  

**What we offer**

* Collective agreement
* Flexible working time
* Health care and wellness allowance
* Fantastic career possibilities within Hitachi Energy both within Sweden and globally
* Mentor to support you throughout onboard phase
* Various trainings and education supporting employee development
* Diversified company with over 70+ nationalities working in Sweden
* Supplementary compensation for parental leave
* Employee Benefit Portal with thousands of discounts and perks

**More About Us**

If you are passionate about people and how groups work together, we encourage you to apply! Applications will be reviewed on an ongoing basis.


Talent Acquisition Partner: Agnieszka Borkowska, +41 76 317 40 67, agnieszka.borkowska@hitachienergy.com will answer your questions about the position.


Union representatives – Sveriges Ingenjörer: Mikael Hjort, +46 107-38 25 73; Ledarna: Frank Hollstedt, +46 10 7387048; Unionen: Fredrik Holmgren, +46 107-38 21 85.


**Qualified individuals with a disability may request a reasonable accommodation if you are unable or limited in your ability to use or access the Hitachi Energy career site as a result of your disability. You may request reasonable accommodations by completing a** **general inquiry form** **on our website. Please include your contact information and specific details about your required accommodation to support you during the job application process.**
------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------

**This is solely for job seekers with disabilities requiring accessibility assistance or an accommodation in the job application process. Messages left for other purposes will not receive a response.**

title: Research Engineer for Analysis and Control of System Dynamics models
emails: barreau@kth.se, barreau@kth.se, pernestal@kth.se, pernestal@kth.se, jonas1@kth.se, jonas1@kth.se
description:
### **Job description**


The Division of Decision and Control Systems is currently looking for a research engineer with an engineering background and interest in control systems, mathematics, programming, and learning for control. The successful candidate will join an interdisciplinary team on the project: developing a framework for analysis and control of system dynamics models. We propose, for this pre-study, to focus on the use case of policy synthesis for faster adoption of electric trucks.


The Division of Decision and Control Systems conducts fundamental research in networked control systems, cyber-physical systems, system identification, and transport systems. Industrial projects involve partners such as Hitachi Energy, ABB, Ericsson, and Scania. A major part of the research is conducted within the framework of the Wallenberg AI, Autonomous Systems and Software Program. We have a large academic network and collaborate with researchers at Caltech, MIT, UC Berkeley, Stanford, among others.

### **What we offer**

* A position at a leading technical university that generates knowledge and skills for a sustainable future.
* Engaged and ambitious colleagues along with a creative, international and dynamic working environment
* Work in Stockholm, in close proximity to nature
* Guidance on relocating and settling in KTH and in Sweden .


Read more about what it's like to work at KTH and our benefits.

### **Qualifications**

**Requirements**

* A graduate degree or an advanced level (higher education) in the research subject or equivalent competence.
* Good command in English, as it is required in the daily work.
* Knowledge of Python.

**Preferred qualifications**

* Awareness of diversity and equal opportunity issues, with specific focus on gender equality
* Collaborative abilities
* Independence
* Familiarity with Tensorflow or PyTorch


Great emphasis will be placed on personal skills.

### **Trade union representatives**


Contact information to trade union representatives.

### **To apply for the position**


Log into KTH's recruitment system to apply for this position. You are responsible for ensuring that your application is complete according to the instructions in the ad.

**The application must include:**

* CV including relevant professional experience and knowledge.
* Copy of diplomas and grades from your previous university studies. Translations into English or Swedish if the original documents have not been issued in any of these languages.
* Brief account of why you want to conduct research, your academic interests and how they relate to your previous studies and future goals. Maximally two pages long.


Your complete application must be received by KTH no later than the last day of application, midnight CET/CEST (Central European Time/Central European Summer Time).

### **About the employment**


The employment is valid for a limited time according to the agreement - for up to 4 months, with access according to agreement.

### **Other information**


Striving towards gender equality, diversity and equal conditions is both a question of quality for KTH and a given part of our values


For information about processing of personal data in the recruitment process.


It may be the case that a position at KTH is classified as a security-sensitive role in accordance with the Protective Security Act (2018:585). If this applies to the specific position, a security clearance will be conducted for the applicant in accordance with the same law with the applicant's consent. In such cases, a prerequisite for employment is that the applicant is approved following the security clearance.


We firmly decline all contact with staffing and recruitment agencies and job ad salespersons.


Disclaimer: *In case of discrepancy between the Swedish original and the English translation of the job announcement, the Swedish version takes precedence.*

  

About KTH KTH Royal Institute of Technology in Stockholm has grown to become one of Europe’s leading technical and engineering universities, as well as a key centre of intellectual talent and innovation. We are Sweden’s largest technical research and learning institution and home to students, researchers and faculty from around the world. Our research and education covers a wide area including natural sciences and all branches of engineering, as well as architecture, industrial management, urban planning, history and philosophy. Read more here

title: Senior Electronics Development Engineer
description:
We are currently in an exciting phase with several large development projects, and we're seeking talented individuals to help us shape the technology for **Kongsberg Maritimes** world class products.


In the role as **Senior** **Electronics Development Engineer** in our Hardware & FPGA department, you will be part of a vibrant and highly competent team that develops electronics and electro-mechanics for our Automation and Control product portfolio. You get the opportunity to apply your knowledge in both large and small development projects, in collaboration with software developers and system architects. You will follow products through the whole lifecycle, from idea to design, development, testing and maintenance.


Innovate for a better world with us! Join us in one of Norway’s leading tech communities and be part of shaping the maritime future!

**What you will be doing**

* Participate in concept studies and prototyping.
* Lead specification, architecture and design.
* Create schematics and simulations.
* Perform testing and documentation.
* Collaborate on integration of electronics in systems with FPGA, software and mechanics.
* Maintain designs and products through the whole lifecycle.

**We think you should have**

* Bachelor’s or master’s degree within electronics, cybernetics or other relevant areas.
* 5+ years of experience in one or more of the following areas is desirable:
	+ Embedded design (E.g. Ethernet, PCIe, DDR 4/5)
	+ Digital, Analog or Power Electronics
	+ Functional Safety / Reliability
	+ EMC
	+ Simulation
	+ Experience with PCB design is an advantage but not a requirement.


At **KONGSBERG**, we believe that diversity fuels innovation. We encourage you to apply, even if you do not meet every requirement. Your unique perspective is valuable to us. Your skills, attitude and perspective could be exactly what we are looking for!

*This employment may require security clearance by the Norwegian National Security Authority, clearance through Civil Aviation Authority or a background check.*  



**You** **are able to:**

* act on own initiative, make things happen and accept responsibility for the results.
* have a positive mindset.
* produce fresh and imaginative ideas and solutions.
* use an analytical approach to problem solving.
* co-operate well with others, share knowledge, experience, information and support others in the pursuit of team goals.

**Why join us**

* A work environment with «open doors» and a culture to bring out the best from each other.
* Mentoring of new employees.
* Opportunities to develop and challenge yourself throughout your career.
* Competitive salary / benefit packages and hybrid working arrangements.

**Work location**  

Kongsberg, Horten, Ålesund or Kristinehamn (Sweden)

**Point of Contact**  

Håkon Devold +47 480 38 220


Our **Automation & Control division** develops technology, products, and solutions applicable for maritime vessels, offshore production units, and fisheries & aquaculture. We look at the **ocean space** as our operating area where we deliver a wide range of products and services. Our deliveries ranges from single products to fully integrated systems and solutions. **Automation & Control** serve a wide range of market segments. Through our comprehensive portfolio of offerings Automation & Control has been recognized as a world leader in our core markets for the last decades.


Pro**tech**ting people and planet.

title: Fullstack Engineer
description:
At Svea Solar, we have a clear vision - to fix the planet. As Sweden’s and one of Europe’s leading players in energy technology, we are driving the energy transition with solar power and smart energy solutions.
  

  

We’re now expanding our website team with an **Fullstack Engineer**. Are you ready to join the Power Shift?

### **About the role & the team**


As our **Fullstack Engineer (with a frontend focus)** in the Websiteteam, you’ll be part of a talented and ambitious agile team. Together you’ll design and implement technical solutions for Svea Solar’s website and related areas, ensuring a seamless experience between our site and our smart energy platform *Sunbeam*.


You’ll work closely with another Teach lead, a frontend engineer, an analyst, and a product manager, reporting to our Engineering Manager Anna. We follow a collaboration-first approach, working three days a week from our Stockholm office.

 **Your key responsibilities:**


Build and maintain both frontend and backend features, with a strong focus on frontend.  

* 

Develop modern, accessible, and semantically correct websites using HTML5 and CSS3 (SASS).  
* 
* Write clean, maintainable, and well-structured code in **TypeScript/JavaScript** and **React.js**.

Design and implement REST APIs and integrations with our CMS written in Python.  
* 

Collaborate with designers, product managers, and fellow engineers to create functional and user-friendly solutions.  
* 
* Contribute to architectural discussions and best practices, supporting long-term scalability and event-driven design.
* 

### 
**Are we a match?**

**We’re looking for you who…**

* Value team success over personal success and thrive in a collaborative dynamic environment.

Have at least 5 years of professional experience in software development, including at least 2 years in backend.  

* 

Have strong experience with: TypeScript, React, Node.js, Express, REST APIs, CMS, and event-driven design.  
* 

Have solid knowledge of HTML5, CSS3, and SASS.  
* 
* Are fluent in English and Swedish.  

  

**Bonus points if you..**

Have experience with Next.js, i18next, Motion/React Spring, Tailwind, Styled-components.  
* 
* Are comfortable with Python, Django, Wagtail, or Deno.

### **Life as a Power Shifter - What do we offer you**

 **The opportunity to make an impact** – your work directly contributes to fixing the planet and driving the energy transition.

**A value-driven workplace** – read more about our values here.

**The chance to own your results** – grow, take responsibility, and power up as both we and the energy industry evolve.

**Diversity and inclusivity** – different perspectives drive innovation. Here, you can be yourself and contribute with your experiences, identities, and ideas.

**Employment benefits** – occupational pension, 30 days of vacation, wellness allowance, parking, and more.

**Flexibility/ hybrid work** – work up to two days a week from home.  

  

Want to see what life at Svea Solar really looks like? Follow us on Instagram: @LifeAtSveaSolar

### **Who are we**


As Sweden’s - and one of Europe’s - leading providers of energy tech and solar, we help our customers optimize their energy use with smart, connected solutions. From solar panels to heat pumps, batteries, EV chargers, and software, we’re shaping the future of energy. We call it **The Power Shift**. And the ones driving it? **Power Shifters**.


#LILS2

### **About our recruitment process**

* With structured interviews and assessments through Alva Labs, we make sure our recruitment process is fair, inclusive, and unbiased - because diversity is key to innovation!
* Read more about our Recruitment process here.  

  

**Ready to become a Power Shifter?** We review applications on a rolling basis, so don’t wait to send yours in!
