title: Test & Verification Lead
description:
**Excillum designs, develops, and manufactures X-ray sources used for quality assurance in industries such as semiconductor, electronics, and battery manufacturing. Other applications include drug development and research in fields like biology, medicine, and materials science. Excillum has customers across Europe, Asia, and the United States. We are now in an exciting phase of advancing the industrialization of the company, and a key part of this journey is developing processes that ensure our products not only remain world-leading in performance, but are also robust, safe, and reliable for industrial production and use. Here, you will have the opportunity to make an impact from the initial idea all the way to the finished product, establish ways of working that take us to the next level, and contribute to the development of technology that truly makes a difference.**


You will be part of a team of four people; a Compliance Engineer, two technical writers, and your closest manager. You will work closely with your own team as well as experts in electronics, software, research, production, marketing, sales, and more. Today, we are around 90 employees at the headquarters in Kista, with both labs and production on-site, which means you will be working close to the products being developed.

**A few words from your future manager**

*“Hi! My name is Anton Persson and I have been working at Excillum since 2020. Excillum is a workplace characterized by high ambition, curiosity, and a strong spirit of collaboration. Here, you never stop learning. In this role, you are expected to act as a key connector, working closely with most of our departments, from researchers and engineers to production, as part of our efforts to become more industrialized. If you are motivated by driving change and working with complex, world-class products, you will thrive with us!”*

**Work tasks**
--------------


As our Test & Verification Lead, you will act as the central connector between software and hardware, serving as a key point of contact for several of our teams. As we move towards becoming a more industrialized organization, the demands on quality and reliability, both internally and externally, are increasing. In this role, you will play a crucial part in ensuring that our products and ways of working function as intended and meet the highest standards. You will also serve as an important sounding board for your manager on matters related to testing and requirements management, ensuring that all testing and verification activities are comprehensive and follow a structured process.

**For example, you will…**

* Coordinate the verification activities in projects and align with the team project managers and design owners.
* Ensure both requirement specification and risk analysis are covered by the verification plan.
* Define and improve the verification processes, tools and best practices.
* Have an overall knowledge of all tests that are performed on a product and make sure there is complete verification coverage.
* Keep track on, analyze and present test results. You communicate verification status to stakeholders.
* Develop tests, plan, and practically execute verification of systems against system specification.
* Create and maintain structure for documentation regarding verification from project to product.
* Create and maintain structures for reporting, summarizing and finalizing verification data.

**We are looking for**
----------------------


This is a role for someone who enjoys contributing to development and improvement, who takes responsibility, and who likes to think in new ways. You thrive with varied tasks and are ready to step in where needed – at Excillum, we work together as a team!

**In addition, you have…**

* A university degree (BSc or MSc) in mechanics, physics, electronics, mechatronics, or a related field
* At least a few years of professional experience in testing and verification of products involving both hardware and software
* Experience in driving and developing ways of working within the field
* Excellent command of English, both spoken and written

**Other information**

* Start: As agreed
* Scope: Full-time
* Location: Kista
* Contact: Recruitment consultants Johanna Sörell, johanna.sorell@academicwork.se and Minna Loosaar, minna.loosaar@academicwork.se
* We work with ongoing selection, so please apply as soon as possible if you are interested.

**Our recruitment process**
---------------------------

* Phone interview with Academic Work
* In-depth interview with Academic Work + personality test & problem-solving test
* Interviews with Excillum + case
* Reference check + decision

title: Graduate Trainee Engineer
description:
**We are Siemens**

  

Siemens is a leading global technology company that has stood for technical excellence, innovation, quality, and reliability for more than 175 years. Operating worldwide, we focus on intelligent infrastructure for buildings and distributed energy systems, on automation and digitalization in the process and manufacturing industries. With our technology, we connect the real world with the digital world. We want to develop technical solutions that benefit a more environmentally friendly and sustainable world. To achieve our ambitious goals, we are looking for new talents who share our pursuit of a sustainable future.


We are now looking for a talented graduate, to join our team at Siemens Digital Industries Software.

 **About the Position**

  

Over 25 intensive and exciting months, the program will provide you with unique expertise within Siemens and the opportunity to establish a global network within the organisation. You will be able to manage and plan rotations within the organisation yourself and gain experience working on real project assignments based on business needs. To be successful, it is essential that you are proactive and genuinely committed, and that you are attracted by the advanced technology and innovations that characterise Siemens. You will work with the latest technology and build the competencies you need for the future. As a graduate with us, you will have a permanent position from day one and a dedicated manager and mentor to support your career in the company.  



  

**We offer you:**

  

* A permanent position after completing the program.
* Several rotations based on your own ambitions and interests.
* Opportunities for study visits both within Siemens and at other companies.
* Training in, for example, company and product knowledge, sales, leadership, and project management.
* An exciting job where you will work at the forefront of digitalisation and help the Nordic market remain leading and sustainable.
* We provide you with the network, knowledge, and competence to strengthen your career in the best possible way. Siemens Digital Industries Software's Swedish offices are located in **Stockholm.**

**About you:**

  

* You will graduate with a Master of Science in Engineering degree no later than spring 2025 and are at the beginning of your career; your degree should not be older than two years.
* You are a communicative team player with the ambition to develop yourself, the business you work in, and our customers in various industries.
* You are a goal-oriented and driven person.
* You have very good written and spoken knowledge of both Swedish and English.
* You have a valid work permit.
* You are attracted to working in an international environment.
* You want to work closely with technology and business development.

 **What else do I need to know?**

  

The program starts from mid-October 2025, and you will be permanently employed by Siemens Industry Software AB. After completing the program, you will take the next step in your continued career with a placement within Siemens Digital Industries Software in Stockholm, Solna, Arenastaden.

 **Selection Process!**


Selection, interviews with future managers and former trainees, and feedback will take place continuously during the advertising period. We recommend that you apply as soon as possible if you are interested and to avoid missing out on this opportunity.


To apply, please prepare your CV and cover letter in English. The application window closes on **Friday, October 3rd**, but we encourage early submissions to maximise your chances.


We look forward to receiving your application and potentially welcoming you to our Siemens team!

 **Why Working at Siemens Software?**

  

We are an equal opportunity employer and value diversity at our company. We do not discriminate based on race, religion, color, national origin, sex, gender, gender expression, sexual orientation, age, marital status, veteran status, or disability status.

**Transform the everyday and shape the future of your career with us.**


Siemens Digital Industries Software is your place to thrive. Whether you’re a current student, recent graduate or postgraduate. In our talent hiring programs you will find the trust and freedom to succeed, while building a solid foundation for your professional career. You will have the chance to work on real projects, providing value to our future success and making an impact for our customers.


Visit: https://www.sw.siemens.com/en-US/careers/student-programs-and-early-careers/
company_description: We are a leading technology company - focused on industry, infrastructure, transport, and healthcare - that transforms the everyday of billions of people.

title: Full Stack Developer Intern (Remote)
company_industry: Mechanical Or Industrial Engineering, Technology, Information and Internet, and Information Services
description:
Are you a passionate aspiring
 **Full Stack Developer** 
 with expertise in
 **Next.js** 
 , eager to revolutionize the world of online education? Do you thrive in fast-paced, innovative environments where your contributions directly shape the future of learning? If so, we have an exciting internship opportunity for you!
   

  

**About Coursfy**
 Coursfy is a cutting-edge e-learning platform designed to empower instructors and learners with flexibility, creativity, and autonomy. Our mission is to create a seamless, intuitive educational experience through advanced technology, prioritizing simplicity and ease of use.
   

  

 Why Join Coursfy?
   

  

* Innovative Technology: Work on a platform that harnesses the power of Next.js to redefine online education.
* Impactful Work: Your Next.js expertise will enhance the experience for millions of global users.
* User-Centric Design: Collaborate to ensure our platform’s interface remains intuitive and accessible.
* Dynamic Team: Join a passionate group of professionals dedicated to transforming learning.
* Professional Growth: Gain hands-on experience in modern web development and grow your career in a supportive, tech-driven environment.


**Key Responsibilities**
* Develop and maintain robust, scalable web applications using Next.js as the core framework.
* Implement dynamic, server-side rendering (SSR) and static site generation (SSG) to optimize performance.
* Collaborate with designers and product managers to craft seamless, responsive user interfaces.
* Write clean, maintainable, and efficient code, leveraging the full potential of Next.js features.
* Optimize for SEO and performance, ensuring fast and accessible user experiences.
* Troubleshoot and debug issues, contributing to the continuous improvement of the platform.
* Stay updated with the latest developments in Next.js and the web development ecosystem.


**Requirements**
* Strong proficiency in Next.js and related technologies (React.js, Redux, JavaScript, TypeScript, etc.).
* Familiarity with server-side rendering, static site generation, and API routes in Next.js.
* Experience with front-end technologies (HTML, CSS, MUI, TailwindCSS, etc.).
* Knowledge of back-end development (Node.js, RESTful APIs, and microservices architecture).
* Understanding of databases (SQL, NoSQL) and version control systems like Git.
* Excellent problem-solving skills and attention to detail.
* Ability to work collaboratively in a team and independently on tasks.


 If you’re ready to bring your
 **Next.js** 
 skills to the forefront of online education, apply today! Let’s shape the future of learning together.

title: Full-Stack Engineer
description:
**Join Quartr’s Data Tooling Team!**
 Quartr is a software company serving the world of finance. The Quartr ecosystem gives millions of professional investors and corporate professionals worldwide easy access to first-party information from public companies through a variety of services – including a web app, a mobile app, and an API solution.
   

  

 Our Data Tooling team is dedicated to developing and enhancing the tools crucial for our in-house data sourcing operations. We are looking for a talented individual to join this dynamic team.
   

  

**Desired qualities and skill sets:**
* You take ownership and are focused on the needs of our internal users
* Mindful of the bigger picture and the impact of technical decisions
* Eager to learn and embrace challenges
* Excellent at communicating with others
* Passionate about our mission
* At least 2 years of professional experience


**Required technical skills:**
* TypeScript
* Node.js
* React
* Docker


**Preferred technical skills:**
* Next.js
* Cloud experience (preferably AWS)
* Knowledge of other programming languages


 At Quartr, we believe in individual freedom and trust that you know what work setup suits you best. Whether you prefer to work remotely, be based at one of our offices in Stockholm or Gothenburg, or something in between, the choice is yours. However, you must be based in Sweden with a valid work permit.
   

  

**What we offer:**
* Competitive salary
* Company option plan
* Top-notch equipment of your choice
* Wellness allowance
* Occupational pension


 By joining Quartr, you'll be part of a rapid growth story in the global investor relations space, where no day is like the other – in a good way.
   

  

**Note: We aren’t looking for consultants or assistance from recruitment agencies.**
****Learn more about Quartr****
**Quartr partners with Perplexity**
**Quartr secures Investment from Altos Ventures** 
 partnering with respected San Fransisco-based VC firm to further accelerate growth and continue transforming qualitative market research
   

  

**Fourth Most Innovative Company in Personal Finance 2024** 
 as recognized by Fast Company

title: Frontend Developer / Product Engineer
description:
*Do you want to build a product that is loved by its users?*
*StoreSprint is looking for a Front-end Developer / Product Engineer who wants to work on building the best platform for digitalization in retail operations.*
**What is StoreSprint?**
 To understand better what we do, imagine working in a store. When you come to work, you need to keep track of daily workflows, routine tasks and issues. If you work in a typical store, you might need to check off long checklists in excel, check your schedule in a calendar app and speak with colleagues in a chat app. Most likely, you will have to work in a plethora of different tools that don’t fit well together.
   

  

 The problem is that this experience is extremely messy for the employee. StoreSprint is the one stop shop for co-worker productivity. We are today used by 15,000 employees in companies like ICA, Rusta, Coop, and Hemköp. These organizations use our platform to make sure that everything is running efficiently. We provide a product that covers everything a typical employee needs to do during the day. No more moving from spreadsheets to whatsapp and logging time in a third tool.
   

  

 Our focus from the start has always been to win by providing the best user experience. That’s where you come in as a front-end engineer. We are looking for someone that loves building products. Someone that is inspired by products that feel perfect for the users. We are inspired by companies like Linear, who really care about the details that make a product great.
   

  

**Your typical day**
 Our culture is low on processes and high on agency. We will give you ownership. On a typical day, you will be working on a new feature end-to-end, or improving an existing one. You get feedback from users, you ship meaningful improvements to users.
   

  

**Skills And Requirements**
* You have experience working in a product led organization.
* You like ownership. You thrive in an environment where you make decisions end to end when developing the product.
* You are familiar with building frontends in React and React Native, as well as designing in Figma.


**Offer**
 We offer a competitive salary and a truly product led team. We all obsess over product and care about the end user experience. We have a really nice office in Södermalm in Stockholm and have a flexible remote work policy.

title: Developer - Backend
description:
Lysa’s vision is to set a new standard in savings through automation, efficiency and an unwavering dedication to our customers' best interests. We believe that many institutions work against their customers and we see a significant opportunity to establish a new financial champion. We are on a mission to make it simpler for people to save smarter. To achieve this, we need to continuously develop our product and expand into new markets. We have an outstanding team, but to further accelerate growth, we need more talented colleagues. We are currently seeking a Developer - Backend to join our team.
   

  

**The opportunity**
 From concept to deployment, you'll have a direct hand in creating features for our customers and colleagues. Collaborating closely with product managers, designers, legal experts, and customer service, you'll see your ideas come to life and make a real difference.
   

  

 You thrive on turning ideas into user friendly features and likely have the following background:
   

  

* A solid foundation in software development, with experience in Java or similar languages
* Experience of microservices
* Experience of applications running on cloud platforms such as AWS and distributed systems


 Technologies that we like at Lysa:
   

  

* Java
* Spring-boot
* Spring-cloud
* PostgreSQL
* Redis


 We are continuously updating to the latest versions to stay at the forefront of technology.
   

  

 As a colleague, we believe you share Lysa’s values: Earn trust, Add value, Have grit. You enjoy working in a cross-functional environment and strive to build efficient collaborations across the organisation.
   

  

**What We Offer**
 Lysa offers a unique opportunity to work at the forefront of the financial industry by creating a better way to save and invest.
   

  

 At Lysa, we cherish:
   

  

* A supportive Team environment: Where team members, from any background, are valued, heard, and empowered to take responsibility within a collaborative setting.
* Continuous growth and learning: Opportunities to grow and develop on the job, through mentorship and structured training initiatives.
* Work-Life harmony: We understand the importance of balancing professional achievements with personal well-being.


 Lysa is one of Sweden’s fastest growing FinTech companies - and the largest provider of digital discretionary portfolio management in the Nordics. Today Lysa has 185 000 paying customers and we manage about EUR 5bn. We have launched our platform in Denmark and Finland, and also in Germany. Our team of 75 has a mission-driven culture, a high employee Net Promoter Score (eNPS), and we work hard to have a significant impact on the European savings market. You will have the opportunity to participate in Lysa's long-term incentive program and thereby take part in Lysa's long-term growth.
   

  

 We are a highly skilled and motivated team where earning trust and adding value is at the core of our collaborative culture.
   

  

 Want to join us?
   

  

 Apply now by clicking the link below. For any questions, feel free to reach out to Fredrik, VP of Engineering, fredrik.lindstrom@lysa.se.
   

  

 We're excited to welcome you to our team of brilliant stars.

title: Fullstack Developer - Team Buying
description:
Tradera is a purpose-driven company with a belief that consumption has a significant impact on our planet. We are determined to use what we can control - our business, our voice, our creativity, and our platform - to take action.
   

  

 At Tradera, we are on a mission to "Drive the Transition to Sustainable Shopping" by changing the way people consume and resell preloved goods. Our technical platform is an enabler in facilitating this shift. Together, we are building large, distributed, and scalable systems capable of handling vast amounts of data. With more than five million weekly visits and 300 bids per second during peak traffic, our technical solutions face significant demands.
   

  

 To continue our mission, we need more people to join us!
   

  

**About the team:**
 We are currently seeking a fullstack developer to join our Buying Team at Tradera. In this role, you will collaborate with dedicated developers who are responsible for crafting customer-facing applications serving thousands of users across the Nordic region. You will have the opportunity to engage with the entire technical stack and influence its ongoing development.
   

  

 Your work will involve seamless coordination with our tech, product management, and UX teams to propel the next generation of our user-facing applications. You will play a pivotal role in tackling complex challenges and devising elegant, straightforward solutions that enhance the world-class experience on Tradera.com.
   

  

 Additionally, we take pride in fostering a friendly learning culture, where we actively encourage continuous growth and development among our team members.
   

  

**Example of responsibilities:**
* Build and maintain next generation scalable web applications
* Bind our frontend and backend services together
* Define and implement new platform initiatives and push Tradera’s web stack forward
* Collaborate with software engineers, product management, UX, and operational teams
* Ensure that our users’ experience is the very best it can be
* You will work with languages and technologies such as .NET Core/C#, JavaScript, TypeScript, React.js, Next.js, RabbitMQ, MongoDB, Google Cloud, Docker, Kubernetes and more.


**Who are you?**
* 5+ years of professional experience within web development in product-driven environments
* Experience in React.js and .NET/C#
* You know how to build user-friendly JavaScript/CSS applications
* Comfortable with tooling, build pipelines and getting code into production
* You have a Swedish residence permit or work visa to work in Sweden or within EU.


 At Tradera we offer competitive salaries and benefits like a yearly bonus and a generous pot for competence development. But most of all, you’ll get a little extra when you join us! Like a group of talented people who really love what we do and with strong belief that people deserve a smooth way to care about the planet!
   

  

 Come and join us – Don’t be square, get circular!

title: Game Developer
description:
****More independence, freedom, and better pay****
 Coody believes in combining the freedom and flexibility of freelancing with the security of traditional employment.
   

  

 It's not rocket science.
   

  

 Overpaid managers, fancy offices, and heavily burdened organizations are history.
   

  

 The tech talent of tomorrow deserves a new, independent, and well-paid standard.
   

  

 Welcome to what we call Gravity Free Consulting.
   

  

****Why Coody****
 At Coody, we cut out everything unnecessary to give more back to you as a consultant. And we have done it in the package of a slimmed and efficient organization, meaning no overpaid managers, no fancy offices and no luxurious conferences. But, what does this mean in practice?
   

  

**Maximized Compensation** 
 - Typically a +40% salary increase.
   

  

**Freedom & Flexibility** 
 - No bosses. All digital. Fully remote for those who prefer.
   

  

**Employment Security** 
 - Fixed salary, pension, insurance, paid vacation and a big educational fund.
   

  

**Shaping the Future** 
 - Projects and assignments for digital game changes like Mojang, Spotify, Volumental, Volvo Cars, Varjo, Toca Boca, Hemnet, and exciting startups and scaleups.
   

  

****This is Coody****
 We’re a diverse community of ambitious tech people from more than 14 nationalities working on exciting challenges with customers across Sweden, Finland, USA, and the UK in industries ranging from gaming, AR, EV, AI, Medtech and Fintech.
   

  

 Coody is more of a platform than a traditional consultancy. Everything we do, we do to make sure individuals working here can live according to their own priorities and unique ambitions. A consultant-first environment where you have better control over your career.
   

  

 Explore our
 **Employee Handbook** 
 and discover a company that actually puts consultants first.
   

  

****What you’ll be doing****
 As a consultant in Game Development at Coody, you’ll have the opportunity to work with some of the most inspiring digital entertainment companies in the world, in fields such as Games, AR/VR, Music, and other forms of interactive media. You’ll collaborate with cross-functional teams, including developers, designers, artists, producers, and product managers.
   

  

 You’ll need to be adaptable and ready to hit the ground running in new environments. We see every challenge as an opportunity to grow. Typically, you’ll work on 1-2 assignments per year for companies in industries that you’re passionate about.
   

  

****Who you are****
 We’re after talented game developers who love to build immersive experiences and bring ideas to life. You thrive in fast-paced environments, enjoy pushing technical boundaries, and want the freedom to work on exciting projects - without the corporate nonsense.
   

  

* 5+ years of experience in software development.
* Hands-on experience with building games, VR/AR, or similar interactive experiences.
* Solid skills in modern C++, Lua, AngelScript, or web technologies.
* Experience from Unreal Engine (a bonus).
* A relevant degree in Computer Science, Engineering, Game Development, or similar.
* Based in Sweden - You must have Swedish citizenship, a valid work visa, or permanent residency.
* Fluent in English (spoken and written)


****How to apply****
 Are you excited to take your career to the next level and meet the criterias? Apply now, and we'll be in touch shortly.

title: Bruce Studios is hiring a Android Developer
description:
Bruce Studios is on a mission to redefine how people train, recover, and feel good – every day.
   

  

 With thousands of members and over 1,000 partner studios across the Nordics, we offer the most flexible way to stay active and well. And we’re just getting started.
   

  

 We’re now looking for an Android Developer to our Tech Team in Stockholm, Sweden.
   

  

**Your mission**
 As our Android Developer, you will take full ownership of our Android app – from building new features and improving UX, to making sure our members get a smooth, smart, and delightful experience every time they open Bruce. You’ll work closely with product managers, designers, and backend developers, and be part of the full development lifecycle.
   

  

**What You´ll Do**
* Take charge of code review, testing, and continuous integration for our Android app
* Work cross-functionally to improve the overall user experience on our Android platform
* A/B-test new features to measure their results and impact
* Stay up-to-date with the latest developments in the Android ecosystem (developer tools, new Android APIs, market trends)
* Multi-task, organize, and prioritize work with the team
* Participate in roadmap planning, code reviews, problem-solving, and testing sessions
* Own and be involved in the development lifecycle from start to finish
* Perform other activities that broadly fall within the scope of the role


**What We Want You To Bring**
* Strong experience in Android development using Kotlin, Java, View-based layouts and the Android SDK
* Hands-on experience with Jetpack libraries, MVP architecture, and building production-ready apps
* Experience building and maintaining apps in production for several years
* Good communication skills in English or a Scandinavian language
* A proactive, solution-oriented approach and the ability to work independently
* A love for smart, clean code – and ideally some interest in fitness or wellness
* Bonus: experience working with AI-driven features, and/or technologies like Retrofit, Realm, and RxJava


**Our values at Bruce Studios**
 At Bruce Studios, our values guide everything we do—from how we work together to how we engage with our community.
   

  

* Own it – We take responsibility, make decisions, and follow through. We’re proactive, honest, and always learning from our mistakes.
* Be engaged – We’re all in. We respect each other’s time, stay curious, and continuously strive to improve.
* Be real – Authenticity is key. We communicate openly, support each other, and create a safe space where everyone can be themselves.
* Be adaptable – Change is constant, and we embrace it. We find solutions, stay flexible, and innovate together.
* Be bold – We challenge the status quo, take risks, and push boundaries while treatingeach other with kindness and respect.


 Want to be part of a team that lives these values every day? Apply now.
   

  

**What We Offer You**
* Fully renovated top-floor office with terrace, ideally located in central Stockholm
* 30 days of vacation
* Pension benefits
* Hybrid work setup with three office days per week
* A welcoming company culture and supportive team
* A Bruce Epic membership (yes, you get to workout too!)


**How To Apply**
 Does this role sound like the right fit for you? Great – we’d love to hear from you!
   

  

 Apply directly via Teamtailor by uploading your CV (in English or Swedish) and adding a short personal note about why you're excited about this opportunity and how you’d contribute to the team.
   

  

 We value a diverse and inclusive workplace, and we warmly welcome applicants of all gender identities, ages, backgrounds, and abilities.

title: Full Stack Engineer
job_function: Engineering, Product Management, and Information Technology
company_industry: Software Development, Environmental Services, and Retail
description:
💙 Sellpy’s vision is to empower everyone to live circularly. We believe that every item deserves a second life, and we see huge financial, social and environmental value in making sure this happens. Join us in building technology that drives real change – one line of code at a time.
 



  





**Fullstack Engineer** 




 At Sellpy, we love elegant code – and we hope you do too. Your work will be at the core of how millions of people shop pre-loved items, making circular consumption the new normal. You’ll design and build features across the stack, continuously improve our architecture, and help us scale a product that matters.
 



  





 We’re looking for someone who thrives in a fast-moving product environment, who loves solving challenges with simplicity, and who’s eager to grow by experimenting, learning, and pushing boundaries. Here, clean code, ownership and collaboration aren’t just buzzwords – they’re the foundation for how we work.
 



  





**In short, you will** 



* Build user-centric, next-generation web applications.
* Work with JavaScript, React/React Native & Node across the stack.
* Take ownership of features from idea to release and beyond.
* Ensure scalability, maintainability and simplicity in everything you build.
* Continuously improve Sellpy’s products and architecture.



  





**Requirements** 



* B.S. or M.S. in Computer Science (or related), or equivalent proven experience.
* 3+ years of professional software engineering experience.
* Strong knowledge of JavaScript.
* Experience from a fast-paced product environment.
* Fluency in written and spoken English.



  





 We think you’re someone who’s curious, open-minded and enjoys learning new things. You like collaborating with others, sharing ideas and finding simple solutions to complex problems. With a positive mindset and a drive to make a difference, you bring both energy and creativity into your work.
 



  





**We’d be impressed if you have** 



* Experience with React, React Native, Node.js, Web Components, logging & monitoring.
* Worked in a scaling, product-focused startup.
* Hands-on experience with continuous integration & deployment.
* Knowledge of AWS and Git.



  





**You get to** 



* Be part of a tech-minded company that's driving the change towards a sustainable lifestyle. In return, you will get direction, energy, and work on meaningful challenges daily.
* Benefit from hybrid work from our offices at Medborgarplatsen, Rosersberg, and from home.
* Work with highly skilled and motivated colleagues.
* Gain new skills with unlimited access to a learning platform.
* Grow professionally during monthly level-up days.
* Make use of prepaid vacation.
* Enjoy Sellpy credits and staff discounts at Sellpy and the H&M brands (Arket, COS, Other Stories, Weekday and more).
* Save up with a monthly pension plan.
* Engagement in Sellpy’s social traditions with game nights, interactive planning days, guest speakers and other activities.



  





**Location** 




 You’re welcome to work from our new office at Medborgarplatsen in Stockholm and from home. Ideally, we’d love to see you in the office regularly, as it helps create a positive and productive environment.
 



  





**Form of employment:** 
 Full-time
 



  





**Start:** 
 As agreed upon
 



  





 👉
 *Apply now and turn clean code into real impact for people and the planet.*

title: Fullstack-utvecklare
description:
Vi på Compileit är ett snabbrörligt företag som arbetar med att skapa innovativa tekniska lösningar för våra kunder, främst inom webb och app. Genom vår expertis har vi hjälpt flera stora aktörer såsom ICA, Barncancerfonden och Hästens att nå nya höjder.
   

  

 Just nu förbereder vi oss för spännande framtida projekt och söker därför prestigelösa och nyfikna fullstack-utvecklare som vill vara med på vår resa när tiden är rätt!
   

  

 Vad innebär rollen?
   

  

 Som fullstack-utvecklare hos oss kommer du att ha en nyckelroll i våra utvecklingsteam och arbeta nära både andra utvecklare och projektledare för att förstå kundernas behov.
   

  

 Du kommer att:
   

  

* Utveckla både frontend- och backend-komponenter för webbapplikationer eller appar
* Samarbeta med designers för att skapa en optimal användarupplevelse
* Omsätta designskisser till fungerande, skalbara och effektiva lösningar
* Skriva ren och testbar kod
* Integrera tredjeparts-API:er
* Delta i sprintplaneringar, stand-ups och retrospekt


 Urval av 🛠️ du kommer använda:
   

  

* Next.js
* React Native
* Typescript
* Node
* Serverless
* Tailwind
* PlanetScale


 Är detta något för dig?
   

  

 Vi söker dig som har en prestigelös inställning och alltid är nyfiken på att lära dig nya saker. Du trivs i en snabbföränderlig miljö där du får vara kreativ och arbeta agilt. Vi anser därför att du bör besitta följande:
   

  

* En relevant utbildning, t.ex. civilingenjör inom datavetenskap eller liknande
* Besitter minst 1-2 års erfarenhet av att utveckla både frontend och backend
* Stark kommunikationsförmåga, både på svenska och engelska
* Ett stort intresse för ny teknik och att utvecklas kontinuerligt


 Startdatum?
   

  

 Vi söker alltid duktiga utvecklare, vilket innebär att vi inte nödvändigtvis ser en omedelbar anställning just nu. Fattar vi tycke för varandra så håller vi kontakten tills tiden är mogen för oss båda. När tiden är rätt och vi får ett passande projekt kommer du att erbjudas en tillsvidareanställning med 6 månaders provanställning.
   

  

 Vad får du som anställd hos oss?
   

  

 ☀️ 6 veckors semester
   

  

 ⛷️ Maxat friskvårdsbidrag
   

  

 👩🏽‍💻 Generösa arbetsverktyg
   

  

 🏢 Centralt kontor
   

  

 🚚 Flyttdag
   

  

 👵🏼 Tjänstepension - från att du fyllt 25 år avsätter vi 8% av din månadslön i pension via SEB
   

  

 🚀 Var med och påverka! Som anställd hos oss är du en viktig del av vårt team och har en stor möjlighet att påverka vårt företags framsteg. Du är en medskapare av vår framtid!

title: Low-Code Developer
company: Novacura - Solutions and Services for ERP Systems
description:
**Kickstart Your Career as a Low-Code Developer!**
 Are you a recent graduate in software development, computer science or related field and ready to dive into the tech world?
   

  

 Novacura is looking for a Low-Code Developer to help businesses work smarter and faster by developing innovative solutions using Novacura Flow - our powerful low-code platform.
   

  

**About The Job**
 With Novacura Flow, we help customers streamline and optimize their workflows by seamlessly connecting people, systems, and data. The platform enables organizations to build custom applications with minimal coding, enhancing efficiency, flexibility, and digital transformation. With integrations to leading ERP systems like IFS and SAP, our solutions empower companies to optimize their operations.
   

  

 As a Low-Code Developer, you’ll play a key role in:
   

  

* Automating and improving business processes using Novacura Flow
* Customizing ERP solutions to meet specific customer needs


 In this role, you and your colleagues will be able to work and collaborate with large companies, both nationally and internationally in their core processes.
   

  

 We believe in shaping roles around people, not the other way around. As you grow, you’ll have the opportunity to tailor your path based on your interests, whether that’s software development, project management or process consulting. Your curiosity and drive will help define your journey.
   

  

 You will be working in-house at Novacura, collaborating closely with both colleagues and customers to deliver tailored solutions that drive real business value. We are building our presence in Stockholm, offering a dynamic and close-knit team environment. Recently, we moved into a brand-new, centrally located office on Birger Jarlsgatan - a great place to grow your career and make an impact.
   

  

**What are we looking for?**
 We are looking for a service-minded and customer-oriented individual with a flexible mindset. You thrive in a team environment, communicate effectively, and are always eager to learn and grow. In this role, you’ll often encounter challenges without immediate solutions so it’s important that you are comfortable with problem-solving, seeking support when needed, and proactively searching for information will be key to your success.
   

  

**To succeed in this role, you should have:**
* A university degree in Information Science, Technology, or a related field.
* Basic knowledge in SQL and database development.
* Basic knowledge in programming (C#, Javascript, Python or similar).
* Fluency in both Swedish and English (spoken and written).
* A proactive and solution-oriented mindset, with the ability to navigate new and complex challenges.


 It is a plus but not required if you have experience working with or knowledge of:
   

  

* IFS or other business systems (ERP).
* Low-Code platforms, such as Microsoft Power Apps/Power Platform, Mendix, Appian, OutSystems or similar.
* HTML, CSS and REST.


**What We Offer**
 We strongly believe in working with individuals who love what they do. When you get the opportunity to do what you do best, the result will be exceptional.
   

  

 We offer you a global development role in an innovative and fast-growing company at the forefront of technology, and we provide you with the opportunity to deliver real value to the customers. We offer competitive benefits, compensation based on competence/performance and highly talented Novacurians as great colleagues. Novacura offers a strong and open cooperate culture where each and every employee has the opportunity to influence the development of the company and our processes.
   

  

**How can I find out more?**
 If you think we’re a good match, apply today! Selection is done continuously so don’t miss your chance. For questions regarding the recruitment process, please contact Elin Mankert, Talent Acquisition, at elin.mankert@novacura.com. For questions regarding the position, please contact Emil Huusko, Team Lead, at emil.huusko@novacura.com.
   

  

**About Novacura**
 At Novacura we are passionate about solutions that enable our customers to work smarter and faster in their businesses. We work with several business systems and our own unique product Novacura Flow. We are a global organization with close cooperation between our offices in different countries and we have high ambitions to continue to develop and grow in all our markets.

title: Embedded Software Engineer
description:
****More independence, freedom, and better pay****
 Coody believes in combining the freedom and flexibility of freelancing with the security of traditional employment.
   

  

 It's not rocket science.
   

  

 Overpaid managers, fancy offices, and heavily burdened organizations are history.
   

  

 The tech talent of tomorrow deserves a new, independent, and well-paid standard.
   

  

 Welcome to what we call Gravity Free Consulting.
   

  

****Why Coody****
 At Coody, we cut out everything unnecessary to give more back to you as a consultant. And we have done it in the package of a slimmed and efficient organization, meaning no overpaid managers, no fancy offices and no luxurious conferences. But, what does this mean in practice?
   

  

**Maximized Compensation** 
 - Typically a +40% salary increase.
   

  

**Freedom & Flexibility** 
 - No bosses. All digital. Fully remote for those who prefer.
   

  

**Employment Security** 
 - Fixed salary, pension, insurance, paid vacation and a big educational fund.
   

  

**Shaping the Future** 
 - Projects and assignments for digital game changes like Mojang, Spotify, Volumental, Volvo Cars, Varjo, Toca Boca, Hemnet, and exciting startups and scaleups.
   

  

****This is Coody****
 We’re a diverse community of ambitious tech people from more than 14 nationalities working on exciting challenges with customers across Sweden, Finland, USA, and the UK in industries ranging from gaming, AR, EV, AI, Medtech and Fintech.
   

  

 Coody is more of a platform than a traditional consultancy. Everything we do, we do to make sure individuals working here can live according to their own priorities and unique ambitions. A consultant-first environment where you have better control over your career.
   

  

 Explore our
 **Employee Handbook** 
 and discover a company that actually puts consultants first.
   

  

****What you’ll be doing****
 As a consultant in Embedded Software at Coody, you’ll be tackling challenges for companies and products that truly make a difference. Your role will likely include:
   

  

* Developing & Optimizing products within Embedded or Firmware Software.
* Prototyping, Testing & Debugging on real hardware, ensuring top-notch quality and reliability throughout development.
* Collaborating on product and service strategy, engineering best practices, and building strong team spirit with your client.


****Who you are****
 We’re after skilled problem-solvers who love to build, optimize, and innovate in the embedded and firmware space. You thrive in hands-on development and enjoy tackling complex technical challenges.
   

  

* At least 4-5 years of experience as an Embedded Software Engineer.
* Deep expertise in C, C++ or Embedded Python, plus experience with other embedded or firmware related areas.
* A doer’s mentality - You get things done and have a track record to prove it.
* Relevant engineering degree - Background in vehicle, electronics, computer science, mechatronics, or similar fields.
* Based in Sweden - You must have Swedish citizenship, a valid work visa, or permanent residency, to apply.
* Fluent in English (spoken and written).


****How to apply****
 Are you excited to take your career to the next level and meet the criterias? Apply now, and we'll be in touch shortly.

****What you’ll be doing****
 As a
 **Machine Learning Engineer** 
 at Coody, you’ll dive into exciting and challenging AI projects to build and optimize machine learning models for production use cases, ensuring they are highly efficient and scalable. You’ll also design and build machine learning infrastructure, often in cloud environments, to support large-scale deployments for our customers. Here’s what your day-to-day will look like:
   

  

* Design, develop, and deploy scalable machine learning products
* Build and maintain infrastructure and tooling as a platform for data scientists
* Collaborate with cross-functional teams to integrate ML solutions into production systems
* Monitor and maintain the performance and reliability of ML models post-deployment
* Stay current with the latest advancements in machine learning and related technologies

****Who you are****
 We’re looking for Machine Learning Engineers with at least
 **3-4 years of experience** 
 and a proven track record of delivering real results. If you’ve got the following, you’re probably a great fit:
   

  

* A track-record of delivering machine learning models in production
* Cloud experience (e.g. AWS, Google Cloud, Kubernetes)
* Experience with distributed data tools (e.g., Spark, Dask, PySpark, Apache Beam)
* Expertise in Python and modern ML/AI libraries (PyTorch/TensorFlow, Transformers, LangChain, LangGraph, Vertex AI)
* Strong understanding of ML infrastructure: deployment, monitoring, debugging, optimization
* A degree in Computer Science, Engineering, Mathematics, Statistics, or something related
* Based in Sweden - You must have Swedish citizenship, a valid work visa, or permanent residency

****How to apply****
 Are you excited to take your career to the next level and meet the criterias? Apply now, and we'll be in touch shortly.

title: Senior Java Developer
description:
**About MAG (in brief!)**
 At MAG Interactive we make mobile games that feel good. As a part of this fun and dynamic industry, it’s our mission to spread joy to players around the world. With over 350 million downloads globally, we credit our success to our awesome colleagues and we hope you'll join the team!
   

  

**The role: Senior Java Developer**
 Join our small but mighty server team and help power the backend for all of MAG’s mobile games which are played by millions around the world. Based in our Stockholm office, you’ll work alongside three experienced developers to build and maintain the services that keep our games running smoothly.
   

  

 This is a unique opportunity for someone who enjoys solving complex challenges at scale. Our team may be small, but we’re responsible for a large, sophisticated system that supports the entire MAG game portfolio. From core multiplayer features to tools that help us operate and scale our games, you’ll get to work on projects that really matter.
   

  

 We’re currently using Java 21 and deploy everything ourselves using Google Cloud in a DevOps setup. You’ll find plenty of variety here and the chance to take real ownership of your work.
   

  

**What you’ll do:**
* Design and develop backend features and services
* Support game teams in Stockholm and Brighton
* Work on both quick-win projects and longer-term systems
* Take part in peer reviews and testing to ensure high-quality code
* Maintain and refactor legacy systems
* Deploy and monitor services in production (DevOps style)


**Your skills/experience:**
* Approx 5+ years of Java development experience
* Solid knowledge of cloud platforms (we use GCP)
* Experience with SQL and NoSQL databases
* A proactive, DevOps mindset. You help drive ideas from conception to release and share ownership of the feature in production
* Focus on writing clean, testable, maintainable code
* Excellent communication skills and team spirit
* Fluent in EnglishDegree in Computer Science/Engineering or equivalent experience


**Nice to have (but not a dealbreaker):**
* Interest in mobile gaming
* Familiarity with Unity or C#
* Experience in the games industry


**Our Tech Stack:**
 We run a monolithic game server on Google App Engine, with real-time features on Compute Engine using Netty and FlatBuffers.
   

  

 Languages: Java 21 (plus some C# & Python)
   

  

 Frameworks & Tools: Micronaut, gRPC, Jersey REST, Swagger, Lombok, Jetty, Reactive
   

  

 Protocols: HTTP, FlatBuffers, Protobuf
   

  

 GCP Services: App Engine, Compute Engine, Cloud Run, Cloud Functions, Datastore, Cloud SQL, Memorystore (Redis/Memcache), Pub/Sub, Dataflow, BigQuery, Kubernetes
   

  

 Testing & CI/CD: Gatling, GitHub, GitHub Actions, SonarCloud, Terraform
   

  

**Perks and Benefits:**
* Generous company bonus
* Company mobile phone and contract
* Favorable pension and private health insurance package
* Flexible work hours
* Seasonal kick-offs
* Gym allowance
* Generous learning and development budget
* Monthly After works
* Enhanced parental leaveCompany wide carbon off-setting and CSR initiatives
* Free Swedish lessons (if you wish to learn a new language!)


**At MAG, we want all of our employees to feel valued, appreciated and empowered to bring their true selves to work!**
**Our recruitment processes are designed to prevent bias and discrimination against people regardless of; gender identity or expression, sexual orientation, religion, ethnicity, age, neurodiversity, disability status, or any other aspect.**
**About MAG**
 We are MAG Interactive – a leading mobile developer and publisher of casual mobile games built on a wealth of creativity and passion. We thrive on creating quality experiences that make our players want to come back for more. And Players agree! Combined, the Company’s games have been downloaded more than 350 million times. We create a good times factory with a global reach that continues to grow.
   

  

 We are all part of a creative, positive and trusting environment where everyone has a sense of ownership over their activities and pride in their work. This open and collaborative working culture at MAG is key to our ability to continuously create top notch games.
   

  

 Every game released from MAG Interactive has reached a multi-million player base and reached the #1 position in its category in a large number of countries. Our games have been selected Best of Google Play, Best Of App Store by Apple and have reached the #1 word game spot in over 100 countries.
   

  

 MAG Interactive was founded in Stockholm in 2010.

title: Software Engineer
description:
Tom är Sveriges största tjänsteförmedling för bygg, flytt och städ. Genom vår portfölj av varumärken, som Offerta, IPIS och Svenska Eljouren, skapar vi transparens och tar bort hinder - vi gör det helt enkelt lättare att hitta pålitliga hantverkare.
   

  

 Vi är i startgroparna för att bygga en ny plattform som gör det möjligt för oss att utveckla snabbare, integrera smartare och bygga fantastiska upplevelser för våra kunder. Du blir en del av ett litet team som med stöd av resten av organisationen jobbar nära med kunder och vågar experimentera och styras av vad som fungerar och vad som inte funkar.
   

  

**Din roll**
* Du är drivande i att designa och bygga en ny plattform med både användare och AI-agenter som kunder.
* Du bygger en plattform som möjliggör snabba leveranser och att enkelt kasta det som inte funkar.
* Du bygger features och användarupplevelser för tusentals användare.
* Du strukturerar och bygger API:er, integrationer och MCPs.
* Du arbetar produktnära med kunder, PM:s och designers.


**Vad vi söker**
* Du har tidigare erfarenhet av att arbeta som Software Engineer på ett produktbolag.
* Du har en akademisk examen inom till exempel datavetenskap.
* Du är inte rädd att röra dig mellan frontend och backend och har erfarenhet av att bygga i .NET eller TypeScript med Node.js, och React.
* Du har erfarenhet av att bygga API:er och gränssnitt för modulära system.
* Du är pragmatisk och vet när det är rätt att bygga snabbt och när det är bättre att bygga långsiktigt.
* Du är en prestigelös, initiativtagande lagspelare som hugger i där det krävs och vill förstå varför och vem du bygger för.


**Varför Tom**
* Du får jobba på ett lönsamt, snabbt växande företag samtidigt som du bygger något nytt från grunden.
* Din kod går live snabbt och påverkar tusentals användare direkt.
* Du är en del av ett litet team, utan hierarkier eller tidskrävande godkännandeprocesser.
* Du väljer tillsammans med ditt team vilka verktyg ni behöver för att lyckas.


 För att trivas hos oss tror vi att du är hjälpsam, pragmatisk och värdesätter farten hos ett entreprenöriellt bolag. Det spelar mindre roll om du inte checkar alla boxar eller är i början av din karriär - vi lägger mycket vikt vid initiativförmåga och känsla för vad som gör en bra produkt. På Tom vill vi skapa en kultur där våra användare är i centrum. Vi värdesätter transparens, prestigelöshet och att få saker gjorda.
   

  

 Vi arbetar på kontoret, antingen i Stockholm eller Uppsala. Tjänsten utgår främst från Stockholmskontoret som ligger i nyrenoverade lokaler precis ovanpå centralstationen.
   

  

**Förmåner**
* Generöst friskvårdsbidrag.
* 30 semesterdagar.
* Frukost på kontoret varje vecka.
* Nyrenoverat kontor i centrala Stockholm.


 Bra att veta
   

  

 Tillträde: Snarast eller enligt överenskommelse
   

  

 Arbetstid: Heltid
   

  

 Arbetsort: Stockholm
   

  

 Sista ansökningsdatum: Urval och intervjuer sker löpande.
   

  

 För frågor om tjänsten, kontakta Johan Liedgren via mejl (förnamn.efternamn@tom.se).
   

  

 Välkommen med din ansökan!

title: From Code to Intelligence – We’re Hiring AI Developers
description:
**🚀 Join Our Team VIPAS AB as an AI Developer 🚀**
 Do you want to be part of a journey where technology meets innovation and creativity? At VIPAS AB, we believe that IT consulting is not just about solving problems—it’s about building smarter, more efficient, and future-ready solutions. As a growing company, we are looking for passionate talents like you to join us and shape the next wave of digital transformation.
   

  

**About VIPAS:**
 At VIPAS AB, we go beyond traditional consulting. We deliver tailored solutions that bring real impact, using powerful technologies such as Java, Python, and cloud platforms. Our work extends across diverse fields including software development, DevOps and automation, embedded systems, manufacturing and mechanical engineering, mobile solutions, and project management. With every project, we combine deep technical expertise with a forward-thinking mindset, helping our clients achieve results that are both innovative and sustainable.
   

  

**Job Description:**
 We are looking for a skilled and motivated
 **AI Developer** 
 to join our growing team.
   

  

 In this role, you will design, develop, and deploy AI-powered applications that solve business challenges across different domains, including
 **machine learning, deep learning, natural language processing (NLP), computer vision, and data analytics** 
 .
   

  

 Whether you are an
 **entry-level developer eager to learn** 
 , a
 **mid-level engineer building scalable solutions** 
 , or a
 **senior expert driving innovation and strategy** 
 , you will find the opportunity to grow and make an impact with us.
   

  

**Key Responsibilities:**
* AI/ML Development


 Design, build, and optimize
 **machine learning and deep learning models.**
 Implement algorithms for
 **NLP, computer vision, and predictive analytics** 
 as required.
   

  

 Run experiments, evaluate results, and improve model accuracy and efficiency.
   

  

* Data Engineering & Integration


 Collect, clean, and prepare data for training and inference.
   

  

 Transform data science prototypes into
 **production-ready solutions** 
 .
   

  

 Work with
 **databases, APIs, and Big Data platforms** 
 to ensure scalable pipelines.
   

  

* System Deployment & Maintenance


 Deploy AI models into
 **cloud environments (AWS, Azure, GCP)** 
 or on-premises systems.
   

  

 Integrate AI solutions into existing products and company platforms.
   

  

 Monitor, maintain, and continuously improve AI applications
   

  

* Collaboration & Strategy


 Work closely with
 **data scientists, software engineers, and business stakeholders** 
 .
   

  

 Translate business challenges into AI-driven solutions.
   

  

 Share findings and insights with both technical and non-technical teams.
   

  

* Innovation & Compliance


 Stay updated on the latest
 **AI research, frameworks, and tool**
 Ensure AI applications follow
 **ethical guidelines, data privacy, and regulatory standards** 
 .
   

  

**Qualifications**
 We welcome applications from all levels –
 **junior, mid-level, and senior** 
 . Your responsibilities and scope will be tailored to your experience.
   

  

**Core Skills (all levels):**
* Proficiency in Python (knowledge of Java, C++, or R is a plus).
* Experience with ML/DL frameworks (TensorFlow, PyTorch, Keras, scikit-learn)
* Solid grasp of mathematics, statistics, and algorithms.
* Familiarity with data handling tools (SQL/NoSQL databases, Pandas, Spark, Hadoop).


**Preferred Skills (role-dependent):**
* Experience with cloud platforms (AWS, Azure, GCP).
* Knowledge of MLOps tools (Docker, Kubernetes, MLflow, CI/CD pipelines).
* Exposure to specialized domains such as NLP, computer vision, recommendation systems, or reinforcement learning.
* Strong problem-solving, critical thinking, and communication skills.


**Education:**
* Bachelor’s degree in computer science, Data Science, Engineering, or related field.
* Master’s/PhD is a plus for senior roles.


**Why Join Us?**
 At VIPAS AB, we believe in more than just filling positions—we believe in building futures. Our consultants choose us because we offer security, transparency, and growth opportunities that last. As part of the Teknikföretagen (Almega) collective agreement, you can trust that your career is supported with fair compensation, solid benefits, and long-term stability.
   

  

 What sets us apart is the diversity of the projects we offer. From Telecom to Automotive, from Retail to Banking, our consultants gain hands-on experience across industries, strengthening their skills and expanding their perspectives. Whether you are an experienced developer or just beginning your journey in tech, we create an environment where continuous learning, challenging projects, and leadership opportunities pave the way for your success.
   

  

 Our culture is built on collaboration, curiosity, and integrity. We celebrate innovation, embrace inclusion, and ensure that every voice is valued. At VIPAS AB, you don’t just join a company—you join a community that helps you grow both professionally and personally.
   

  

 If this sounds like the place for you, apply today and take the next step in your career journey with us.
   

  

 📩 For more details, feel free to reach out at
 **pooja@vipas.se**
**Note:** 
 Applicants must hold a valid EU work permit. We review applications on an ongoing basis, so don’t wait—apply now before the opportunity closes.

title: Backend Engineer – Registrations
description:
**Location:** 
 Stockholm (In-office)
   

  

**Company:** 
 360Player
   

  

**Job Type:** 
 Full-time
   

  

**Join the Global Leader in Sports Technology**
 At 360Player, we are redefining how sports clubs operate, develop players, and manage teams. As the world’s leading all-in-one Club Operating System, we help clubs streamline every aspect of their operations—from scheduling and payments to player development and video analytics. Trusted by top clubs such as Rush Soccer, FC Barcelona, and Rafa Nadal Academy, our platform is transforming the sports world. With offices in Stockholm, Barcelona, and the US, we’re looking for passionate, driven individuals to join our team as we continue to grow globally.
   

  

**About The Role**
 We are looking for a
 **Backend Engineer** 
 to join our
 **Registrations team** 
 , focusing on building and maintaining one of the most critical flows in our platform: helping users register, pay, and become members of sports clubs worldwide.
   

  

 In this role, you will work on
 **building services that handle user registration flows, payment connections, and data management tooling** 
 that clubs rely on to manage their communities. You will need to understand how clubs operate globally and design flexible, scalable solutions that can adapt to a wide variety of club needs.
   

  

 Registrations, and form building, are deeply connected to many other domains in our platform, requiring close collaboration with other teams and a clear understanding of user experience and operational requirements to deliver seamless flows that clubs and their members love.
   

  

**What You’ll Do**
* Develop and maintain backend services for the registrations domain within the 360Player platform.
* Build tooling for managing registration data, including forms and data collection workflows.
* Work closely with frontend engineers to ensure smooth, user-friendly registration experiences.
* Collaborate with other backend teams to support connected features and integrations.
* Ensure data integrity, stability, and scalability within the registrations domain.
* Participate in code reviews and contribute to improving backend practices.
* Gather insights from clubs and translate them into technical solutions that support a variety of workflows.


**What We’re Looking For**
* 3+ years of experience in backend development.
* Proficiency in Go (Golang) or strong experience in another language with a willingness to learn Go.
* Solid understanding of relational databases and SQL.
* Experience designing APIs and working with data collection workflows.
* Ability to think from a user perspective and translate workflows into stable backend systems.
* Comfortable working collaboratively with frontend engineers, product managers, and stakeholders.
* Strong attention to detail, especially related to user data management and operational flows.
* Fluent in English, both spoken and written.


**Personal Qualities**
* Structured and proactive with a collaborative mindset.
* Clear communicator who enjoys working with others to find the best solutions.
* Curious and eager to learn, bringing ideas to improve systems and user experiences.
* Enjoys problem-solving and designing systems that are both flexible and scalable.
* Interest in sports or technology that supports communities is a plus.


**Why 360Player?**
* Build features in a system trusted by top sports clubs globally.
* Be part of a fast-growing company with opportunities for professional growth.
* Collaborate with a skilled, supportive, and international team.
* Work on projects that directly impact athletes, coaches, clubs, and their communities.
* Enjoy a flexible, creative, and collaborative work environment where your contributions matter.


**How To Apply**
 If you are excited about backend development and want to help build seamless, impactful registration experiences for sports clubs worldwide, we would love to hear from you.
   

  

 Apply with your
 **r** 
**esume and a short cover letter** 
 explaining why you are interested in this role at 360Player. We review applications on a rolling basis, so don’t wait to apply! Please note that due to summer vacations interviews will be conducted in August and responses may be delayed.

title: Senior Software Engineer
description:
Vi har nu ett nytt behov och söker därför en konsultkollega med nedan kvalifikationer. Tjänsten är en del av vår konsultverksamhet vilket innebär att du blir anställd av oss och arbetar hos kund alt. interna projekt och åtaganden.
   

  

****Din profil (Skall krav)****
* Praktisk problemlösare med strategiskt perspektiv.
* Är bekväm med att tackla en legacy monolit och se möjligheter i en komplex miljö.
* Är beredd att underhålla och ansvara för ett befintligt, affärskritiskt, system
* Skriver ren och hållbar kod i .NET.
* Har god förståelse för systemarkitektur och gillar att optimera processer.
* Har erfarenhet av drift, integrationer och systemunderhåll.
* Kan samarbeta tvärfunktionellt och kommunicera med både tekniska och icke-tekniska roller.


**Meriterande**
* Erfarenhet inom e-handel
* Erfarenhet av ERP-system, lagerhantering eller logistiklösningar.
* Kunskap inom automation, scripting eller DevOps-verktyg.
* Erfarenhet av både molninfrastruktur och on-prem-miljöer.


**Sista ansökningdatum:** 
 23-09-2025
   

  

**Om Deploja**
 Vi sysselsätter idag erfarna konsulter, inom bl.a. Systemutveckling, Test, Arkitektur, IT-Projektledning, IT-Säkerhet.
   

  

 Att jobba på Deploja är något helt annat än att arbeta på ett vanligt konsultbolag – och det är vi riktigt stolta över. Vad är det då som gör oss unika?
   

  

 Vi erbjuder helt enkelt mer än bara hög lön och större frihet, det är bara början. Hos oss hittar du den arbetsmiljö och de möjligheter du förtjänar. Välkommen till Deploja, där gräset faktiskt är grönare!
   

  

**Vi erbjuder dig följande, Valet är ditt!**
 🚀 Spännande uppdrag hos våra många kunder. Vi fokuserar på långsiktiga uppdrag, vilket ger dig möjlighet att skapa värde för kunden samtidigt som du utvecklas själv.
   

  

 🌟 En trygg månadslön – tillsammans bestämmer vi en grundlön baserad på dina uppdrag.
   

  

 🚗 Tjänstebil – vi uppmuntrar dig att välja en elbil för en mer hållbar framtid.
   

  

 💼 Tjänstepension och stora möjligheter till löneväxling.
   

  

 🌴 Semester - Önskar du mer än 30 dagar semester, kanske 60 dagar?
   

  

 🏥 Privat sjukvårdsförsäkring, olycksfallsförsäkring och livförsäkring för ökad trygghet.
   

  

 📚 Kompetensutveckling – du får själv sätta din budget och välja vilka utbildningar du vill delta i.
   

  

 🕑 Livskvalitet - Har du kanske svårt att få ihop pusslet i vardagen och önskar arbeta lite mindre och ändå kunna tjäna lika mycket om inte mer?
   

  

* Vi hanterar ansökningar löpande, med hänsyn till höga arbetstrycket är det extra viktigt med en kort motivering för tjänsten som förklarar hur man möter kraven.

title: QA Engineer
description:
**JOIN US ON OUR JOURNEY TO DIGITIZE EXAMS WORLDWIDE 🌎**
 At Digiexam, we’re more than just a SaaS company. We’re a pioneering force in EdTech innovation, empowering educational institutions worldwide with cutting-edge, reliable exam solutions. Since our start in 2011, we’ve grown into the go-to platform for 350,000+ users across 14 countries, facilitating 18 million+ exams - all while providing an exceptional user experience that sets the industry standard.
   

  

**About The Role**
 Digiexam builds technology for secure and reliable digital exams with device lockdown and LMS integrations used by schools and universities worldwide. Our products combine a cross-platform student application (with full device lockdown) and a modern web platform for authoring, administering, and grading exams.
   

  

 As a QA Engineer you will own product quality end-to-end: break our apps in smart ways, explain exactly how you did it, and help engineers fix the right things fast, while thinking like both a student, an administrator and a red-team tester.
   

  

**SOME OF THE THINGS YOU'LL GET TO DO**
* Deep system-level testing for lockdown & exam flow on Windows and macOS, verifying group profiles/policies, firewall/network configurations, system hardening, logs, and exam workflows both online and offline
* Configure and manage virtual machines and test environments to reproduce, isolate, and verify issues across different OS setups.
* Create gold-standard repros: minimal steps, deterministic data, logs/traces (OS + app), screen/video captures, and environment diffs; file crisp issues developers love.
* Web testing (UI + API): design and execute scenarios against our educator/admin web apps; validate acceptance criteria, RBAC, and business rules; perform API checks in Postman and verify responses/side-effects.
* Threat-model and probe: think like a cheater—attempt bypasses (keyboard shortcuts, windowing, screen capture, network tricks, MDM/profile toggles, kiosk/lock task escapes), and document risk & containment.
* Automation where it pays off: contribute smoke/regression suites (e.g., Playwright for web), build platform scripts/tools for evidence collection, and add pragmatic CI checks.
* Partner across teams: collaborate with Desktop (Rust/Tauri), Backend (Go, gRPC), and Frontend (TypeScript/React) to prioritize issues, tighten specs, and ship high-confidence releases.


**What We Offer**
 You'll become a part of our international team of 20 colleagues. In addition to working in an ambitious SaaS environment within a 100% bootstrapped company, we offer you:
   

  

* Flexible way of working: mix working from home with office collaboration in Slussen with your team 1-2 days a week or fully remote.
* A comprehensive benefits package including fixed salary, pension, and insurances.
* 30 days of vacation and a breakfast buffé every Tuesday.
* A wellness allowance of 5000 SEK and one monthly team gym session during working hours.
* Regular team activities such as After Works, Kick-offs, Summer- and Christmas parties.


**Skills & Experience We'd Love**
* Background as a system administrator on Windows and/or macOS: able to configure and manage operating systems, group policies/profiles, firewall/network rules, system hardening, and detailed log analysis.
* Able to spin up and configure virtual machines and test environments to reliably reproduce, isolate, and verify issues.
* Proven QA experience testing and validating on Windows/macOS platforms.
* Web QA depth: strong exploratory skills, clear test design, UI regression instincts, and solid Postman/API chops (auth flows, headers, schemas, idempotency, error handling).
* Evidence mastery: can convert “it’s broken” into a precise, reproducible defect with artifacts (logs, recordings, repro environments).
* Security mindset: familiarity with pentesting workflows (Burp Suite, mitmproxy, TLS/proxying, endpoint hardening), threat modeling, abuse-case testing—especially around lockdown/anti-cheat.
* Tooling literacy: comfortable with at least one scripting language (PowerShell, Bash, Python, etc.) and modern QA tooling; able to read code and reason about logs/metrics/traces.


**BIG PLUSES (NOT MUST-HAVES)**
* Can read and discuss code in Go, Rust, or TypeScript (even better if you’ve written tests or small tools).
* Experience with Playwright (web), Appium/XCUITest/Espresso/WinAppDriver (mobile/desktop bits where relevant), or platform-specific scripting.
* Knowledge of gRPC, auth flows (OAuth2/OIDC), and LTI 1.3-style LMS integrations.
* Comfort with observability tools (logs/metrics), packet captures (Wireshark), and CI pipelines.
* QA experience on iPadOS and/or Android.


**How We Work**
* Evidence-first QA: clean repros, quick risk calls, and pragmatic automation.
* Security by design: we evaluate features through “could this be abused to cheat?”
* Collaboration > silos: QA partners with engineering and product from spec to release.


**What Success Looks Like In 90 Days**
* You’ve closed high-signal bugs with exemplary repros across two platforms.
* There’s a lean but valuable set of smoke tests running in CI.
* You’ve documented at least one meaningful bypass attempt (and helped us neutralize it).


**READY TO HEAR MORE? 🌟**
 We are eager to get to know you! Apply in just a couple of minutes using your LinkedIn profile or upload your resume and answer a few initial screening questions. We look forward to hearing from you!

title: Mobile Application Developer
company_industry: Information Services and IT System Custom Software Development
description:
